loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  5   mujeres  emprendedoras   y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “MUJERES ACTIVA”.  La Sra. Zonia   de 43  años de edad casada y con 4  hijos, la Sra. Zonia  tiene una pequeña bodega  hace unos  5  años. La Sra. Zonia con la ayuda de su familia a sabido salir adelante tanto así que  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender su productos (azúcar, café, leche, arroz etc.) . Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos y asi   seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Zonia   y  todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado    y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Zonia  está parada se le distingue por su polo de rayas de color verde   Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
A group is composed of 5 entrepreneurial women with a lot of creativity for business - this is what the members of the communal bank "Mujeres Activa" (Active Women) are like.

Zonia is 43 years old and married with 4 children. Zonia has had a small grocery store for 5 years. With the help of her family she has been able to improve her situation, so much so that has been able to earn the loyalty of her clients, which has generated an income for her to cover household costs. In the future she would like to have her own store where she can sell her products (sugar, coffee, milk, rice, etc.). She will invest the loan in purchasing more products and continuing to meet the needs of her clients, thereby enabling her to get ahead. Zonia and all the members are grateful to Kiva for the loan and for the confidence demonstrated in them.

Zonia is pictured standing with the green striped polo. She bids farewell with a promise to meet all of her goals.

loans.use: to purchase products for her small grocery store.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself as focused and determined.  He operates a transport business, in which he transports customers using his motorcycle. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank for storing clean and sufficient water.  That will benefit five family members.  They face a challenge of lack of enough water storage facilities. They will be able to store enough water for domestic use.

 He hopes that in the future, he will sustain himself economically and socially. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of three children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Josephine is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF in order to buy empty shells and other raw materials for her sea-foods culture.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy empty shells and other raw materials for her sea-foods culture.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as determined. She operates a grocery business to earn an income. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank for storing clean and enough water that will benefit five family members. They face a challenge of lack of enough water storage facilities. They will be able to store enough water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will grow and sustain the business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлюде 44 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее старшая дочь совершеннолетние, а трое еще не совершеннолетние. Мавлюда работает Экспертом по займам в ИМОН ИНТЕРНЕШНЛ. Она умная и трудолюбивая женщина, и поэтому она выполняет свою работу на высшем уровне. Ее муж занимается ремонтом автомашин. Ее дочь Марджона успешно окончила среднюю школу и поступила в Филиал Национального исследовательского технологического университета «МИСиС» по специальности экономиста. Мавлюда должна оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери в университете. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 750 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mavluda is 44 years old. She is married and raising four children. Her eldest daughter is an adult, while the other three are not yet adults. 

Mavluda works as a Loan Expert at IMON International. She is a smart and hardworking woman and therefore she carries out her work at the highest standard. Her husband works with repairing vehicles. Her daughter Mardjona has successfully finished high school and started at a branch of the National Research Technological University "MISA", specializing in economics. 

Mavluda needs to pay her daughter's tuition at the university. She requests a loan in the amount of 750 US dollar. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter’s education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three cattle and two milk cows.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a woman of thirty three years, married to Joseph and a mother of two children. She does dairy farming in Kiambaa in the outskirts of Limuru town; she has been in this business for twelve years now. Gladys earns a monthly income of fifty five thousand shillings.

This will be Gladys' third loan with KADET LTD; she plans to use the entire loan to buy animal feed in bulk; she also wants to start poultry keeping in future.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds in bulk

loans.name: Fakhra

texts.en:
Fakhra is age 50.  Her husband has grown old and stays at home. Her husband mostly remains sick, and most of the income is spent on his treatment. 

She is the mother of five children.  Two of her sons are living separately. Her other son lives with his parents, and bears all the household and medical expenses. Fakhra and her husband are fully dependent upon their son.  He works over a press machine and manufactures buckles and clips for school bags and shoes. He is doing it very efficiently, and succeded in getting a huge order for manufacturing. Although, he has some savings to buy steel, the amount he has is somewhat less than needed for getting this contract.

Fakhra knows that through this contract, her son will be able to earn more profit than earlier. Therefore, she requested a loan for her son, so that he would be able to buy pieces of steel for manufacturing. 

Fakhra wants to see her husband hale and hearty.  She will use the profit amount for the better treatment of her husband.

loans.use: to buy pieces of steel for manufacturing buckles and clips to sell.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 24-year-old married woman living with her husband in Lahore. She married her husband 2 years ago but they still do not have any children. Her husband is an automobile electrician. Bushra is therefore requesting a loan for her husband so that he can buy electrical goods such as wires, bulbs, and horns. With the loan proceeds, she hopes that she and her husband can improve their living standards. In the future, she would like to have a child. Bushra thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase electrical goods (e.g., wires, bulbs, and horns) that were stolen

loans.name: Nazmeen

texts.en:
Nazmeen is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of 2 children and equally responsible for all of them. She belongs to an ultra poor family which is why she cannot afford the educational expenses of all her children. One of her sons goes to the primary school. 

Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he provides the services of welding. He also provides door to door services to his customers. Due to increase in the price of iron he is unable to buy sufficient welding material such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc. to carry on his business. To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise he needs some capital to buy welding material.

Nazmeen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he would be able to buy material to carry on his business. Nazmeen is very glad and thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy welding material.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 30 years old from Nakuru. She is married to Nnadi who is a business man and they have 3 kids aged 11, 8 and 3 years old.

She has a general store which consists of mobile money transfer services, a kiosk and a green grocer and she has been running this business for the past 3 years. She has applied for a loan of KES 50,000 from Kadet Ltd which is her third one, and she intends to use it for buying more stock like sweets, vegetables and add float for her general store. 

Sylvia's expected profits will be used for repaying her loan to Kadet Ltd and her hopes and dreams for the future is to improve her business and to better the living standards for her family.

loans.use: To add stock to her general store

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a 43-year-old married woman. She and her husband have five children, two of whom are in school.

Angela is in the agricultural business. Specifically, she raises pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this line of business for five years.

On 15 prior occasions, Angela borrowed from NWTF to sustain her business operations. She is now requesting another loan from NWTF, this time in the amount of 16,000 PHP, to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Angela would like to save money to expand her business and to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and their three children. Her husband owns a small jewelry shop, where he sells bracelets, bangles, lockets, necklaces, rings, and earrings. He displays his jewelry under a glass case to attract customers.

Her husband has only one source of income, which he uses to pay for their living expenses (such as utility bills), children's school fees, and household expenses. Their house is in poor condition, so he wants to improve their living situation.

Nabeela and her husband realize that they have to generate more income to pay for the construction that would be needed for their house. Therefore, Nabeela requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can increase his inventory and ultimately sell more jewelry. She hopes that they will be able to work on the house soon to improve the family's living standards. Nabeela is very thankful for BRAC Pakistan because they provided her with hope to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: To expand a jewelry business by purchasing additional jewelry (e.g., bracelets, bangles, lockets, necklaces, rings, and earrings).

loans.name: Seryozha

texts.en:
Seryozha is from the village Malishka, where he lives with his wife and two children (ages 3 and 4). Seryozha has been running his farm for many years. He keeps 4 cows and 8 chickens, as well as owns a plot of land where he grows different types of tree (peach, apricot, nut, apple, and pear). Seryozha is very skilled in the farming business and works hard to gather a good harvest. Seryozha's wife takes care of their children and at the same time helps her husband with the farming business.

Seryozha feels very responsible to take care of his family’s living conditions so he would like to enlarge his farm. By applying for this loan, Seryozha wants to purchase 2 oxen and enlarge the number of livestock. He also wants to purchase fertilizer which is very important for successful land cultivation. Seryozha hopes that Kiva lenders will support him to enlarge his farm and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for 2 oxen and fertilizer

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 29 years old, married and blessed with two children aged 16 and 17 years respectively. She runs a hotel, and she has been in this business for five years. Sally's monthly income from the business is KES 45000.

She is borrowing KES 30000 to buy stocks of flour for her hotel.  She plans to build rental houses with the anticipated profit. This is her first loan from KADET.

Sally's desire is to lead a successful life as her children prosper.

loans.use: to buy stocks of flour for her hotel

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
This is Rosalina. Her previous loan was a big help for her business. She was able to buy the supplies and materials needed for her metals business. Her income from that loan also helped to pay for her children's education and for their family's living expenses. She also has a trading business where she buys and sells t-shirts. She and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 51,000 PHP loan so that she can buy supplies such as glass, stainless steel, and other materials used in her business. Profits from the business help her cover her family's daily living expenses and her children's educational expenses. She thanks all lenders for their support.

Rosalina dreams of having her own stall and stockroom and hopes that her children will have a good future. She meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials and supplies (e.g., glass and stainless steel) used in her business

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 38-year-old married man. He and his wife have four children.

For the last three years, he has earned a living by selling milk in Malindi. He earns approximately 26,000 KES per month from his business operations.

Thomas was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is now applying for his fourth loan. He is seeking 70,000 KES to buy additional dairy equipment and goods for his business, such as milk cans, milking gloves, water cans for the cows to drink from, and feed for the cows. He will use the profits that he expects to generate as a result of the loan to pay for his children's school fees and to expand his farming activities. Thomas' goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing his income so as to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials and goods for his dairy business (e.g., milk and water cans, milking gloves, and feed)

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila’s husband is a kind and hard-working person. He has grown old now and does not have as much working capacity as he was young. Her husband is a poor person but loves his family very much. He tries to make sure that his family does not have any needs left unfulfilled, so he keeps on with his carpentry work in old age. He is involved in his own business to have a regular income in the family.  Her husband is involved in manufacturing and selling furniture, such as tables, chairs, beds, etc. He started this business over 35 years ago. 

Jamila does not work; she stays at home and most of the days she gets sick. She has previously obtained loans for business; she is adding a second loan for her selection of handmade furniture. Today, her husband has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for her, but her family's needs are increasing day by day and he needs to earn more money. Now her husband wants to buy more raw materials for making furniture in order to expand his business. This is why she came to BRAC Pakistan and wishes to obtain a loan to buy raw materials for marking furniture. 

Jamila hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for her business as well as for her family. She says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy raw material for making furniture.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 48 years old, married and not well. She suffers from chronic illnesses that require medication, the cost of which eats into their income. She and her husband have grown old, and they are worried about their future.

Zahida’s husband sells flour for an income. He buys wheat and with the help of his son, grinds it and packs the flour into sacks to sell. Recently the wheat grinder belt broke during operation, which stopped production.

Zahida is applying for a 25,000 PKR loan through BRAC Pakistan so her husband can buy a new belt and more stocks of wheat. The grinding machine is their only source of income and so her husband wants to repair it immediately.

Zahida hopes that they will save a sufficient amount of money so they can pass through life smoothly.

loans.use: buy a new grinding machine belt and more wheat

loans.name: Gayurbek

texts.ru: Гаюрбек хороший мастер. Он трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и имеет 4 детей. Его жена домохозяйка и поэтому Гаюрбек является основным кормильцем в семье. Он более 10 лет занимается предоставлением услуги сварщика. Гаюрбек работает честно и имеет своих клиентов. Он изготавливает ворота и продает свою продукцию местным жителям. Гаюрбек хочет развевать свой бизнес и получать больше дохода. Для развития бизнеса он нуждается в машине. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для покупки автомашины. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Gayurbek is a good craftsman. He is a hardworking and purposeful man. He is married and has four children. His wife is a housewife and therefore Gayurbek is the only breadwinner in the family. For more than 10 years he has provided a welding service. 

Gayurbek does honest work and has his own customers. He produces gates and sells his products to the local residents. Gayurbek would like to develop his business and get a larger income. To develop the business, he needs a vehicle. He requests a loan in the amount of 1,500 US dollar to purchase a car. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To purchase a car to develop his welding service

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Rosa de Lima está iniciando este ciclo con mucho entusiasmo de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando sus vidas. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de las integrantes están con ingresos muy escasos, pero esforzándose por mejorar.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Pablina, es una de las integrantes,  ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, y con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y está ayudando a su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que sabe que la única forma de salir adelante es por medio de su sacrificio.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras y frutas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas y dar a su familia lo que necesitan para el día a día.
texts.en:
The group called “Santa Rosa de Lima” is starting this loan cycle with great enthusiasm because they want to continue growing and improving their lives. The members have taken a poverty elimination survey, which indicated that three of them have very scarce incomes. However, they are striving to improve.

One of the members is Sra. Pablina, who sells fruits and vegetables. With great effort, she is moving forward and helping her family. Pablina is a hardworking person who knows that the only way to succeed is through sacrifice. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of vegetables and fruits in order to continue her sales and provide for her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les cinq femmes du groupe benkola ont  en moyenne 40 ans et 7  enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de N’GOLOFANASSO  dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles le commerce d’articles divers. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont adhéré  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1er   prêt solidaire.
Madame, Kotimi (debout au milieu sur la  photo) excelle dans la vente de savons  depuis plus de 9 ans et elle est  très sollicitée dans le village  et ses environnants, puisse qu’il ya jamais de rupture chez elle. Selon ses clients qui sont majoritairement constitues de femmes. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs de savons kabakourouni de 50 morceaux chacun frais 2 cartons de  savons BT de 25 morceaux    elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame Kotimi  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 9000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married in traditional extended families, the five women who make up this Benkola group have an average age of 40 and on average 7 children. They all live in the village of  N’golofanasso in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of Mali) and met each other through ties of neighborhood and kinship. They all sell various merchandise. With the intention of growing their working capital, the members of the group joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso  and they are on their first solidarity loan. 

Madame Kotimi (standing in the middle of the photo) has excelled in the sale of soap for more than nine years now, and she is much in demand in the village and its surroundings since she never runs short of merchandise, according to her customers, who are mostly women. She intends to use her loan to buy three sacks of 'kabakourouni' soap, 50 bars and two cases of BT soap with 25 bars. She buys her soaps in San. She sells retail, for cash or credit to a clientele composed of women and men. 

With this loan, Madame Kotimi  hopes to make an average monthly profit of 9,000 f CFA which will be used to reinvest in her business and to help her spouse to cover the needs of the household.

loans.use: to buy sacks of soap for resale

loans.name: Buenos Aires Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BUENOS AIRES”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Isabel es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verdura, tienda de barrio, tejido de chompas, venta de frutas, venta de chicharron (comida boliviana).

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Isabel es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la asesora que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de mecánica; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente su esposo, ya que el contaba con experiencia en el trabajo del rubro.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lubricante) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank ‘Buenos Aires’ will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II regional office. It is composed of eight members and is governed by a board of directors of which Isabel is president. The businesses carried out by the members of the bank are diverse and include selling vegetables, running a neighborhood store, knitting sweaters, selling fruit, and selling chicharron (a Bolivian food). 

The loan Isabel will take out will benefit small micro-businesses of which she is a member. She indicates that five months ago she became a member of Pro Mujer after she was invited to join by one of the institution’s promoters who came to visit her. Currently, she runs a mechanic shop. She says that she started this business together with her husband since he had experience in the field. 

Isabel is taking this loan out to increase capital. She will buy lubricant from wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto and afterwards she will resell it in her shop. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family since she is married and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training on health and the loans.

loans.use: to buy lubricant.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. Her husband provides public transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses.

The rickshaw now needs some maintenance to keep it running smoothly. For this reason Rehana is applying for a 25,000 PKR loan through BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and have some work done on the rickshaw’s engine. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better service for his passengers.

Rehana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and bring positive changes to his business. She is very thankful for Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new tires and have work done on her husband's rickshaw’s engine.

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en:
Alimatu is 40 years old and married with three children between the ages of eight years and 16 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo, rural Western Area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to earn her daily living. 

She's been in this business since just after she got married, and sells fish within her community. She says that at present she is facing insufficient capital to run her business

Alimatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take good care of her family. 

In the future, she would like to become a fish supplier. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Allans José

texts.es:
El señor Allans  es un hombre ejemplar,  actualmente se desempeña como transportista de carga pesada, efectuando  recorrido por todos los  departamentos del país,  ya que de manera familiar esta actividad desde hace varios años, es  casado, con 2 hijos a los que les está brindando todo el apoyo  para su desarrollo académico.

 actualmente tiene una necesidad  como es la de mejorar las llantas de sus camiones, por eso visito ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un financiamiento para utilizarlo en la compra de  llantas y de esa manera mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida y de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Allans is an exemplary gentleman. He currently works as a heavy cargo transporter, which requires him to travel to all of the departments within the country. Allans has been supporting his family in this manner for several years. He is married and providing his two children with everything they need for their academic development.

Allans currently needs to replace the tires on his trucks. For this reason, he came to CEPRODEL to take advantage of a loan in order to buy tires. As a result, he will be able to improve his conditions and his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy tires for his trucks.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en: Salina is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with seven children aged 21,18,16,14,12,10 and 8 years respectively. She has been running a shop for seven years and her monthly income is 10,000 KES. She has borrowed a loan of 10,000 KES with KADET which she will use to add to the stock in her shop. She will use the anticipated profit to open up another business. This is her first loan with KADET. She hopes and dreams to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business like sugar, tea leaves and other items.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson does livestock selling business in Kangundo town. He is 65 years old, married, and has four children. He has been in this business for 35 years and it has enabled him to provide for the needs of his family.

This being his third loan term, he plans to buy more cattle to sell. He will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to grow his business and become a successful livestock trader.

loans.use: To buy cattle to resell.

loans.name: Salam Al-Baidha Group

texts.en:
The Salam Al-Baidha group consists of four women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They are applying for a loan of 80,000 YER through Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Salam, 45, started working as a seamstress to assist her husband in providing for her children. She is a responsible individual who possesses many values such as sincerity and honesty. She has gained the respect of her neighbors and family members and is eager to excel.

Salam will use her portion of this loan to buy fabric to help herself sew and sell dresses, shirts, etc. for her clients. She hopes to open a sewing shop and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more fabric for her sewing business

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive  junto con su familia en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 59 años de edad, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la enseñanza, ella es profesora en uno de los colegios de la ciudad de Paucartambo pues es una excelente profesora,  ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Llapallanchis Llankasunchis” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para la educación de sus hijos y gastos de alimentación, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Sabina was born in the city of Paucartambo and still lives there with her family.  She is 59 years old and a hardworking and enterprising person.  Sabina presses forward along with her family with great effort in her work.  Her main occupation is teaching since she is an instructor at one of the schools in the city of Paucartambo.  Sabina is an excellent teacher and a responsible person.  It was for these reasons that she was invited to participate in the Communal Bank known as “Llapallanchis Llankasunchis”.  

Sabina is taking this opportunity to request a loan to pay for her children’s education and the cost of feeding them.  She is grateful for and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s education and the cost of feeding them.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a married man, age 34 years. His spouse is called Caroline, and they are blessed with three children, ages 8, 7 and 6 years respectively.

Evans has been operating a hotel (restaurant) business for three years with a monthly income is KES 6,000.

This is his third loan term with Kadet Ltd. He is requesting a loan of KES 60,000, which he will use to purchase more food stock for the hotel business. The anticipated profit he earns will be used to buy a plot and build rental houses. The previous loan of KES 50,000 was paid successfully.

His hope and dream is to be stable in life and prosper.

loans.use: To purchase more food stock stock for hotel business.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a married man with six children; the family lives in Nyarukiika-Rukiiri. He is hard working and wants to provide the best for his family.

In addition to selling coffee, Godfrey is a distiller who grows bananas to make a local brew, his main source of income. He is applying for a 1,500,000 UGX loan through UGAFODE to buy organic fertilizers for his banana plantation. He wants to increase his plantation’s yield so he can produce more banana brew.

Godfrey wants to thank UGAFODE for giving him a loan. No bank would be interested in giving him a loan in his rural setting otherwise.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer for his plantation

loans.name: Nancy Rosaliny

texts.es:
Nancy de 30 años de edad, su comaleño de vida se dedica a trabajar como ayudante de albañil, ambos se esfuerzan  por  darle una excelente calidad de vida a su hija quien esta estudiando séptimo grado en el Centro Escolar de la comunidad, desde muy pequeña la cliente se ha esforzado por trabajar muy duro y de esta manera ha podido obtener su vivienda y el sustento diario de todos los días; en su casa solo vive con su compañero de vida y con su hija.

Ella se dedica a trabajar como domestica desde hace 15 años, comenzó donde una tía, hoy en día esta trabajando en otra casa donde cuenta con  6 años laborando ahí, para llegar a este lugar tiene que trasladarse en autobús durante unos 15 minutos y caminar a donde le toma otros 10 minutos, cuando regresa de su trabajo tiene que realizar los quehaceres de su hogar, donde la esperan su compañero de vida y su hija, ya que su trabajo es de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm no tiene mucho tiempo para pasar con su familia; pero al final ella siente que este esfuerzo es recompensado, por la unión que tienen como familia.

Con el crédito  comprara: cemento, arena, hierro, bloques; para la construcción de una habitación; ya que la casa donde vive no tiene mucha privacidad, su vida mejorara porqué se sentirá mas segura por las noches y el precio de compra será mas bajo por la cantidad que comprara tendrá un pequeño margen de descuento.

En un futuro desea hacer mas grande su vivienda, para que puedan vivir mas cómodamente y procrear otro bebe, tanto ella como su compañero de vida quieren que su hija culmine todos sus estudios y se guíe por el camino correcto, que todos los esfuerzos que están realizando tengan sus frutos en un futuro muy cercano.
texts.en:
Nancy is 30 years old.  Her life partner works as an assistant bricklayer.  Both of them put forth great effort in order to give their daughter, who is in the seventh grade at the community school center, an excellent quality of life.  Ever since she was very little, Nancy has put forth effort to work very hard.  This way she has been able to get her house and her daily sustenance.  She lives in her house with her life partner and her daughter.

She has been working as a domestic employee for 15 years.  She started where her aunt was, and now she is working in another house, where she has worked for six years.  In order to get there she has to travel for 15 minutes by bus and walk for another 10 minutes.  When she comes home from work, where her life partner and daughter are waiting for her, she has to do the household chores.  Because her work is from 7:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m., she does not have a lot of time to spend with her family.  However, in the end she feels that this effort if rewarded by the unity that they have as a family. 

She will use the loan to buy sand, iron, and cement blocks in order to build a room.  This is because the house where she lives does not have much privacy.  Her life will improve because she will feel safer at night.  The purchase price will be lower because buying in quantity will give her a small discount.

In the future she wishes to make her house bigger so that they are able to live more comfortably and have another baby.  She and her life partner want their daughter to finish her education and be guided down the right path.  They want all of their efforts to bear fruit in the very near future.

loans.use: to buy sand, iron, and cement blocks in order to build a room.

loans.name: Kotognontala (L’Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Kotognontala est un regroupement de femmes Darsalam I de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien, et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans, sont mariées et au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les habits, les cosmétiques, la restauration et divers article. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. 
Salimata  est un membre du groupe Kotognontala debout au milieu.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des habillements de toutes sortes,  des tasses super et glacières.  Elle se procure de ces articles  à Koutiala. Elle vend ces articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kotognontala comptent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen de 127 500 CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Salimata compte réaliser  180 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Kotognontala is a group of women from Darsalam 1 near Koutiala who know each other well and who live in big traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They have an average age of 39, are married, and on average have three children. 

This group of women sell various articles such as clothing, cosmetics, cooked food, etc. To grow the size of their activities, the members decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their fifth group loan. 

Salimata  is the member of the Kotognontala group  who is standing in the middle. She intends to use her loan to buy clothing of all sorts, basins, and ice chests. She gets these items in Koutiala. She sells her goods retail and for cash, out of her house and at the market to a varied clientele. Whereas the other members of the  Kotognontala group expect to make a profit of 127,000 CFA each during this loan term, Mme Salimata expects to make 180,000 f CFA. 

Besides reimbursing the loan, she will use part of the income to cover personal expenses and part to grow her working capital.

loans.use: to buy clothing of all sorts, basins, and ice chests for resale.

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Amistad está en su ciclo número dos del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Es un grupo que se destaca por las ganas de trabajar que tienen, ya que son mujeres muy trabajadoras.
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas. Una integrante es Severiana, quien es peluquera y solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, y demás insumos para poder seguir con su buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called “Amistad” (Friendship) is in its second loan cycle as part of the Women’s Committee Program, in which all of the members are working and helping one another move forward.  The members of this group are known for their willingness to work since they are very industrious women.  This committee is from the city of San Lorenzo and they have established promoting the growth of each member as their main objective.  

One of the members is Severiana, who is a beautician.  She is requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchase of shampoo, rinses, and other supplies that will enable her to continue providing good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, and other supplies.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina, 41, works hard to provide for her family. She is married and has three children.

For the past 23 years Josefina has run a sari sari, or general store, in the Philippines. She also has a meat shop.

Josefina has previously borrowed and repaid fourteen loans from NWTF. She is now applying for a 40,000 PHP loan to buy more stock to sell.

Josefina aspires to save enough money to rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her sari sari

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es: Hortensia, de 47 años es una mujer feliz y casada con Nicolás con quien tenia 3 hijos pero uno de ellos falleció y ahora solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia. Hortensia se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, todos los días y de manera constante sale a cuidar de sus sembríos, además de las vacas, cerdos y ovejas que posee, comenta que gracias a ello puede mejorar sus ingresos, pues tiene a sus hijos estudiando en otra ciudad, a donde ella manda un dinero mensual para sacar adelante a su familia. Comenta que con la leche que obtiene de las vacas de manera semanal puede solventar los principales gastos del hogar, mientras que las cosechas de los alimentos, le sirven para ahorrar y pensar en mejorar su condición de vida. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de sus animales y aumentar su ganado. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por lo espera continuar con su apoyo financiero, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Hortensia, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de comida balanceada para nutrir a sus vacas.
texts.en:
Hortensia, age 47, is a happy woman, and she is married to Nicolás.  They had three children, but one of them died.  She now lives with her two children in her own house.  Hortensia works with livestock and agriculture.  Every day she regularly goes to take care of her plants and the cows, pigs, and sheep that she has.  She says that thanks to this, she is is able to improve her income.  Her children go to school in another city where she sends money monthly in order to get her family ahead.

She says that with the milk that she gets weekly from the cows she is able to pay the primary household expenses.  The food harvests are used for savings, and she plans to improve her living conditions.

She now wishes to improve the quality of her animals and to increase her livestock.  This is her first loan with Kiva.  She hopes to continue with Kiva's financial support.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  Hortensia will use the 1,000 soles to buy balanced feed to nourish her cows.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to nourish her cows.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
From Nakuru, Rebecca is 25 years old and has two children aged eleven months and six years. She is married to Jonah who works to support the family.

For the past two years Rebecca has been in the motorcycle transport business. Her monthly income at present is 10,500 KES. She is applying for a 20,000 KES loan through KADET to use to add to her savings and buy another motorcycle.

Rebecca’s ambition is to be successful in her business and have a healthy family.

loans.use: to add to her savings and buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Milagros Virginia

texts.es:
Milagros tiene 48 años, con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro pudo iniciar su negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas, agua embotellada y cervezas y con este negocio ha podido solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y tiene muchas ganas de mejorar cada día.

Milagros está muy agradecida con el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que podrá comprar una congeladora para su negocio y de esta manera podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor atención y conservar mejor sus productos, así mejorar sus ingresos y seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una tienda mayorista”.
texts.en:
Milagros is 48, with much effort and savings, she was able to start her business of selling drinks, pop, bottled water and beer, wit this business she has been able to cover her home expenses, she is getting ahead because she is very responsible and really wants to improve each day.

Milagros is very thankful for the support provided by the Kiva lenders because this will allow her to buy a refrigerator for hes business to provide her customers with better services and keep her products in better condition and this way increase her income, she will continue to fight for her dream: "to have a wholesale store".

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 31-year-old lady from Suna South located in Migori County, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Christopher, and she supports 3 people in her family.

Esther has a wind(posho) mill for grinding millet,maize and other cereals. She also sells cereals at her milling place, which she has been doing for the last four years.Esther earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.

Esther is taking her forth loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to expand her business by purchasing more cereals for grinding as well as cereals for selling. She will also use the anticipated profits to grow her business by purchasing an extra posho mill.

Her dream is to prosper as she continually expands.

loans.use: to expand the business by purchasing more cereals for grinding, cereals for selling and an extra posho mill.

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
El Sr. Benigno tiene 48 años, el tiene un hijo que está viviendo con la madre, él le ayuda económicamente para que no le falta nada y el día de mañana pueda ser un joven de bien.
Don Benigno empezó con este trabajo hace 31 años, aproximadamente desde el año: 1.982, Él le ayudaba siempre a su padre en la carpintería, es por eso que tiene conocimientos para fabricar todo tipo de muebles y aberturas para viviendas, hace mucho tiempo ya que él se dedica en forma independiente a la carpintería, y en la actualidad el tiene personas con quien está comercializando sus productos.
Este crédito le servirá para comprar más materia prima madera, que aumentara su producción y podrá seguir trabajando
texts.en:
Sr. Benigno is 48 years old and has a son who is living with his mother.  He provides financial support so that his son lacks nothing and can grow up to be a fine young person someday.  

Don Benigno began in this line of work in 1982, approximately 31 years ago.  He always helped his father with his carpentry jobs, which explains why he has the knowledge for making all types of furniture and doors for houses.  Benigno has been in this trade for a long time and works independently as a carpenter.  He currently has people who buy his products.  

This loan will be used to buy more wood, which will allow him to increase production and continue working.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
Olga tiene 40 años y desde joven aprendió a confeccionar prendas, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de costura. Con su pequeño negocio Olga puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, es por ello que siempre atiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y responsabilidad, ya que de ello depende que ella siga creciendo.

Olga está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo podrá comprar más telas, mejorar su pequeño espacio de negocio y poder arreglar su máquina de coser; de esta manera seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un gran taller de confecciones”.
texts.en:
Olga is 40 and learned to sew articles of clothing from a young age. This is how, with a great deal of effort, she managed to start her sewing business. With her small business Olga can pay for the household expenses. So she always serves her customers with great friendliness and responsibility, as she depends on this to continue growing. 

Olga is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to their great support she will be able to buy more fabric, improve her small workspace, and be able to fix her sewing machine. In this way she will be able to continue striving to make her greatest dream a reality: "To have a large sewing workshop".

loans.use: To run her business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 37 years old from Nakuru. She is married and has three children ages 12, 8, and 4. 

She has a milk bar i.e she is a milk vendor and she has been running this business for the past 4 years. She has applied for a loan of Kshs 40,000  from KADET LTD and she intends to use it for boosting her milk vending business. 

In the future, she hopes to buy a pickup that she can use in transportation of milk from dairy farmers to her dairy.

loans.use: to boost her milk-vending business by purchasing a pickup that she can use to transport milk from dairy farmers to her dairy.

loans.name: Zephania

texts.en:
Zephania is 25 years old and is married. He has two children, both of whom are in school.

He is a farmer and has been one for the past 9 years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd to enable him to buy fertilizer and seedlings for use on his farm.

He hopes to be the leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is 29 years old and is from Homabay region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He supports four people in his family. He is married to Moureen, who is a businesswoman and supports the family by providing little income. He has two children who are 3 years old and 6 years old.

Kevin is a carpenter and he makes furniture. He has been doing this for the past four years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. He has applied for his second loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to boost the business. His dream is to be a successful businessman and take care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more timber.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a married man aged 51 years old and supports nine members of his family.  His children are aged between 17 and 1 years old. Jonathan sells cereals in Kiplombe and has been in the business for a period of 10 years, earning an income of Kes 17,000.

He is now requesting his 6th loan of KES 105,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase more stock of dried maize and beans for resale.  The anticipated profit will be used to purchase a plot of land and develop it.

His dream is to invest and own several assets.

loans.use: To purchase dried maize and beans

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 62-year-old mother from Chavakali which is located in the Western part of Kenya. She supports six people in her family. She is married to Manaseh, who is a small-scale farmer.

Elizabeth sells charcoal in her local market, a business she has been doing for the last 30 years, and generates a monthly income of KES 5000. She has applied for her first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more stocks of charcoal for re-sale at a profit.This will help expand the business.

Elizabeth will use the anticipated profit to sell charcoal in bulk and not in small portions as she used to before.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of charcoal for re-sale at a profit.

loans.name: Subainatu

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Subainatu .  She is married and has one child, aged 2 years. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because he is her younger brother.  

In 2010, Subainatu established her essential drugs (blood syrups etc.) business. She began her business because she had been doing business while she was in college. As a trained nurse, she decided to open a pharmacy. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,080,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Subainatu requires a loan in order to buy blood tonic, syrups, ciprofloxacin, ampiclox, and bi-cortein. 

In the future, Subainatu plans to have an international business and to provide quality education for her child. This loan will help to improve her business. 

She is a hardworking businesswoman. She thanks you for providing financial support for her business.

loans.use: to buy blood tonic, syrups, ciprofloxacin, ampiclox, and bi-cortein.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Don Julio vive con su esposa  y con sus dos hijas, es una persona que se le considera muy trabajador y además responsable, el se dedica a la carpintería desde hace varios años  su negocio lo tienen ubicado en su lugar de residencia,  elabora sillas, bancos, puertas, juegos de sala y comedor, roperos, gabeteros, etc. tiene mucha clientela por su buen Trabajo y los buenos precios también vende sus productos con comerciales de la zona donde él reside, Julio esta solicita un crédito  para poder hacer la compra de materiales para su labor como: maderas, barniz, clavos, pegamento, telas, etc. y de esa manera generarle mayores ganancias y una mejor calidad de vida para el y su familia.
texts.en: Julio lives with his wife and two daughters and he is considered to be a hardworking and responsible person.  He has been a carpenter for many years and runs his business out of his home.  He makes chairs, benches, doors, living room and dining room sets, clothing cabinets, etc.  He has many customers because he does good work and good prices.  He also sells to merchants in his area.  Julio is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as lumber, varnish, nails, glue, fabric, etc.  In this way he can increase his earnings and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín tiene 24 años, está casado con Kelly y tiene un hijo pequeño, juntos viven en una casa alquilada y de material rústico. Efraín es un hombre cuyos logros los obtuvo a base de empeño. Con el apoyo de su pareja, Hace varios años heredó unos terrenos de cultivos. Actualmente esos terrenos los sigue trabajando, cultivando papas, arvejas, maíz entre otros. En todos sus años como agricultor aprendió estrategias para aumentar su producción en la misma extensión de terrenos, por ejemplo con las técnicas de irrigación, de fertilización, entre otras.  “El problema es cuando las heladas malogran las plantas, por eso ya sé que productos cultivar en esos meses”, dice. Para más adelante, piensa adquirir más terrenos, y así aumentar su producción. Ahora sembrará arvejas, por ello requiere de su ayuda. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Efraín, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Efrain is 24 years old, married to Kelly, and they have one young son.  They live together in a rented house made of rustic materials.  Efrain is a man whose achievements came from his efforts and his wife’s encouragement.  A few years ago he inherited some farmland and he continues to work it, raising potatoes, peas, corn, and other things.  Over the years as a farmer he learned ways to increase his production on the same land, for example through irrigation, fertilization, and other things.  “The problem comes when the frost damages the plants, so I already know which crops to raise during those months,” he says.  He wants to acquire more land in the future and increase his production, but he needs help.   This will be his second Kiva loan and he is grateful for the financial support he is getting to help him move ahead.  He is also committed to making his payments on time.  Efrain will use the S/ 2,000 to buy compost to feed his plants.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Juana Isidra

texts.es: Este cliente es casada, tiene cinco hijos,ella trabaja en el Mercado desde hace 21 Años, inicia sus labores del día desde las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 2 de la tarde, el negocio lo comenzo con un pequeño capital que ahorraba su esposo, el préstamo que está solitando lo necesita para adquirir mercadería y de esta manera surtir un poco más su negocio.
texts.en: This member is married and has five children.  She has been working in the market for 21 years and begins working at 6:00 am and finishes at 2:00 pm.  She started the business with a small amount of money that her husband had saved up.  She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise so she can stock her business little by little.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: Doña Maria  vive con  su esposo y sus dos hijas  de 23 y 22 años de edad en casa propia, la cliente posee un taller de costura desde hace varios años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que ella realiza es excelente y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles; doña María  está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar telas, hilos, agujas, zippers  y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y asi el  podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria lives with her husband and two daughters, ages 23 and 22.  She has had a sewing shop for several years and is a hardworking and responsible woman who makes different types of clothing.  Lately she has had many customers because her work is of excellent quality and she sells it at affordable prices.  Maria is asking for this loan so she can buy thread, needles, zippers, and everything related to sewing, so she can continue meeting her customers’ needs and be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Los Dinamicos De San Isidro De Chicon Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS DINAMICOS DE SAN ISIDRO DE CHICON”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lidia ella es casada y tiene 50 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de chicha y cerveza, la socia vende la chicha que es una bebida a base de maíz, la socia tiene una pequeña picantería, la socia ya tiene en este negocio 20 años y le va muy bien, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su local para que pueda vender la chicha y cerveza. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cerveza y chicha.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the “LOS DINAMICOS DE SAN ISIDRO DE CHICON” communal bank, located in the Urubamba district; part of the Urubamba province and Cusco department.

Lidia is 50 years old, married, and has five children.  She has a chicha and beer business.  Chicha is fermented corn beverage.  She also has a small restaurant and has had it for 20 years.  Things are going well for her businesses and she gets her children ahead through them.  Her dream is to expand her shop so she can sell more beer and chicha, and is asking for a loan to buy more.

The other members sell fruit, animals, have grocery stores, or farm.

[Lidia] is grateful to those who form part of this dream and she promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

location.town: Comunidad de san isidro de chicon-Urubamba

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is a married mother of five children aged 18, 15, 9, 6 and 2 years, four of whom attend school. Together with her husband, she is in charge of paying school fees and taking care of the family. Robinah operates a small restaurant in the town of Kagadi; her major challenge are customers who eat food on credit with no intention of paying back what they owe. 


Robinah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 shillings to buy construction materials to complete her home. She hopes to complete this house because the one they are currently occupying is too small as the family continues to expand. Robinah expects to pay back the loan in small installments, using the proceeds from her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old and widowed with seven children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as snack food, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 31 years old, married and a mother of three children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables from her food kiosk in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of about KES 15,000 from the business. 

Halima was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET credit officer. She is applying for her second loan of KES 60,000 to buy additional stock for her kiosk, such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, onions and so on to sell to her customers. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as continue expanding the business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that she may help uplift her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Fatmata from Tombo Western Rural Area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of 9 and 15 years old.  After the war, Fatmata established her clothing business. She began her business because she needs to earn a living. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy more wax cotton for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children.  In the future Fatmata plans to own a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more wax cotton for resale.

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en:
Twenty-six-year-old Bindu operates a table where she sells fashion slippers in the Paynesville South area of Liberia. It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county, with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. 

She is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 14. Only three are currently attending school, and all of them live at home. She completed twelfth grade and is good at managing her business.  She describes herself as a good businesswoman.

Bindu has had a table business for the past three years. She works 10 hours a day, six days a week at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is that during the rainy season, she hardly gets customers. 

She intends to use the loan to buy more fashion slippers for her business. She started her business with help from her husband, who sells charcoal. She likes her business because it helps her buy some items for the home. In the future, she wants to own a house.  

She wants to thank the lenders for supporting BRAC Liberia and its borrowers.

loans.use: to buy more fashion slippers for her business.

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr: Adjoavi âgée de 42ans est veuve. Elle supporte seule ses deux enfants qui sont scolarisés. elle vend dans un marché de la ville des articles plastiques et des ustensiles de cuisine. Les demandes ne cessent d’accroitre et elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire les clients à cause de l’insuffisance du capital. Elle sollicite de WAGES un troisième crédit pour acheter des marchandises (articles plastiques et des ustensiles de cuisine) à Lomé. Avec les profits réalisés, elle souhaiterait agrandir le stock et assurer une condition de vie meilleure à ses enfants.
texts.en: Adjoavi, aged 42, is a widow. She is alone in supporting her two children, who are in school. She sells plasticware and kitchen utensils at the town's market. The demand is continuously increasing, and she is unable to satisfy her customers due to insufficient capital. She is requesting a third loan from WAGES to purchase some merchandise (plasticware and kitchen utensils) in Lomé. With the profits made, she would like to expand her inventory and ensure better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to buy plastic ware and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Irma Erika

texts.es:
Irma es una mujer de 34 años,vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pequeño hijo, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su hijo; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Irma no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Gastronomía que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Irma trabaja brindando servicios de limpieza en un colegio de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Irma se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará su vivienda, ella desea comprar materiales de construcción para construir paredes y encofrar una habitación, así pues Irma seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una bodega de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Irma is a 34 year old woman who lives in Pisco city with her small child. She is very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic, and dedicates all her efforts to helping her child succeed. Sadly because of a lack of economic resources and having to work, Irma couldn't go to school to study to be a professional chef as she had wished. 

Through her own initiative, Irma works providing cleaning services to a school in her city. She works everyday for approximately 10 hours and believes that it is going well due to her dedication and friendly service she provides to others.

Irma is very grateful to the Kiva supporters, as thanks to the help provided she will improve her home. She wishes to buy construction materials to build walls and  frame a room. Irma will continue working and bettering herself in order to achieve her grand dream of having a grocery store.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is 59 years old and married with five children. Amada works very hard to provide for them.

Amada runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock such as snack foods, detergent soap, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store.

Amada has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items.

Amada would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as snack foods, detergent soap, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les cinq femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA  ont  en moyenne 38 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier  de Lafiabougou de la ville de San dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de condiments, d’habits de poissons. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 5eme  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents.
Madame,  MAMOU  (assise  de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) excelle dans la vente de pagnes wax Elle est très sollicitée dans le quartier de Lafiabougou et ses environnants. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 pièces de wax, elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO.  Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle mixtes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame MAMOU  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 30000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Most of them married in traditional extended families, the five women of the group SABOUGNOUMA average 38 years of age and six children each. The women all live in the Lafiabougou district of San City, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of community and kinship and through their professional work. They buy and sell condiments, clothing, and fish.

With the goal of satisfying their continually growing and demanding customer base, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fifth solidarity loan. The previous loans were correctly paid back. 

Ms. MAMOU (sitting at the right in the photo) excels at selling Wax 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She is in high demand in and around the Lafiabougou district. She intends to use her loan to purchase 20 lengths of Wax. She gets her supplies in BAMAKO. She makes her sale retail to a mixed customer base paying cash.  

With this loan, Ms. MAMOU hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and helping her husband to meet household needs.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena, de 20 añitos es una mujer soltera. Vive en compañía de sus padres y sus 2 hermanas menores a las que cuida en la casa que su madre heredó hace muchos años y donde vive desde que nació. Desde hace 8 años emprendió el negocio de compra y venta de productos comestibles, ella era una niña cuando comenzó, afirma que desde pequeña apoyaba a su madre en todas las actividades económicas a las que se dedicaba, pues siempre fue una hija ejemplar. “Ayudar a mis padres es lo más importante, por el progreso de mis hermanas”, afirma. Es por esa razón que desde entonces ella administra los ingresos mientras que sus padres se dedican a cuidar de sus animales y los sembríos. Afirma que le va muy bien en las ventas, pues como su pueblo es muy lejano, los pobladores compran alimentos de manera constante. Ahora desea surtir su tienda y comprar nuevos productos.
Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por lo espera continuar con su apoyo financiero, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Magdalena, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de productos comestibles tales como leche, arroz, azúcar, entre otros, para surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 20 years old and single.  She lives with her parents and two younger sisters, whom she cares for, in a house her mother gave her many years ago and where she was born.  She started her business, buying and selling food products, eight years ago and she was just a girl when she began.  She says that she has been supporting her mother since she was a little girl and has always been an exemplary daughter.  “Helping my parents is the most important thing so that my sisters can get ahead.”  Since then she has managed the income and her parents care for the animals and crops.  She says that things are going very well for her because her village is isolated and the residents buy food constantly.  Now she wants to stock her store and buy new products.

This will be her first Kiva loan and she hopes to continue with her financial support.  She is also committed to making her payments to time and will use the S/ 1,000 to buy food products such as milk, rice, sugar, and other things to stock her store.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Miguel Luigi

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 23 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa. Miguel logro estudiar la carrera e contabilidad y gracias a ello trabaja como empleado en una institución de su ciudad, asimismo con mucho esfuerzo a logrado inicar su negocio de venta de ropa, con lo cual tiene un dinero extra para los gastos de su hogar.

Miguel esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como polos, blusas, short, entre otros, lo que le permitirá  tener variedad de productos para ofrecer y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Obtener su titulo y poder tener un negocio mucho más grande”.
texts.en:
Miguel is 23 years old. He lives in the city of Pucallpa. Miguel succeeded in studying an accounting curriculum, and thanks to this he works as an employee in an institution in his city. With great effort, he also managed to begin his business of selling clothes, from which he has some extra money for the expenses of his household.

Miguel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help that they have offered him, he will be able to buy merchandise for his business, such as polo shirts, blouses, and shorts, among other items. This will allow him to have a greater variety of products to offer and to continue striving to be able to make a reality of his greatest dream: "to obtain his degree and be able to have a much bigger business."

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les dix femmes du groupe  NIETA  ont  en moyenne 46 ans et  5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de N’golofanasso  cercle de SAN  dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente  de condiments. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1er prêt solidaire.
Madame, DJENEBA   (2 eme personne debout de la  gauche vers la droite) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  70 kg de néré puisse qu’elle fait du soumbala de bonne qualité  elle s’approvisionne  auprès des revendeurs de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, à la foire de SAN et dans les foires environnantes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame  DJENEBA   espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 9500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Most of them married in traditional extended families, the ten women of the group NIETA average 46 years of age and five children each. The women all live in the village of N’golofanasso, in Cercle de SAN, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of community, marriage, and kinship. They buy and sell condiments, clothing, and fish.

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan. 

Ms. DJENEBA (standing second from the left in the photo) intends to use her loan to purchase 70 kg of néré seeds and then make good-quality 'soumbala' (pounded and fermented seeds or beans used in making traditional foods). She gets her supplies from local retailers She makes her sales retail to a customer base composed of men and women paying cash at the SAN fair and at surrounding fairs. 


With this loan, Ms. DJENEBA hopes to make an average monthly profit of 9,500 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting household needs.

loans.use: to purchase néré seeds to make 'soumbala'

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina, de 40 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Mario, con quien tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 3 de ellos en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Ella vive en una zona díficil y como es una mujer trabajadora, decidió ubicar su casa en sus mismos terrenos agrícolas para no perder el tiempo en las camitas largas. Sus principales sembríos constan de alverja, papa, habas y maíz, los cuales cuida y son de calidad pues comenta que sus terrenos bordean un manantial por lo que tiene agua a disposición. “Gracias a ello puedo comercializar a buen precio mis cosechas, espero poder seguir mejorando la calidad de los alimentos”, comenta. Ahora espera con ansias poder empezar la siembra de maíz, ya que tiene preparado el terreno y espera nutrir sus sembríos de papa que dentro de poco cosechará. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por lo espera continuar con su apoyo financiero, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Martina, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Martina is 40 years old.  She is a simple woman.  She lives together with her husband Mario, with whom she has four children, three of which live in the home she inherited from her parents.She lives in a difficult area, and since she is a hardworking woman, she decided to locate her home on her farm land so she didn't lose time on the long trip.  Her main crops are peas, potatoes, broad beans, and corn, which she cares for, and have good quality since she says her farm land borders a spring, so she has water available.  She says, "thanks to that, I can sell my crops at a good price and I hope I can continue improve the quality of the crops."  

Now she is anxiously awaiting planting her corn crop, since she has prepared the land and hopes to nourish her potato plants since she will soon harvest them.  This is her first loan with Kiva, and she hopes to continue with financial support.  She promises to make her repayments on time.  Martina will invest the 1000 soles to purchase organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en:
This is 24-year-old Yassah from Liberia. She resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia. The area is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County with one of the best standards of living in the country. Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options makes Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live. 

Yassah is single and has a seven-year-old child. Her child is currently attending school and living at home. 

Yassah runs a table business selling fish. She describes herself as a serious business woman. She started her business two years ago, using money she saved over the year. Typically, she works at her business from 7am to 4pm from Monday to Saturday and transports her goods to her business by taxi.  She cites her greatest challenge as little capital. She is proud of her business because it supports her home.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase fish for her business. In the future, she plans to build a house and educate her children.  She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.
