loans.use: to purchase fish for her business.

loans.name: Alejandro Felipe

texts.es:
Alejandro es un hombre de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres Alejandro pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de electricidad.
Por iniciativa propia, Alejandro trabaja como técnico en una empresa electromecánica de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Alejandro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorara su vivienda, ya que desea reforzar las habitaciones de su hogar con materiales adecuados y resistentes, así pues Alejandro seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda que brinda mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a man of 23. He lives in the city of Pisco with his wife and their little son. He is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person, who focuses all his effort on moving his family forward; thanks to his efforts and the support of his parents, Alejandro was able to study for a degree to be an electrical technician. 

On his own initiative, Alejandro works as a technician in an electromechanical firm in his city. He works everyday for about 10 hours and believes it is going well thanks to his dedication and good performance. 

Alejandro is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he will improve his house, as he wants to reinforce the rooms of his home with adequate and resistant materials. So Alejandro will continue working and striving to achieve his great dream of having a home that provides safety and well-being for his family.

loans.use: to improve his home

loans.name: Jesús De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Doña Jesús de los Ángeles es originaria del municipio de Achuapa un poblado ubicado a 110 km del departamento de León, ahí ha vivido toda su vida donde procreó su familia ya que tiene tres hijos de los cuales todos son independientes.
Doña Jesús es una señora de 53 años, casada, que se dedica a laborar como maestra de primaria en una comunidad ubicada a 6 kilómetros del municipio, diario le toca caminar esta distancia para estar puntual en su centro escolar. Ella ejerce su profesión con gran entusiasmo y dedicación porque es lo que más le gusta hacer enseñar a leer y escribir a sus niños sobre todo los de escasos recursos.
Doña Jesús se presentó a Ceprodel en busca de un financiamiento para pagar la cirugía de su esposo, ya que en los últimos meses ha estado muy enfermo y por lo cual tienen que operarlo para mejorar su salud.
Pone sus esperanzas en Dios y en los inversionistas de Kiva para que le apoyen con este crédito para mejorar la salud de su esposo, ya que con su salario apenas alcanza para el pan de cada día.
Agradece a estas personas por su apoyo que le han brindado en años anteriores, ya que gracias a estos créditos ha mejorado su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jesús de los Ángeles is originally from Achuapa municipality, a town located 110 kilometers from León. There she has lived her entire live and raised her family; she has three grown, independent children. Mrs. Jesús de los Ángeles is 53 years old, married, and works as a primary school teacher in a community located 6 kilometers from town. Daily she walks this distance in order to be on time to her school. She performs her work with great enthusiasm and dedication because what she enjoys most is teaching reading and writing to the children, above all those with few resources. 

Mrs. Jesús de los Ángeles sought out Ceprodel seeking financing to pay for her husband's surgery, because in recent months he has been very ill and needs an operation in order to improve his health. 

She puts her hopes in God and that the Kiva supporters support her with this loan in order to improve her husband's health, because with her salary they barely make ends meet. She thanks all the people for the support they have provided to her in years past, because of those loans she has improved her home.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's surgery.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 46 years old, married and supports a family of four. His spouse is Ruth and she is supportive in providing for the family's financial needs. Edwin runs a retail shop business in Kobujoi, Aldai location in Nandi county. This has been his income generating business for the last 10 years. From this business he gets an average monthly income of KES 120,000.

He has borrowed a fourth loan of KES 100,000 after successfully paying for his previous loans. With this loan he intends to purchase rice, sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat for resale. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to expand his business and pay school fees for his children. His dream and hope is to expand his business into a supermarket and give the best education to his children.

loans.use: To purchase stock for his store

loans.name: Corazon De Amigas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZON DE AMIGAS”  iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Patty es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, elaboración de mantas, venta de café, tienda de abarrotes, venta de ropa americana, venta de fruta, venta de estuco, taller mecánico, servicio de minibus.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Patty es integrante, ella indica que hace veinte años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la sus amigas que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de su pareja, quien es también trabaja en el mismo rubro.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frutas) que adquirirá de las comunidades tropicales del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente a la lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The  A.C. “CORAZON DE AMIGAS” will begin its sixth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. The group consists of 9 members and is directed by an executive board of which Patty is the President. The communal association members' business are varied and among them are: selling vegetables, making table cloths, selling coffee, grocery store, selling American clothing, selling fruit, selling stucco, mechanic shop, minibus service.

The loan that they will take will benefit the small microbusinesses where Patty is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer 20 years ago at the invitation of some of her friends that were members of the institution. Today she has a business selling fruit; she depends on this business that she started on the recommendation of her husband, who also works in the same business.

The loan that will be issued is to increase the capital (buying fruit) that will be acquired from the tropical communities of La Paz and then later sold in her business's space. This work will enable her to generate resources in order to support her home and family including her son.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the continuing trainings.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She used her loan as additional capital for her business. Her income from the business helped her in sending her children to school and in their everyday expenses. She has been running a tailoring business for seventeen years now. She also has a tricycle transport business for additional income. 
 
She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials, such as fabric, cloth and thread for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn dreams that her business will flourish and hopes that her children will inherit her business. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she also finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials, such as fabric, cloth and thread for her business.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 63 years old and married. Nena works very hard to provide for her family.

Nena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks to sell.

Nena has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, bread, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future Nena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, bread, shampoo, and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Yuly Marcela

texts.es: Yuly tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y madre de una hija de 6 años. Inició su negocio con el ideal de conseguir recursos por cuenta propia, que le permitiera estar pendiente de su hija y manejar su propio tiempo. Su negocio consiste en prestar servicios de belleza, como corte, cepillados, peinados infantiles, maquillaje, manicure y pedicure, actividad que realiza en su casa. La cliente es una mujer pujante, emprendedora y siempre está velando por el bienestar de su familia. Por esta razón solicita el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (lavacabezas, vitrina, tocador, silla de manicure) e insumos (esmaltes para uñas, herramientas de decoración, removedor de esmalte, algodón), de esta manera podrá darle una mejor imagen a su negocio además podrá atender mejor a sus clientes ofreciéndoles variedad de productos y mayor comodidad; esto se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas y podrá mejorar la solvencia económica del hogar. Yuly sueña con tener un spa de uñas, pues hoy en día es una buena fuente de ingresos porque en el mundo actual, tanto mujeres como hombres se preocupan por su imagen personal, lo que sería una gran oportunidad para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y ofrecer una excelente educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Yuly is 26 years old. She is married and is the mother of a six-year-old daughter. She began her business with the dream of obtaining resources on her own account, which would allow her to watch over her daughter and manage her own time. Her business consists of offering beauty services such as haircuts. brushing, children's hairstyling, makeup, manicures, and pedicures, activities that she carries out in her house. 

This borrower is a vigorous, entrepreneurial woman, and she is always watching out for the well-being of her family. For this reason, she is applying for the loan, to invest it in the purchase of capital assets (a shampoo chair, a display case, a dresser, and a manicure chair) and supplies (nail polish, decorating tools, nail polish remover, and cotton). In this way she will be able to give her business a better image. In addition, she will be able to tend to her customers better, offering them a variety of products and greater comfort. This will be reflected in an increase in her sales, and she will be able to improve the financial solvency of the household. 

Yuly dreams of having a nail spa, since today it is a good source of income, because in the present world both women and men worry about their personal images. It would be a great opportunity to improve her family's quality of life and offer an excellent education to her daughter.

loans.use: to buy capital assets (a shampoo chair, a display case, a dresser, and a manicure chair) and supplies (nail polish, decorating tools, nail polish remover, and cotton

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 40 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 2 year and 11 years. She sells home products in Tombo, in the Western rural area of Sierra Leone. One of her children is going to school.

Emma has been in business since 2008 selling rubber bowls and sets of plates and pans witinh her community. She says that the main problem facing her business is that is is not located in a prime location.

Emma requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more plates and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and change her status of living. In the future, Emma would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plates and food containers to sell.

loans.name: Hermelinda Heddy

texts.es:
Hermelinda es una mujer de 52 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ella es una persona muy amable,trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Hermelinda no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería.
Por iniciativa propia, Hermelinda trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación.
Hermelinda se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará su vivienda, ya que desea reforzar las paredes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una tienda de comercial.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 52 years old and single. She lives in the city of Ica, and is a friendly, hard-working, enthusiastic woman. She has worked hard her entire life to try and get ahead. Unfortunately, due to her lack of economic resources and the need to begin working young, Hermelinda was unable to pursue a professional career as a nurse.

On her own initiative, Hermelinda works as a field worker in a farm near the city. She works about ten hours every day and she believes that her dedication is paying off. Hermelinda is very grateful for the microloans through Kiva.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to improve her home by to reinforcing her walls. This will allow her to keep working and fighting to achieve her larger dream of running her own store.

loans.use: strengthen the walls of her home.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es:
Artemio es un humilde agricultor, padre de 4 hijos de 16, 14,07 y 2 años de edad a los cuales ama muchísimo y junto a su esposa cada día luchan por salir adelante. Artemio se dedica a la agricultura, actualmente ha sembrado maíz cada día le dedica a su cultivo alrededor de 8 horas; Artemio cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo dedicado.

Artemio está muy agradecido con el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes y solventar los gastos de regadío y arado, de esta manera podrá mejorar su producción de maíz y con ello mejorar sus ingresos; lo que le permitirá seguir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser reconocido como un gran agricultor”.
texts.en:
Artemio is a humble farmer, the father of four children, ages 16, 14, 7, and 2, whom he loves very much. Along with his wife, he strives each day to advance. Artemio works in agriculture. Now he has planted corn. Every day he works on his farm for about 8 hours. Artemio believes that he is advancing because he is very responsible and, above all, dedicated.

Artemio is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders are offering him, since thanks to their help he will be able to buy compost and fertilizers and pay for the expenses of irrigation and plowing. In this way he will be able to improve his production of corn and with that improve his income. This will allow him to continue striving to make a reality of his great dream: "to be recognized as a great farmer."

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers and maintain his crops

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the materials needed in making rugs. Her income from the loan use helped her in the education of her child as well as their everyday expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her rug-making business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilia dreams to expand her business and have other sources of income. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and it is where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her rug-making business.

loans.name: Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VENCEDORAS”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yaneth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: lavado de autos, kiosco de dulces, tejido de mantas, chofer, tienda de carne, tejido de mantas, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yaneth es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; este negocio lo emprendió con un pequeño ahorro que cuando le ayudaba a su madre, posteriormente decide implementar su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio de médico.
texts.en:
The community bank "VENCEDORAS" (Women Who Win) will begin its third term in Pro Mujer as part of the regional office of Collpani. The group is composed of eight members, headed by a director's board with Ms. Yaneth serving as the president. The members of the group run a wide variety of businesses, including car washes, candy stalls, blanket weaving, a chauffeur service, a meat shop, and clothing sales.

This loan will benefit the small businesses of Yaneth's group. She said that she's been a member of the Pro Mujer for six months, and that they joined at the invitation of a friend who was a member. Currently, Yaneth runs a business weaving and selling blankets. She started this business with a small amount of savings to help her mother, then later she decided to start her own independent business.

This loan will be used to increase her capital through the purchase of wool, which she will buy at the markets in the city of El Alto. After weaving the blankets, she will sell them in her sales location. This work allows her to generate income to maintain her home, as she lives in a with her partner and two children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she said she likes the health clinic.

loans.use: purchase wool to weave blankets

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es: Santusa nació en la ciudad de Sunchubamba de la provincia de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 24 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta de caldo y comida, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Llapallanchis Llankasunchis” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo papas, verduras, fideos y carnes, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Santusa, 24, was born in the city of Sunchubamba in the province of Paucartambo, and she lives in the same city with her parents.  She's in a common-law relationship from which she has one child.  She's a hardworking and enterprising person who gets her family ahead with the effort she puts into her work.

Santusa's main job is selling broth and food.  She was invited to participate in Llapallanchis Llankasunchis Communal Bank because she's a responsible person.

Santusa's requesting this loan to buy supplies such as potatoes, vegetables, pasta, and meat.

She's grateful for the loan and appreciates it.  She promises to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, vegetables, pasta, and meat

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen comes from Buhanda village, which is many kilometres away from the main city in the Ibanda District of Uganda. 

Stephen deals in produce, harvesting an average of around eight bags of coffee from his own coffee plantation. He has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to help him buy manure and fertilizers, which will to help boost the yields and reduce the amount of fertilizer he needs to purchase and transport from his neighbors' properties. 

He is confident the loan will come with many of benefits, such as financial savings and market connections from being a part of the lending organization. He says he will try so hard to pay well so that he can maintain his partnership with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson, a 60-year-old married father of five from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. He earns a monthly income of KES 17,000, which he uses to support his family. This marks his fifth loan with KADET after repaying his previous loans successfully. 

With the loan he has applied for from KADET LTD, he will be able to purchase more seedlings and fertilizers. The additional income created will allow him to meet his family’s needs and repay his loan. In the future, Benson would like to educate his children. 

He hopes to start exporting his farm produce.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 45 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Antonia is borrowing 20,000 PHP  through NWTF (Kiva's field partner in the region) to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Antonia has been buying and selling livestock for 2 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: José Isidro

texts.es:
José de 29 años de edad, es persona trabajadora, luchadora y  responsable, todo con el fin  de darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia es decir, alimentación, vestuario, vivienda y salud; él se levanta a  las 4 y 30 de la mañana; ya que trabaja cuidando una finca de árboles de pino y debe caminar 45 minutos hasta llegar al lugar, dos días por semana sale a buscar bovinos para comprar y en la próxima semana salir a venderlos, para ello tiene que recorrer grandes distancias. 

él antes era padre soltero; pero se volvió a acompañar. Su compañera de vida se dedica únicamente a los trabajos  domésticos, a estar pendiente de sus dos pequeños. A parte de su compañera de vida y sus hijos con él vive su mamá, quien ayuda  a realizar los oficios hogareños.

Él se dedica a comerciar ganado bovino en  el municipio donde reside y en sus alrededores. Tiene cuatro años de ser comerciante;  el trabajo lo aprendió ya que cuando era más joven le gustaba salir con un  amigo vecino a realizar el mismo trabajo, y al ver  que no tenía otra actividad que le generara ingresos opto por dedicarse a este negocio. 

También recibe ingresos pues cuida una finca de árboles de pino, antes de ser comerciante se dedicaba a hacer jornales agrícolas.  La finca que cuida está a unos 3 kilómetros aproximados desde su vivienda los cuales los recorre a pie, su horario en la finca es de 6:00 am a 4:00 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para comprar una yunta de bueyes y una ternera los que posteriormente pondrá a la venta. Y con ello ayudar a su familia para cubrir las necesidades más básicas; será satisfecha la necesidad de ir superándose poco a poco en todos los ámbitos de la vida,

 Él lo que tiene planificado, es seguir trabajando con la fundación que le sigan apoyando y obtener un monto mayor  y repellar su casa ya que es de adobe y no es del todo segura. Las ganancias las pretende invertir, en comprar más animales y luego ponerlos a la venta,  tener en un futuro un buen mercado donde comprar y vender bien. Dice que puede lograrlo si se empeña si duplica sus esfuerzos; lo puede lograr no importando la hora de salida del trabajo  y no acomodándose solo a una cosa.
texts.en:
José is 29 years old and he is a hard-working, responsible man who fights to bring his family an improved quality of life, ensuring their food, clothing, home, and health. He wakes up at 4:30 in the morning to begin work. He cares for a pine tree farm and has to walk 45 minutes to that location. Twice a week he goes to find cattle to buy so he can sell them the next week. To do all this, he must cover long distances.

He used to be a single father, but he has since found a partner. She works out of the home so as to be available to their two children. In addition to his partner and their children, his mother lives with them, and she also helps with the household labor.

His primary work is selling cattle in the town where he lives and other towns nearby. He has four years of experience in the work, which he learned by following a  neighbor around when he was younger. When he realized he didn't have any other options for bringing in income, he decided to begin working at what he had learned.

He also receives income for caring for a pine tree farm. Before he began to sell cattle, he was a farm day laborer. The farm he cares for is about 3km (1.8 miles) from his house, which he travels to on foot. He works in the field from 6am to 4pm.

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase a pair of oxen and a heifer, which he will later resell. This will allow his family to meet the expenses for their basic needs and allow them to keep improving their overall situation a little at a time.

He plans to keep working with the foundation that continues to support him, borrowing greater amounts. With future loans, he hopes to plaster his home since it is made of adobe and isn't particularly secure. With future income, he wants to invest in purchasing more animals and putting them up for sale. He would like to have a good marketplace where he can buy and sell. He says that he can achieve all this by committing himself to redoubling his efforts, regardless of how early or late he has to work, and by not limiting himself to just one thing.

loans.use: purchase a yoke of oxen and a heifer calf.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of two women who live in the same neighborhood. They both work in commerce and have good social cohesion. 
Beatrice is the group's representative and she is standing on the left in the photo. She is a widow and the mother of three children, all boys. Beatrice does commerce in smoked fish. With her loan of GHS 1,000, she intends to purchase two cartons of fish from the fishing port, smoke it and supply it to customers. She has good experience in this domain and her customers are very loyal to her since they get along well. Her profits enable her to pay the family's monthly food expenses.

Janet is the other partner who sells salt.

loans.use: To purchase two cartons of fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past year, Margret has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells sugar, rice, and posho. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar, rice, and posho and will help Margret to generate greater profits and to increase her capital. Margret hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, and posho to sell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 26 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with two children, ages 2 and 8; they are in school and live at home. 

She has been selling cold water, juice, and soft drinks for the past two years.  She started this business from her susu (local saving account) and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is the profit she generates every day. 

Hawa is requesting a loan to purchase more cold water, juice, and soft drinks for her business.  

In the future she wants to own a house. She appreciates the support of BRAC, and she promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase more cold water, juice, and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Mammy

texts.en:
Mammy is 47 years old and married with three children. She runs a domestic product business in Tombo in the western rural area of Sierra Leone. One of her children is going to school.

She's been in this business since 2008 and sells rubber bowls, pans and plates within her community. She says that the main problem with her business is her improper business location.

Mammy requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more plates and a variety of food container for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and change her status of living. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more plates and food containers to sell

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is a married, 47 years old and the father of four chilrdren who lives in the town of Mwingi. He has been running a hotel for the past 27 years and has a monthly income of KES 17,000, which he uses to support his family. Boniface is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying his first loan successfully. He will use this loan to buy wheat, kale, cereal, onions and cabbage in bulk for his hotel. He will plow the proceeds back into his business. He hopes to educate his children to the college level and secure their future.

loans.use: to buy flour, kale, cereal, onions and cabbage in bulk for his hotel

loans.name: Kyanya Bakyara Group

texts.en: Eddy is a 48-year-old married woman with four children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. For 13 years she has been operating a retail shop but also practices farming to earn extra income. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are her major challenges, while her dream is to own a wholesale shop and educate her children. Eddy intends to use this loan to buy sugar and soap to sell. She is a member of the above-mentioned group, whose members guarantee each other when accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Cristian Camilo

texts.es: Cristian es un joven de 21 años de edad, que luego de culminar sus estudios secundarios, comenzó a laborar en una distribuidora de gaseosas, encargado de entregar los pedidos a los clientes; actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años y es su principal fuente de ingresos, con los que sostiene el hogar donde convive con su madre. Es un hombre enérgico, activo, emprendedor y se esmera por alcanzar sus objetivos, por eso desea comenzar su propio negocio, que consistirá en distribuir una marca de gaseosa muy reconocida en todo el mundo, para lo cual, el dueño y jefe de la distribuidora donde labora, le prestará el espacio para almacenar los productos. Esto lo motiva a solicitar el crédito, que desea invertir en la compra de gaseosas al por mayor en todas las presentaciones, aprovechando que es un producto reconocido y muy solicitado, de esta forma obtendrá ingresos extra para continuar llevando la carga económica de su hogar. Cristian sueña con independizar su negocio completamente, acreditarlo para que sea rentable y le permita ofrecer a su madre un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristian is a 21 year old young man who after completing high school started working as a beverage distributor, tasked with delivering orders to customers. He has worked this job for three years and it is his primary source of income, which he uses to cover expenses for the home he shares with his mother. Cristian is very energetic, active, and enterprising, and he works very hard to achieve his goals. 

One goal is to start his own business, distributing soft drinks for a brand with worldwide recognition, and the owner and boss of the distributor for whom he currently works is willing to lend him the space to warehouse his products. This is the motivation for seeking the loan, which will be used to purchase soft drinks at wholesale price in a variety of sizes and flavors. He will be able to take advantage of the brand's name recognition and customer demand, and thus be able to earn greater income and continue managing the household expenses. Cristian dreams of one day taking his business completely independent, financing it so that it is profitable and allows him to provide his mother a greater wellbeing and quality of life.

loans.use: purchase a variety of wholesale soft drinks.

loans.name: Fasso Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les 6 femmes du groupe Fasso Kanou  ont  en moyenne 45 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de N’golofanasso    dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font le petit commerce. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur   2e  prêt solidaire.
Madame, SARAN  (1 ère personne debout  de la droite  vers la gauche) très connue dans son activité  de vente de soumbala dans le village.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 120 kg  de noix de néré.  Elle s’approvisionne  auprès des revendeurs à SAN. après avoir acheté son marchandise elle transforme le néré en Soumbala pendant 3 jours pour le mettre au séchage en une ou deux jours  Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, à SAN  et à son domicile dans le village. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame SARAN espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married and living in traditional extended families, the 6 women of the Fasso Kanou group have an average age of 45 years and 5 children each. They all live in the village of N'golofanasso in the Ségou region (the 4th administrative region of Mali) and came to know each other as neighbors, by marriage, and as relatives.

The women are all in small business. In the goal of increasing their business funds, the members of the group have partnered with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan. Saran (the first person standing, from right to left, in the photo) is well-known in her business of Soumbala sales in the village. 

Saran plans to use her loan to purchase 120kg of néré seeds. She stocks up from resellers in San. After she purchases her merchandise, she turns the néré into Soumbala for 3 days, in order to allow it to dry for one or two days. She resells her product at retail for cash to a customer base made up of both men and women, in San and at her home in the village.

With this loan, Saran hopes to earn an average monthly salary of 17,500 francs CFA which she will use to reinvest in her business and to take care of her household's needs.

loans.use: purchase néré seeds to produce Soumbala

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 41 años, está casado con Julia y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Junto a su esposa se dedican a diversas actividades, una de ellas es la agricultura, pues ambos aprendieron el oficio de sus padres y abuelos. “Ella se encarga de cuidar los sembríos, cuando tengo tiempo le ayudo también”, afirma José, quien se dedica a la crianza de animales, posee 4 vacas lecheras en buen estado, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, ya que según cuenta le producen varios litros de leche al día, lo que le genera ingresos permanentes para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Por esa razón José cuida de su alimentación y estado de salud. Más adelante comprará comida balanceada en gran cantidad, pues de esa manera le sale más comodo, además de continuar con la agricultura  ya que es temporada de siembra. Éste es su segundo crédito con Kiva, por lo espera continuar con su apoyo financiero, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.José invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old, and is married to Julia. They have 3 children with whom they live in their own home. Together with his wife they do a number of things. One of them is farming which they both learned from their parents and grandparents. He explained, "She takes care of the fields and when I have time, I help her".  He raises animals. He has four milking cows in good condition. He takes very good care of them and he says that they produce a number of liters of milk per day. Which generates constant income that covers the household expenses. For this reason he is careful about their food and health. Later on he will buy balanced feed in large quantities for them, as it is more convenient. Also it is planting time so he needs to attend to that.

This is his second loan with Kiva. He hopes to continue having this financial support and promises to pay his installments on time.  He will use the loan to buy organic fertilizer to strengthen his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his fields.

loans.name: Gunje

texts.en: Gunje is 28 years old, married and the father of one child. For the past three years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town, from which he earns a monthly profit of KES 9,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his fourth loan, in the amount of KES 40,000. He is going to use this loan to service and repair his motorbike. Gunje will use the profits to pay school fees for his child, invest in his business and continue looking after his family. His goal for the future is to continue growing his businesses, so that he can improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to repair, service and buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.en: Shafoat is married and has four children. Shafoat is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life for his children. He began his own business dealing in animal husbandry seven years ago. His wife and children help him manage the business. He has great experience. Shafoat is one of the best businessmen in the local market. He is a repeat client of IMON and has a good credit story. He requested a loan for 3,000 USD to increase the number of animals he has for sale and to buy feed for his cattle. He hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve his family's income.

loans.use: To buy cattle and feed for the cattle

loans.name: Jardin Del Sur Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JARDINES DEL SUR”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Olga es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de productos de limpieza, venta de zapatillas, venta de cosméticos, venta de CD’s, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Olga es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás, ya que anteriormente trabajaba de ayudante de cocina y ya conocía la forma de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo, aceite) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas a la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el el seguro de vida.
texts.en:
The “JARDINES DEL SUR”  group is in their first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of Villa Exaltación regional office. It's eight members are lead by a Board of Directors with Olga as the Treasurer. There is a variety of businesses amongst the members including the sale of cleaning products, shoe sales, cosmetic sales, selling CD's, a neighborhood store and selling clothes.

This loan will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, including Olga. She indicated that this is her first time as a member of Pro Mujer, joining on the invitation of a promoter from Pro Mujer, who visited her home. She sells food, something she started a number of years ago. Before that she had worked as a cook's aide and got to know the business. 

Olga will use the loan to increase her capital, buying rice, pasta and oil in the surrounding markets of the city of El Alto. And later she will sell the finished product in her commercial space. By working in this way she can generate enough income to support, as best as possible, her household. She lives with her life partner and their three children. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she liked the life insurance.

loans.use: to buy rice, pasta and oil.

loans.name: Armida Guadalupe

texts.es:
Armida de 27 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora y responsable, estudio sexto grado, desde hace tres años su esposo emigro a Estados Unidos en busca de una mejor condición de vida. Su esposo cuando estaba en El Salvador se dedicaba a realizar trabajos de carpintería, tiene tres hijas las cuales viven con ella en su casa, actualmente están estudiando la primera 4togrado, la segunda 2dogrado y la tercera que aun no estudia.   La señora no tiene negocio sus ingresos dependen de las remesas que le envía su esposo de USA.

Con el financiamiento pretende comprar 8 pliegos de lamina para el techo, también comprara 6 cuartones para techar una área que hace poco termino de construir , 2 costaneras y las bisagras para hacer una puerta de los baños. De esta manera  vivirá mejor pues ya no le dará el sol a la hora de estar lavando ni se mojara ella y ni sus niñas cuando tengan que  salir hacer sus necesidades.

El sueño para sus hijas, es verlas crecer en un ambiente agradable algo que ella por muchos motivos no tubo cuando era joven, a la vez pretende salir bien con su crédito es decir pagarlo en el tiempo establecido y que la fundación le siga apoyando e ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda. Lo que más necesita  hacer en un corto plazo es al menos fraguar  el piso pues actualmente es de tierra y  le dificulta que su pequeñita juegue tranquila.
texts.en:
Armida is 27 years old. She is a hard-working and responsible person. She completed sixth grade. Three years ago her husband emigrated to the United States in search of a better living condition. When he was in El Salvador, he did carpentry work. She has three daughters who live with her in her house. Now they are in school, the oldest in 4th grade, the second in 2nd grade, and the third is not yet in school. She does not have a business. Her income depends on the remittances that her husband sends her from the USA.

With the loan she intends to buy 8 sheets of laminated roofing, 6 planks to roof an area that was just built a little while ago, 2 boards and the hinges to make a door for the bathroom. In this way, she will live better, since she won't be exposed to the sun when she is washing, and neither she nor her little girls will get wet when they have to go out to use the toilet.

Her dream for her daughters is to see them grow up in a pleasant environment, something that she, for various reasons, did not have when she was young. At the same time, she intends to do well with her loan, that is, pay it off in the established time. And she dreams that the foundation will continue supporting her and she can continue improving her house little by little. What she most needs to do in the short term is to harden the floor, since now it is dirt, and it is difficult for her little one to play peacefully.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Kadiatu from Tombo in the western rural area of Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of 6 and 13 years old. Her children are currently attending school. After she got married, Kadiatu established her palm oil business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan to buy gallons of palm oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her house. In the future, Kadiatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Batorgil

texts.en: Batorgil is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Bulgan province of Mongolia. His wife Ganchimeg works at a local hospital. His daughter Lhagvazul is a junior in the university and son Boldsaihan studies at a local secondary school. Batorgil has had a business providing clean water delivery for more than a decade and has a lot of regular clients. He is a well-experienced, welcoming and hardworking man who works for his family and to get his children well educated in the future. He is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of clean mineral water to sell and deliver to his clients.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of clean mineral water to sell and deliver to his clients

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle transport business.

Liezel has been in this business for 14 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Nizom

texts.ru: Низом заботливый отец 5 детей. Его жена Мушарраф добрая женщина и всегда помогает ему по введению домохозяйства. Низом имеет высшее образование. Он более 35 лет работает в школе преподавателем. Он преподает младшим классам. Он имеет огромный опыт и хорошие знания и является одним из лучших и заслуженных учителей своего района. Низом вырастил своих детей воспитанными и интеллигентными людьми. Несмотря на то, что его дети выросли, он является основным кормильцем семьи. Он планирует провести мероприятия дома, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для проведения мероприятия. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nizom is a caring father of five children. His wife Musharraf is a kind woman and always helps him to take care of the house. Nizom has a college degree and has worked as a teacher for 35 years. He teaches elementary school. Nizom has a lot of experience and knowledge and is one of the best and recognized teachers in the region. Nizom has raised his kids to be polite and intelligent people. Despite the fact that his children are adults now Nizom remains the main provider for his family. He needs to organize a party but lacks the funds. He is requesting a loan of 1500 US dollars to pay for the party. He hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to finance a party for his family

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia is a 20-year-old lady who graduated from high school. She lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She use the county as an opportunity to engage in business. She was helped by a friend and as of today, she is operating a small shop where she earns a living. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to expand her business. In the near future, she hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Sraloeng's Group

texts.en: Sraloeng, a mother of two schoolchildren and two little kids, is in her mid 30s and is a resident of Thmor Koul district in Battambang province.  Her core business, from which she can generate income for her family, is rice cropping. It is the business that she has had for 10 years. Sraloeng is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy herbicide for her crop. She hopes that she can double her yield and earn a good profit.

loans.use: To buy herbicide for her crop

loans.name: Yankin

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Yankin from Tombo in the western rural area of Freetown. She is married with one child who is 8 years old. Her child goes to school. After the war, Yankin established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed to create an income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Yankin requires a loan to buy more used clothing for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her child . In the future, Yankin plans to own a big clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Muyassara

texts.ru: Муяссара доброжелательная позитивная женщина. Она замужем и имеет 3-х детей. Она очень трудолюбивый человек, никогда не сидит на месте. Живёт она со своей семьёй в сельском посёлке, и имеет положительные отзывы со стороны соседей и близких. Её муж работает в местной мастерской. А она, чтобы помочь своему мужу зарабатывать деньги также ведёт свой бизнес. Муяссара занимается купле-продажей женской одежды. Муяссара имеет свой магазин и у нее очень много клиентов. По ее словам заниматься бизнесом, в особенности купли-продажей одежд трудно, так как надо платить высокие налоги, но несмотря на это она продолжает заниматься торговым бизнесом, так как она имеет не мало клиентов. Её бизнес с каждым разом расширяется. И от этого она получает хороший доход, и может удовлетворять нужды своих детей. Она не раз получала кредит с Арванд для реализации своего бизнеса, и каждый раз успешно использует полученные средства. И сейчас также она желает получить кредит, чтобы закупить большой ассортимент женской одежды. Тем более что сейчас начинается сезон осенней одежды. Муяссара очень надеется на поддержку Арванд и заранее благодарит.
texts.en: Muyassara is a positive and well-meaning woman. She is married and has three children. She is a very hardworking person and never stays idle. Muyassara lives with her family in a village and has good relations with her neighbors and relatives. Her husband works in the local workshop. She herself helps out her husband by managing a business - Muyassara resells women's clothes. She has her own store and many regular clients. In her own words the clothing resale business is hard as she has to pay high taxes, but she continues to work here as she has a large customer base. In fact, her business is expanding and is very profitable. This is not the first time Muyassara took a loan with Arvand and she always puts the loans to good use. This time Muyassara will use the loan to purchase a large batch of wholesale clothes. She has to refresh her inventory for the fall season. Muyassara hopes for Arvand's support and is thankful in advance.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene tres hijos, vive en  el municipio de Choloma. Anteriormente, se dedicaba a la compra y venta de mercadería y hace 2 años decidió por establecer el negocio de una pulpería donde  ofrece la venta de harina de maíz, refrescos, churros, manteca, arroz, frijoles, embutidos, carnes etc.  El préstamo que solicito es el octavo ciclo con ODEF, y es por 8,000 Lempiras  para la compra de productos para el negocio como granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, carnes, productos de limpieza, lácteos, refrescos y otros abarrotes, con el propósito de  aumentar la demanda y tener más ingresos. Su plan es ampliar el negocio y mantenerlo bien surtido.
texts.en: Juana is 33 years old and lives in the municipality of Choloma with her common-law husband, with whom she has three children. She previously made a living buying and sell general merchandise, but two years ago she decided to set up a grocery store and offer products like cornmeal, beverages, churros, lard, rice, beans, sausages, meats and other items. She is requesting the loan, her eighth with Kiva partner ODEF, to purchase products for her business like basic grains, sugar, lard, meats, cleaning supplies, dairy products, beverages and other groceries with the goal of increasing her demand and her profits. Her plan is to expand her business and keep it well stocked.

loans.use: to purchase basic groceries like cornmeal, sugar, lard, meats, beverages, dairy products, cleaning products, grains and other items to stock her store.

loans.name: Khoshmurod

texts.ru: Хошмурод житель района Пяндж, прекрасный семьянин и хороший доктор-уролог. Ему 53 года. У него жена и 5 детей. Он хороший доктор и работал по своей профессии в течение 11 лет. В данное время он занимается сельским хозяйством. Хошмурод всегда хотел разводить крупнорогатый скот для продажи. Он давно к этому шел и решился начать свое дело. Хошмурод накопил сбережение и еще просит кредит, чтобы  приобрести шесть голов бычков. Он планирует выращивать скот в течение месяца и затем продавать по прибыльной цене на местном скотном рынке. Полученный доход Хошмурод собирается потратить на торжество по случаю обрезания своего внука.
texts.en: Khoshmurod lives in Pyandj region. He is a wonderful family man and a retired urologist. He is 53 years old, married and has 5 children. Khoshmurod is an excellent doctor and has been practicing for 11 years. However, he is retired and now manages the family's farm. Khoshmurod always wanted to try raising cattle for resale. He has finally decided to start his business. Khoshmurod has saved a starting capital, but is also requesting a loan to purchase six more calves. He plans to fatten the calves for a month then resell them at the local livestock market for a higher price. Khoshmurod plans to use the profit from the sale to finance the circumcision ceremony for his grandson.

loans.use: to buy six calves and start his cattle resale business and so finance his grandson's circumcision ceremony

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 45 years old and married with six children who are all school going and they are in charge of paying their school fees. She operates a private school in the name of St.Cecily's primary school in Kibaale district where she is the director. Teddy works hand in hand with her husband to raise tuition and look after the family, though at times they find financial challenges.

Teddy has approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX 2,000,000/= (Two million shillings) to pay tuition fees for her daughter who is going to the university. She intends to pay back the loan using the collections from the school plus money from her farming projects.

Her dream is to educate all her children up to the university level, but she is challenged by the delays in the school fee payments of the pupils at her private primary school and yet she is supposed to see it operating financially. In the photo is Teddy (right) with the Ugafode staff.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her daughter

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 68 years old, married, and a mother of six children. For the last year, she has earned a living by selling farm produce in Mpeketoni, Lamu. She earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. Beatrice was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer and is applying for her fifth loan of KES 40,000, to buy seeds, some fertilizer, and other farm inputs needed for her business. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her grandchildren as well as to expand her farming activities. Her goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing her income so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase farming inputs for her business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, a father of eight from Mwingi, owns a business selling cereals and other grains. He currently lacks the capital needed to purchase items in bulk to restock his store. Francis also sells groceries to supplement his income. With a loan through KADET LTD, Francis will be able to purchase maize, beans, cow peas, and green grams in bulk when he finds goods at low prices. 

He will then be able to have a fully stocked store which will attract more customers, generate sales, and create more profit due to a lower cost of goods sold. Additional income created will allow him to reinvest in his business, meet the needs of his family, and educate his children. 

In the future, Francis would like to eradicate poverty and uplift the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans, cow peas, and green grams in bulk

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 38 years old. She is married to Emmanuel who works as a trader and they live comfortably in their own house.

Sophia sells bags. She buys this product from the central market, then sells them by walking to customers. She started this business over 10 years ago with her own capital, derived from her savings. Sophia says that she decided to start her own business to help her husband with household expenses and to have income, in addition to having a job and feeling productive. She is holding a sample in the photograph.

This is Sophia's thirteenth loan cycle with ID-Ghana, and she is grateful for the financial support she receives. She also commits to repaying her loan on time. Sophia will need GHS 1500 to be able buy enough bags to resell to customers. She will try to obtain good deals so that she can get better earnings.

loans.use: To buy enough bags to resell to customers.

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.ru: Фазилат учительница, проживающая в районе Вахш. У нее есть муж, двое сыновей и дочь. Фазилат 43 года. Она в течение 18 лет работает в школе и преподает там русский язык. Она любит свою профессию, школу и учеников. Старшая дочь Фазилат учится в Государственном Медицинском Университете имени Абуали Ибн Сино. Она студентка второго курса. Оба сыновья Фазилат еще учатся в школе. Фазилат хочет, чтобы все ее дети в будущем имели высшее образование. Сейчас ей необходимо оплатить за следующий учебный год дочери, которая учится на договорной основе. С такой целью она запрашивает кредит в размере 1200 долларов США. Она надеется, что ее дочь успешно закончит университет и станет хорошим врачом.
texts.en: Fazilat is a teacher in Vakhsh region. She has a husband, two sons and a daughter. Fazilat is 43 years old and has worked for 18 years as a Russian language teacher. She loves her profession, her school and her students. Fazilat's eldest daughter is a sophomore at the Abuali Ibn Sino State Medical University. Fazilat's two sons are still in school. Fazilat wants all of her children to get a college degree. Currently she has to pay for her daughter's tuition and is requesting a loan of 1200 US dollars. She hopes that her daughter will successfully graduate from the University and become a good doctor.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's college education

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 58 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mahmadullo

texts.ru: Добрый человек, который всегда старается улучшить условию проживания, и надеется на светлое будущее, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Его зовут Махмадулло  Ему 31 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет  3 детей. Так как он живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Он более 2  лет занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Он так хорошо ухаживает за своим скотом, словно знает и понимает язык своего скота. Благодаря хорошему состоянию скота, он имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Он хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 долларов США для покупки скота для пополнения оборотного капитала. С полученного дохода он планирует улучшить условию проживания. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Here is a kind man who always tries to improve his family's life and hopes for a better future, but needs your help. His name is Mahmadullo. He is 31 years old, married and is raising three children. Mahmadullo lives in the country where conditions are good for raising livestock. He has been raising cattle for two years and has a lot of experience in this line of work. Mahmadullo takes good care of his animals, as if he understands their language. Because his cows are in good health, Mahmadullo has many regular clients. He wants to expand his business and earn bigger profits. Mahmadullo is requesting a loan of 2500 US dollars to purchase more cattle and increase his business capital. He plans to use the profits from his business to improve his family's life. Mahmadullo awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en: Tenneh is 28 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which is the largest free port and the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with two children who are 8 and 11 years old. They are in school and live at home. She has been selling charcoal since 2004.  She started this business with a loan that she took from a club (group saving accounts) and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is the profit she generates every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. In the future, she wants to educate her children and build a house. She appreciates the support of BRAC and she promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Meet 47-year-old Fatu, from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 3 years and 12 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2010, Fatu established her cake business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. Fatu works at her business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Fatu requires a loan in order to buy flour, sugar and oil to prepare more products for her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her family welfare. In the future; Fatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and oil to prepare more products for her business.

loans.name: Batchimeg

texts.en:
Batchimeg is 39 years old and lives with her 2 sons in a Ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in Bulgan province of Mongolia. Her son Luvsandagva is freshman in university and Myagmardorj is a secondary school student. 

Batchimeg has been providing a cobbler service business in a rental place for years, and has a lot of regular clients in Bulgan province center and the countryside. She produces all types of shoes by order and is well-known with her qualified products among customers. She is now requesting loan of 1,500,000MNT to purchase leather and other inventories to produce a large amount of shoes before the academic year starts, which is high season for her business. 

She is a hardworking, well-experienced and open-minded woman.

loans.use: to purchase leather and other items to produce shoes

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Asma. She is married and has 5 children, and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

In 1998, her husband established a business selling clothes in his nearby town. Now, his young children are growing and their needs as well. With the rapid increase in the necessities of their family, he wants to grow his business. He does not have any other source of income to fulfill the needs of his family so he wants to grow his current business, but he does not have sufficient money.

Asma requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy a variety of clothes for ladies and gents to sell.

Asma hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in the enterprise of her husband and in her family as well. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.ru: Молодой человек по имени Насимчон живет в городе Вахдат. Ему 24 года. Он предоставляет услуги такси по городу и это основное средство их семейного дохода. Его молодая жена следит за их маленьким сыном, в то время как Насимчон зарабатывает на жизнь. Сейчас у его машины технические неполадки, и ему становится труднее работать. Он просит кредит в размере 2200 долларов США, чтобы он смог отремонтировать свою машину и провести ремонт в доме до прихода зимы. Он в эту трудную минуту нуждается в поддержке и обещает, что кредит будет выплачивать в срок за счет дохода с деятельности.
texts.en: A young man named Nasimjon lives in Vahdat city. He is 24 years old. He works as a taxi driver. Nasimjon's young wife takes care of their baby son while Nasimjon provides for the family. Currently his car is in need of repair and it's hard to find other work. Nasimjon is requesting a loan of 2200 US dollars so that he can repair his car and also fix his house before coming winter. He is in a difficult situation and needs help. Nasimjon promises to repay the loan on time using the profits from his taxi business.

loans.use: to repair his car and his house and improve working and living condition

loans.name: Mirali

texts.ru: Мирали житель района Вахш. Ему 37 лет. Он женат и имеет четырехлетнюю дочь и трехлетнего сына. Мирали дехканин. Он занимается выращиванием хлопка и арбуза. Он в этой сфере работает в течение 6 лет. Мирали любит жену и детей. Он всегда трудится усердно, чтобы обеспечивать их хорошо. Он нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить минеральные удобрений для усовершенствования урожая хлопка и арбуза. У Мирали большие планы на будущее. Он в следующем году собирается приобрести еще 15 га земельных участков и увеличить посев хлопка.
texts.en: Mirali lives in Vakhsh region. He is 37 years old, married and has a four-year old daughter and a three-year old son. Mirali is a farmer. He grows cotton and watermelons. He has been farming for six years. Mirali loves his wife and children and works hard to provide for them. He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to improve his harvests of cotton and watermelons. Mirali has big plans for the future. Next year he plans to purchase another 15 hectares of land and increase his cotton harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, tiene 54 años de edad,  esta soltero, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos, lleva varios años de experiencia, cosecha granos básicos como ser  el maíz. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. El préstamo que ha solicitado es el segundo ciclo en ODEF, el cual es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la preparación de las tierras para la limpieza, fertilización y siembra de maíz. Este préstamo le ayudara a mantener en buen estado la tierra para sacar una buena producción de maíz. Su plan es comprar una nueva finca y así poder dejarles a sus hijos algo que les ayude a mantenerse en el futuro.
texts.en:
Juan is 54 years old, single and has two children. He lives in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa. He has always worked as a farmer of basic grains, and has several years of experience harvesting grains such as corn. He sells his product in the local market. 

This loan request is his second cycle with ODEF, and he asks for 10,000 Lempiras. He plans to invest the loan in preparing his property for cleaning, fertilization and sowing of corn. This loan will help him keep his property in good condition in order to harvest a good yield of corn. His plan is to purchase a new farm so that he may be able to leave his children something that will help them support themselves in the future.

loans.use: to fertilize and clean his property in order to sow corn

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en:
Manvel lives in Mrgashat village with his wife and son. The family has been engaged in agriculture for many years. Currently, they keep a cow and cultivate cucumbers. Manvel's farm was damaged from a hail storm which took place in June 2013. The most affected farmers were those who were cultivating orchards and grapes, and Manvel was one of them. His grape orchard was partially destroyed, and he wasn't able to recover it. 

Now, Manvel is asking for this loan in order to enlarge his farm and rebuild his farm. With the loan's help, he will purchase three oxen, forage for feeding them, seeds and fertilizer. This loan is very important for Manvel to be able to recover from the damages and start a new life. He waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen, forage for feeding them, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Akjoltoy

texts.ru: Акжолтой 60 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Акжолтой - среднее образование. Акжолтой качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Акжолтой, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 кобыла, а также 5 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячный доход составляет 6,840 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Акжолтой обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 1 головы крупного рогатого скота. Доходы от кредита Акжолтой планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Akjoltoy is a 60 years old widow, and has been raised her three children and managing the house by herself after the death of her husband. She has a high school degree and raises livestock as the main means to support her family. Akjoltoy has been raising animals for 20 years, she purchased her first livestock with 15,000 som (KGS). Due to Akjoltoy's hard work she now owns a mare and 5 sheep/goats, and makes 6,840 som (KGS) monthly profits. In order to expand her business Akjoltoy has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS). She will use the money to buy a cow. Akjoltoy plans to invest the profits into her livestock business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz is 34 years old. He has two children, and he is the only breadwinner in the family. He earns his living by agriculture activities and additionally, works at wedding parties as an operator. 

He lives in a village, where most local people are busy with animal husbandry and farming. Thirteen years ago, Mubariz began his own business in farming. He works every day, from early morning until late evening, on his own land. He knows his business very well and has great experience. Since he has been running his own farm, his parents have been helping him. He sells his harvest at the local market.

He wants to develop his business further and to get a good profit. He wants to buy a tractor; he will use it on his own land and plans to provide a plow service with the aim of extra income.
 
Mubariz has many perfect plans for the future, and he tries to realize them. He awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy a tractor to use on his own land and to provide plow services.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and four children. Her husband owns a small jewelry shop, in which he sells bracelets, bangles, lockets, necklaces, rings and earrings. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case for the attraction of customers.  

Her husband has only one source of income; he has to afford the expenses of utility bills, the school fees of his children and household expenses, alone. The condition of his house is not up to the mark for inhabiting. He wants to construct his house, and for this purpose, more earnings are required so that he could save some money for construction. 

Therefore, Rukhsana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could increase his inventory and earnings, as well.

She hopes that she will construct her house soon, so that her family members pass their lives comfortably.

Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: To buy bracelets, bangles, lockets, necklaces, rings, earrings, and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Makhpiret

texts.ru: Махпирет 24 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Махпирет - высшее образование, работает в почте. Махпирет в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Махпирет, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 головы крупного рогатого скота, а также 11 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Махпирет обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки бычка. Доходы от кредита Махпирет планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также намерена улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Makhpiret is 24 years old, married and is raising two kids with her husband. Makhpiret has a college degree and works for the post office. As a supplemental income Makhpiret raises cattle. She started 5 years ago by purchasing cattle with 15,000 som (KGS. Due to her dilligent work Makhpiret now owns 4 cows and 11 sheep/goats, which yields a monthly profit of 15,000 som (KGS). In order to expand her business Makhpiret has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS). She will use the loan to buy a calf. The profits from this venture will be used to buy more animals and so improve the well-being of Makhpiret's family.

loans.use: to by goby

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмон житель севера страны - района Спитамен. Ему 30 лет. Он живет с женой, матерью, отцом и четырьмя братьями. Отец находится в России на заработках, двое его братьев работают в строительной бригаде. Сам Абдурахмон работает в частном дилерском центре. Он собирается открыть собственный семейный бизнес. Абдурахмон планирует заняться куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. У него есть сбережение в размере 3000 таджикских сомони. Чтобы закупить скот он нуждается в кредите. Абдурахмон просит кредит для приобретения двух голов крупнорогатого скота и корма и начать бизнес. Он планирует откармливать скот в течение 60 дней и затем реализовать на скотном рынке района, который находится недалеко от его дома. Таким образом у него не будут транспортных расходов при реализации скота. Данный бизнес будет приносить ему хорошую прибыль, который он будет использовать на развитие самого бизнеса.
texts.en: Abdurahmon lives in the north region of the country, the Spitamen region. He is 30 years old and lives with his wife, mother, father and four brothers. His father is working in Russia and two of his brother's work on a construction team. Abdurahmon himself works in a private business center. He wants to open his own business. Abdurahmon plants to start reselling cattle. He has saved 3000 somoni but needs more money to start his venture. Abdurahmon is requesting a loan to purchase two heads of cattle and fodder. He plans to feed the animals for 30 days and then resell them at the livestock market, which is located near his home. That will allow him to save on transportation costs for his animals.
