This business will give him a good profit and he plans to continually invest in expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase two heads of cattle and feeds for them, so he can start his business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta  es madre soltera vive en casa de un familiar con su hijo, su madre y sus abuelos, es una mujer  emprendedora  con ganas  de salir  adelante en su trabajo, ella tiene un negocio de  venta  de comida  en una zona de mucho comercio tiene mucha clientela pues vende los platos de comida a buen precio y es muy amable a la hora de vender, ella solicita financiamiento  para capital  de trabajo quiere  comprar productos  para  preparar alimentos como carnes, pollos, arroz, frutas, verduras, etc. pues le es más cómodo la compra por mayor de esa manera es como ella desea  poder mejorar  su calidad de vida .
texts.en: The client is a single mother who lives in a family member's home with her son, her mother and her grandparents. She is an enterprising woman with a desire to move forward with her work. She has a business selling food in a high-commerce area, and she has a lot of customers since she sells her meals at a good price and is very friendly. She is requesting the loan to purchase products likes meat, chicken, rice, fruits, vegetables and other items to prepare her meals, since she gets better prices when she buys wholesale. In this way she hopes to be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, rice, fruits, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Guadalupe de 30 años de edad, vive en casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Doña Guadalupe posee una tienda desde hace 6 años, Ella comercializa sus productos  en su domicilio, es una persona que se caracteriza por su amabilidad y cortesía a la hora de atender su negocio, por esta razón ha logrado una clientela que demanda sus productos de esta manera es como  solventa algunas de sus necesidades familiares, doña Guadalupe solicita un crédito para surtir un poco mas su tienda comprando  granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, golosinas, etc. para obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Guadalupe is 30 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and their two children. She has had a general store for six years, selling products out of her home. She is a person known for her kindness and courtesy when it comes to business, and for this reason she has a customer base that demands her products. This is how she covers some family necessities. Guadalupe is requesting the loan to stock her store a little more, purchasing basic grains, oil, sugar, snacks and other products to obtain better profits and to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, oil, sugar, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Tujumuike Group

texts.en: MOHAMEDI, who is in his early 20s, is married. For six years now, MOHAMEDI has been running a clothes business selling second hand clothes. He works from 6 am to 6 pm each working day and is able to make a good return per month. From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is MOHAMEDI's third loan request, which he will use to purchase more clothes to resell. With the previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, he managed to improve his business by purchasing more clothes. His business profit, used to cover his home expenses, bought land. He used part of his profit to cover his marriage expenses. MOHAMEDI dreams that one day he will be able to own a big business and build a house. He will share this loan with his loan group "Tujumuike", which consist of nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. Letecia is married and has a business buying and selling appliances in the Philippines.

Letecia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of appliances to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more appliances to sell

loans.name: Valijon

texts.en: Valijon is 21 years old and lives with his parents in the south of Tajikistan. His living place has a wonderful nature and he likes to live there. He began his own business one year ago. He drives a taxi and serves local clients. He is not married and has no children. He covers their living expenses. He wants to develop his business and maximize his profit. With the profit, he is going to improve his living conditions. He is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy a new car. He is a hardworking and diligent man.

loans.use: To buy a new car for his taxi business

loans.name: Wilian Alexander

texts.es:
Wilian de 40 años de edad, estudio sexto grado,  es acompañado, su compañera de vida se dedica a trabajar también con pollos de engorde y gallinas ponedoras, ellos tienen 2 hijos uno de ellos no estudia y vive con una tía, el segundo si estudia 4to grado y tiene13 años de edad. Además de su hijo y su compañera de vida con él viven sus padres.
   
Él trabaja en la explotación, cría de pollos de engorde del cual obtiene sus ingresos para la subsistencia de su familia, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, aprendió este trabajo pues sus tíos se dedicaron a lo mismo por mucho tiempo y él les ayudaba a darle todo el manejo que requiere,  fue como aprendió bien y vio que era una actividad que podía generarle ingresos y salir adelante. También se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos (frijol y maíz) que es otra actividad económica, antes de ser productor él trabajaba haciendo ladrillo de barro y también  vendía diario por las calles de la ciudad, en el trabajo que realiza le ayuda su compañera de vida, su hijo menor y su madre.

   El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 100 pollos porqué el que tiene, en poco tiempo lo sacara a la venta y no quiere quedarse sin producto, además;  comprara 12 quintales de concentrado, 6 de inicio y 6 de finalización  lo que es suficiente para sacar el producto a la venta. El financiamiento le ayudara a que tenga más ingresos y dar así lo más básico a su familia en cuanto a alimentación, salud, educación y vivienda, la necesidad de comprar más pollos y seguir trabajando.

Dice que más adelante,  desearía obtener un crédito más grande con la fundación y  cancelar todos los créditos que tiene y con lo que le sobre ampliar sus galeras, ponerle un techo adecuado para que no se le mojen los pollos; ya que de alguna manera cuando se le mojan le causa estrés al animal y no gana el peso requerido. Por otra parte, él quiere fraguar dos habitaciones de su casa que tienen piso de tierra para tener mejor comodidad para su familia.
texts.en:
Wilian is 40 years old, he studied until the 6th grade and he is in a common-law marriage. His life partner also works with meat production chickens and egg-laying hens. Together they have 2 children, one of them is not studying and lives with an aunt, the second one is studying 4th grade and is 13 years old. Aside from his son and his life partner, his parents live with him.

Wilian earns an income for his family's sustenance by farming and raising meat production chickens. He has been working this way for 3 years and he learned this skill from his uncles who worked in this same farming branch for a long time. He used to help them manage the work and this is how he learned well and realized that in this way he could earn an income to get ahead. He also works farming basic grains (beans and corn). Before becoming a farmer, Wilian worked making clay bricks which he sold daily on the city streets. His life partner, his mother and his youngest son help him with his current farm work.

He requests the loan in order to purchase 100 chickens since the ones he currently has will soon be ready for sale and he doesn't want to be without product. He also hopes to invest the loan in purchasing 12 quintales (1 quintal = 100 kg) of concentrate feed, 6 of a starter formula and 6 of a finishing formula which should be enough to get his product ready for sale. The funding will help him have greater income and in this way help fulfill his family's most basic needs such as food, health, education and housing. He needs to purchase more chickens and to continue working.

Wilian says that in the future, he wishes to obtain a larger loan and with those funds settle all his loans. With the leftovers he would enlarge his chicken coops and improve the roof so that his chickens don't get wet. When the chickens get wet they become stressed and don't gain weight appropriately. On the other hand, he would like improve his family's comfort by building up two rooms in his house which have dirt floors.

loans.use: to purchase 100 chickens and 12 quintales (1 quintal = 100 kg) of concentrate feed, 6 of a starter formula and 6 of a finishing formula

loans.name: Whyea

texts.en: Whyea is 26 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with four children aged between 3 months old and 10 years old. Only three are attending school and live at home. She has been selling palm oil, beans, rice, garlic, etc for the past three years. She says her main challenge is the transportation costs. She started this business with money given to her by her father and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her money and what makes her proud is that it enables her to take care of her children. She is requesting this loan to purchase more palm oil, beans, rice, garlic etc to enlarge her business. She plans to build a house for her children in the future. She would like to thank the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, beans, rice, garlic etc to sell

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Jariatu is in her early 40s and married with two children between the ages of 3 years and 18 years. She runs a domestic product business in Tombo, in the western rural area of Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business since the rebel war and sells a variety of food containers within her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is her improper business location.

Jariatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more sets of pans and various food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her living status. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more pans and food containers for resale.

loans.name: Anielka Karina

texts.es:
Anielka Karina es una joven de 26 años, originaria de la calle real del municipio de Larreynaga, soltera que se ha dedicado a cuidar a sus padres y llevarles el sustento, estudió la carrera de Lengua y Literatura y se desempeña como profesora de secundaria en la escuela de la comunidad de las Mojarras la cual queda a 40 km de distancia y para estar puntual tiene que levantarse a las 4 de la mañana para abordar el microbús que viaja hacia ese lugar.
Anielka ha sido una hija bien responsable que a pesar de ser soltera ha estado al pendiente de sus padres a quienes les agradece su vida y educación.
Actualmente se presentó a la oficina de Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito con el fin de mejorar la salud de su papá con el cual pretende comprar medicamentos, pago de consultas médicas y realización de exámenes.
Sabe que los inversionistas de Kiva a poyan a las personas de escasos recursos de toda Nicaragua y tal es su caso que por su bajo salario no puede cubrir estos gastos altos, confía en Dios y en estas personas de buen corazón que apoyarán su solicitud donde les quedará eternamente agradecida.
texts.en:
Anielka Karina is 26 years old and comes from La Calle Real in the town of Larreynaga. She is single and devotes herself to caring for her parents and providing them with a livelihood. She is studying toward a degree in Languages and Literature and teaches secondary school in the community of Las Mojarras, 40 km away. To arrive on time, she must get up at 4 in the morning to take the microbus that goes there. 

Anielka has been a very responsible daughter. Though she is single, she has been attentive to her parents, to whom she is thankful for her life and education. She has come to the Ceprodel office to request a loan for the purpose of improving her father's health. With this loan, she intends to buy medicines, pay for medical appointments, and pay for exams. 

She knows that the Kiva investors support people with limited resources from all over Nicaragua, and her case is such that, due to her low salary, she is unable to cover these large expenses. She trusts in God and in these good-hearted people who will support her request. She will be eternally grateful.

loans.use: to buy medicines, pay for medical appointments and exams

loans.name: Claveles Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CLAVELES”  iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Florencia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de carne, elaboración de empanada, ayudante de minibús, venta de papa, venta de chuño y papa, venta de CD’s.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Florencia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás, compensando con la venta de papa, con el pasar del tiempo amplio su negocio y comenzó a vender verduras.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra verduras) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas a la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y lo servicios en salud.
texts.en:
The Claveles Group is starting its eighth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Regional Hub. It is made up of eight members, and is managed by a board of directors of which Florencia is president. The members' businesses are varied, and their activities include selling clothing, selling meat, making empanadas [small filled pastries], working as a minibus assistant, selling potatoes and potato starch, and selling CDs.

The Group's loan will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, including Florencia. She says that this is her first time as a member of Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a friend, who is a partner in the organization. Florencia currently has a business selling vegetables. She started it several years ago, initially selling potatoes. Over time she expanded her business, and began to sell vegetables. 

The loan she will receive is to increase her capital by buying vegetables. She will purchase these in markets around the city of El Alto, and later sell them in her retail space. Working in this way allows her to generate income to support her household as well as possible. She lives with her partner and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and health services.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Antonina works hard to support her family. She has a vegetables and spices vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Antonina is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables and spices to sell to her customers.

Antonina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Neli

texts.es: Neli nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive  junto con su familia en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 51 años de edad y tiene dos hijos, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la elaboración de textiles como por ejemplo chompas, chalinas, mantas y otras cosas más, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Llapallanchis Llankasunchis” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar lana, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Neli was born in the city of Paucartambo and lives there together with her family. She is 51 years old and has two children. Neli is a hardworking and entrepreneurial person who moves her family forward with her hard work.

She makes money primarily by crafting textiles such as sweaters, scarves, blankets and other items. She is a responsible person, and for this reason she was invited to be part of the communal bank “Llapallanchis Llankasunchis.” She needs the loan to buy wool. She is grateful for the loan and values it, and promises to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is a 45-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children and equally responsible for all of them. 
She belongs to an ultra poor family; that is why she cannot afford educational expenses. Most of her children are doing jobs as laborers on daily wages. One of her sons goes with his father to help him in his business. Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he provides the services of welding. He also provides door-to-door services to his customers. Due to the increase in iron prices, he is unable to buy sufficient welding material such as welding and soldering rods, etc. to carry on his business.

To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise, he needs some capital to buy welding material. Zahida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he would be able to buy material to carry on with his business. Zahida is very glad and thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy welding material such as soldering and welding rods and iron sheets for the manufacturing business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 31-years-old and has four children. Marites is married; all four children are in school. Marites is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in the pig fattening business for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Rugiatu is 35-years-old and married with five children between the ages of three and 18 years. She runs a domestic products business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business before she got married and sells a variety of food containers in her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is improper business location.

Rugiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more plates and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her status of living. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more plates and a variety of food containers for resale for her home products business.

loans.name: Watta

texts.en: Watta is 37-years-old and operates a table selling goods such as oil, rice, salt, vita, etc. in the Paynesville south area of Liberia. It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. She is an unmarried woman with three children between nine and 16 years. For the past two years, she has been selling oil, rice, salt, vita, etc in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother, she enjoys her business because the business gives her more money. She sells six days in a week, from 7 am to 6 pm, and most of the time she uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, salt, vita etc for her business. She plans to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, salt, vita etc for her food market business.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 43-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been manufacturing bearings for vehicles using die molds for many years. He buys steel scrap material from the market and puts it into high temperatures to melt it. The raw material melts under high temperature, and then he injects it into the dies to shape it. In this way he manufactures the bearings. He sells them in the market and makes enough income to contribute to his family's livelihood.

Shamim has three children and she barely manages to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide them with good food, health, and education. She needs to earn additional income to support her family well. She is in her third loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan. Currently, she has requested a loan to buy more raw materials for manufacturing so that her husband can increase his sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

She is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy steel to manufacture bearings for vehicles.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jonelyn

texts.en: Jonelyn is 31-years-old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell. Jonelyn has borrowed and repaid eleven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years. She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 42 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Clara is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Clara requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Clara has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Clara would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Juliet from the Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children aged between 7 and 18 years old. Two of her children attend school. 

Juliet runs a food stand business at home; she sells rice, tomatoes and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business since just after the war. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Juliet says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient finance to expand her business.

Juliet has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items, such as rice, tomatoes and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items, such as rice, tomatoes and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Abdulla

texts.en:
Abdulla is 54-years-old, married, and father of three children. In September, he will make the wedding ceremony for his two sons. Abdulla is a very hard worker who does a lot to earn a living. By profession he is a teacher. Now he is retired and prepares the school-children for university. 

For many years, Abdulla has worked in an agricultural business. He used to buy and sell cows, buying them cheap and then turning them over at a higher price to make a profit. Now he has managed to build and keep a stable for the cows, and it is for this reason that Abdulla is requesting a loan for the first time in order to purchase cattle. He also claims that he has been the only one who has financially supported his family.

loans.use: To purchase cattle for raising and reselling.

loans.name: Simple

texts.en: Simple is a farmer in kaburaishokye rural Ibanda. He does cattle fattening as his main source of income. Simple is married with six children, four of them are still schooling. However, he has a challenge to raise enough income to improve his farming. He therefore wants the loan to buy more cows for fattening to later sell at a profit.

loans.use: To buy cattle for fattening to later resell.

loans.name: Hadji

texts.en: Hadji is 35 years old. He is married with three young children aged 3, 8, and 9. He has worked as a master welder for over 10 years. Hadji works with his father. He is a very successful master in his village. He has enough clients who appreciate his work. From the beginning of his marriage, he and his family lived with his parents. At last he was able to buy land and begin construction of their home. He is now in need of cash to buy building materials and continue to build a house so that he can move there to live with his family.

loans.use: To buy building materials and continue to build a house so that he can move there to live with his family.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 46 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Analyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming vegetables for nine years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 57-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling and purchasing animals for the past four years. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, raises them, and then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She has now requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. 

Fatima hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is in her late thirties and is married with two children, aged 10 and 13 years old. She runs a fish business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to strive for her daily bread. 

Mariama has been in this business since just after she got married, and sells fish within her community. She says that at present she is facing insufficient capital to run her business and transportation problems.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish to resell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take good care of her family. In the future, she would like to buy a boat for her husband. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Kadaitu from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married to a fisherman and blessed with three children between the ages five years and 18 years. Two of her children attend school. 

Kadiatu runs a food stand business at home; she sells rice, onions and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business just after her wedding. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Kadaitu says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient finance to expand her business.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items such as rice, tomato paste and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a big table. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items such as rice, tomato paste and cooking seasoning for her food market activity.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu is 40 years old and lives in the Paynesville South area of Liberia. It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options.  

Bendu is married with two children aged 11 and 19. They both live at home and only one is currently attending school. 

Before getting into business, Bendu finished the 11th grade. For the past ten years she has been selling fish, frozen chickens, and oil in the local market. She started this business by selling for her mother. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money. She sells six days a week spending ten hours at her business. She mostly uses a taxi to get her goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish, frozen chickens, and oil for her business. She plans to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, frozen chickens and oil for her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Isatu from the Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children, aged 6 and 18 years old.  

In 2010, Isatu established her cookery business. She began her business because she wants to create income to educate her children since she did not go to school. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a lack of enough capital to operate her business.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase rice, cooking seasonings and palm oil to expand her cookery business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Isatu plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking seasonings and palm oil to expand her cookery business.

loans.name: Tazeem

texts.en:
Tazeem is a 45-year-old married woman. 

She has been running a business buying and selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices, near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. 

In order to improve her business, she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives in the village of Haykavan which is in the region of Armavir. She lives with her husband and three children.

Gohar works at local factory with her two daughters, but tries to help her husband around their farm as well. Gohar and her family own a farm which includes two pigs and piglets. Near the village where they live, Gohar also owns an orchard where cucumbers, tomatoes, eggplant and peppers are cultivated. As father of the family, Gohar's husband works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it locally.
 
In order to tackle financial difficulties, Gohar would like to enlarge their farming business. By applying for this loan, Gohar wants to purchase three oxen and forage for feeding them. The loan is very important for this hard working family.

loans.use: to buy three oxen and forage for feeding them.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Ruth from Liberia. She lives in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia. The area is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County, with one of the best standards of living in the country. Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options makes Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live.
 
Ruth is married with four children, aged between 9 and 20. Three of her children currently attend school and they are all living with her in her home. 

She runs a business selling fashion clothes, such as blouses, t-shirts and jeans etc. She describes herself as a serious businesswoman. She started her business 15 years ago, using money given to her husband. Typically, she works in her business from 7am to 6pm from Monday to Saturday, and she transports her goods to her business by bus. She cites her greatest challenge as small capital. She is proud of her business because it supports her home.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase more fashion clothes such as blouses, t-shirts and jeans for her business. In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children. She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes for her business, such as blouses, t-shirts and jeans etc.

loans.name: Saed

texts.en:
Saed is a 20-year-old single man from Jenin. His father works as a blacksmith in his workshop. 

Saed is a student in a local university where he studies Communication Engineering. It is a very good specialization and Saed likes it, but it costs a lot because of the high university fees. Saed took a $1,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university fees for this semester. This will inable Saed to complete his study and find a good job in the future.
 
Saed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay his university fees for this semester.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a widow with three children, two of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. 

She has a business of selling used bed sheets, and has been in this business for 13 years. She works at the market seven days out of every week, and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. Sylvia aspires of becoming a wholesaler and also to get enough profits to build commercial premises. She lives in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

Sylvia has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDTSACCO to buy more bales of used bed sheets.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used bed sheets.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 30-year-old married woman who works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for two years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. 

When Saima was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Saima felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working on her own. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but now she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. 

So, Saima requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in various colors. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Farha

texts.en:
Farha is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband, who assists her by purchasing stock from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Farha is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs. 15,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages for her general store.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been running a business buying and selling animals for the past four years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation]. Uzma has now requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 35 years old and is married with three children, aged between 1 and 18 years old. She runs a palm oil business in the Jui Eastern area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to earn a living. 

She has been in this business since 2010, and sells palm oil within a busy market area. She says that at present her business is doing well because out of the profit she was able to take care of her family.

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and roof her house before the rainy season. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Seedan

texts.en:
Seedan is a 56-year-old married woman. Twenty years ago, she initiated a business of ‘tandoor’ (clay oven used for cooking in North India and Pakistan). She cooks chapattis and naan for the people of her community and also takes orders from nearby hotels. In this way she makes enough money to have a decent life.  

Seedan is a mother of four and is motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

It is her sixth year with Kashf Foundation, and she is happily running her business with the support of it. Now, she has requested a loan of Rs. 55,000 to purchase sacks of flour, and packs of salt and oil. It will help her to inflate her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, and packs of salt and oil for her tandoor business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase ladies' fabrics in order to be able to continue her business.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has 3 years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock from the market from the contacts she has made over the years. 

Tasleem is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy a sack of rice, sugar and flour to meet with the increasing demand at her shop. 

She is in her 6th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Barotali

texts.ru:
Баротали из гостеприимного района Яван. Ему 47 лет. Он из тех людей, в котором нуждается общество. Свое детство он провел там же, любимое его занятие было работа на огороде, в котором трудился со своими родителями. Его родители были простыми дехканами таким, и вырос сам Баротали. Он женат, имеет шестеро детей. У него трое сыновей в возрасте 18, 16, 13 лет и трое дочерей в возрасте 15, 7 и 3 года. 
Баротали в течение 6 лет занимается выращиванием огородных культур. Ему нравится честным трудом зарабатывать на жизнь. Он просит кредит для повторного посева. Ему необходимо приобрести семена овощей и обработать землю. Баротали недавно переехал со своей семьей в новопостроенный дом. За счет прибыли с продажи урожая он хочет приобрести домашние принадлежности.
texts.en:
Barotali is from a hospitable region of Yavan. He is 47 years old. He is one of those people whom the society needs. He spent his childhood in the same place and his favorite thing to do was to spend time in the garden where he worked with his parents. Barotali's parents where simple farmers like whom he became himself. He is married and has six children. He has three sons of the age of eighteen, sixteen and thirteen and three daughters of the age of fifteen, seven and three.

Barotali has been cultivating garden crops for six years. He likes to make a living by doing honest work. He is asking for a loan for the second sowing. He needs to buy vegetable seeds and to cultivate the land. Barotali has recently moved with his family to a newly built house. He wants to use the profit from the sale of the harvest to buy household goods.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds and cultivate the land.

loans.name: Almira

texts.ru: Альмире 49 лет. Совместно с супругом воспитывают двоих детей. В 2003 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле сотовыми телефонами, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 20,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Альмира имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, супруги смогли купить магазин в центре города. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Альмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Альмира планирует вложить в увеличение и расширение своего бизнеса, а также улучшить материальное благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Almira is 49 years old. Together with her husband they are raising two children. In 2003 the spouses started a business selling mobile phones using an amount of 20,000 som (KGS) as a starting capital. They were able to build the business and have regular customers. Almira has an average monthly income in the amount of 20,000 KGS. Because of her hard work in the business the spouses where able to buy a store in the town's center. With the goal to further grow and expand their business Almira has come to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som to increase the sale of goods. Almira plans to invest the income from the loan into growth and expansion of her business and also improve the financial situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones in wholesale for resale.

loans.name: Bibiasmoa

texts.ru:
Бибиасмоа женщина с доброй душой. Она стремится к светлому будущему и верит в лучшее. Ей 37 лет, она живет с мужем и детьми в маленьком районе Кумсангир. Ее дети это смысл всей ее жизни. Все что она делает все ради них. Бибиасмоа опытный скотовод. Она в течение 10 лет разводит крупнорогатый скот мясной и молочной породы для дальнейшей продажи. Сейчас в ее хозяйстве только одна корова с теленком. Ей нужно увеличить поголовье скота для развития бизнеса. С такой целью она обратилась за кредитом. 
Бибиасмоа за счет прибыли хочет отремонтировать свой дом и сыграть свадьбу старшего сына. Она мечтает принять в дом невестку и увидеть лица внуков.
texts.en:
Bibiasmoa is a woman with a kind soul. She seeks to have a bright future and believes in good. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband and children in a small region of Kumsangir. Her children are the meaning of all of her life. Everything she does is for their sake. Bibiasmoa is an experienced cattle keeper. During the ten years she has been breeding large horned cattle for meat and milk and future resale. Right now there's only one cow and a calf in her business. She needs to increase the headcount of cattle and grow her business. She has come for a loan with this purpose.

Bibiasmoa wants to repair her home and hold a wedding for her oldest son using the profit. She dreams to accept her daughter-in-law into her home and see the faces of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy six heads of large horned cattle and increase the headcount of livestock and growth of business.

loans.name: Emmelyn

texts.en:
Emmelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling root crops in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional root crops to sell for her business.

Emmelyn has been in this business for eight years. She earns additional income from a general store and food-vending.

Emmelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional root crops to sell.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 23-year-old single man who has been working in the construction business, specializing in cement work, for the past seven years. 

Mohamad is a hard worker who puts a lot of effort into developing and expanding his business. To widen his working zone, Mohamad needs a car to facilitate his transportation and transport his tools from one place to another. For this reason, he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a car that will facilitate his business transportation and expand his working zone.

Mohamad hopes to keep on supporting and expanding his business in a well-managed way.

loans.use: To buy a car to facilitate his transportation and transport his tools from one place to another.

loans.name: Jenepher

texts.en:
Jenepher is 36 years old and married with three children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jenepher has a tobacco retail business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more tobacco for resell.

Jenepher has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jenepher would like to save enough money so she can rent a space at a public market.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco for resell.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia, a sus 34 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Inició su propio negocio con el interés de generar sus ingresos por cuenta propia, por esta razón montó una papelería y café internet, aprovechando la ventaja de estar ubicado frente a un colegio; trabaja sola todos los días de la semana de 7:00 am a 6:00 pm, desde hace 3 años. Así ha logrado obtener los recursos necesarios para aportar a la economía del hogar. La cliente es una mujer luchadora y enérgica, trabaja con dedicación y mucho esfuerzo para darle a sus hijos el mejor bienestar posible. Actualmente solicita el crédito con la intención de invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (vitrina y estantería) y surtido (cuadernos, lapiceros, marcadores, block, cartulina, carpetas, colores, entre otros), esto le permitirá cambiar la imagen de su negocio para que permita atraer más clientes, además tendrá más variedad de productos disponibles para satisfacer la demanda y los diversos gustos de la clientela; de esta manera Nidia espera poder aumentar sus ventas y poder avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es ser reconocida en el sector por la calidad y el buen servicio que presta, así podrá fortalecer su negocio y tendrá la solvencia económica para brindar a sus hijos una excelente educación y mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Nidia, 34, has two children and lives with her partner. She wanted to start a business to generate her own income and three years ago she opened a stationery store / internet cafe, taking advantage of the location opposite a school. She works alone every day of the week from 7am to 6pm. Nidia has managed to obtain the resources necessary for her to contribute to their household economy. 

She is a feisty and energetic woman, who is dedicated to her business and works hard to give her children the best possible comfort. Nidia is currently seeking this loan to invest in the purchase of fixed assets (cabinets and shelves) and stock (notebooks, pens, markers, blocks, cardboard, binders, crayons, etc.). This will allow her to transform the image of her business and help attract more customers. She will also offer a wider variety of products to meet the demand and diverse tastes of her customers.

Nidia hopes to increase her sales and progress toward achieving her greatest dream, which is to be recognized in the industry for providing high quality and good service. She wants to strengthen her business and build the financial ability to give her children an excellent education and better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fixed assets (cabinets & shelves) and stock (notebooks, pens, markers, blocks, cardboard, binders, crayons, etc.)

loans.name: Gilma

texts.es:
Gilma tiene 65 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos y lamentablemente quedó viuda tras el fallecimiento de su esposo hace algunos años. Toda su vida productiva la dedicó a trabajar en el campo de las confecciones, como empleada en diversas empresas y luego de jubilarse, montó su propio negocio con la idea de seguir generando ingresos para solventar los gastos básicos de su hogar y para estar siempre ocupada sintiéndose útil. Inició una tienda de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicada en la casa donde vive, allí atiende de Lunes a Domingo, aprovechando que vive en una zona residencial y tiene muchos clientes. 
Gilma es una señora pujante y trabajadora, manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir trabajando, además es apasionada por su labor, pues disfruta más la vida sintiéndose útil. Ella solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor ( (productos lácteos, galletería, huevos, granos, productos de aseo, entre otros), así tendrá más variedad de artículos disponibles para ofrecer a sus clientes, satisfaciendo sus gustos y necesidades; esto se reflejará en el aumento de sus ventas y de sus ingresos, con lo que podrá seguir pagando sus gastos mensuales y además tendrá la posibilidad de darle continuidad y acreditación a su negocio y generando más ingresos que le permitan mejorar sus condiciones de vida y su bienestar personal.
texts.en:
Gilma, 65, has three children. Unfortunately, she became a widow some years ago. She worked all her life for different companies in the clothing industry. When she retired, she started a business with the intention to continue generating income to cover the home expenses and to have an activity that would make her feel busy and useful. She opened a grocery store at home. She works Monday to Sunday; she has many customers and makes the most of her location in a residential area.

Gilma is a persistent and hardworking woman. She says that her age is not an obstacle for her to continue working. Besides, she is passionate about her job and feeling useful makes her enjoy life more. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies in bulk (dairy products, cookies, eggs, grains, cleaning products, etc.). This way, she will have a wider variety to offer her customers and satisfy their needs and tastes. This will result in more sales and a better income, which will help her cover her monthly expenses. She will also be able to continue working with her business and to improve its reputation. A higher income means well-being and better living conditions for her.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk, such as dairy products, cookies, eggs, grains and cleaning products.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
A married mother of three, 40-year-old Lydia resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia, Liberia  It is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County and has one of the best standards of living in the country.  Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options make Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live. 


Lydia runs a table business selling lappa (African clothes mostly used by women) in the local market.  Describing herself as a serious businesswoman, she started her enterprise two years ago, using money given by her mother.  Lydia typically works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. from Monday to Saturday, transporting her goods to the market by bus.  She cites her greatest challenge as small capital reserves. 



Proud of her business because it supports her home, Lydia has requested this loan to purchase more lappa to resell.  In the future, she plans to build her house.  She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (women's clothes) to resell.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Amélé est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle habite avec sa famille à Lomé. Pour apporter sa contribution financière aux charges du ménage, elle a entamé le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale, elle a ouvert à cet effet une boutique, elle s'approvisionne à Lomé. Son stock est en baisse et voudrait s'approvisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un troisième crédit pour l'achat de divers produits d'alimentation générale. Elle voudrait assurer l’éducation de ses enfants et créer d’autres boutiques.
texts.en:
Amélé is a married mother of two children. She lives with her family in Lomé. To make a financial contribution to household expenses, she began trading grocery products, and opened a shop to that effect. She gets her supplies in Lome.

Her stock supply is decreasing and she would like to resupply, which is why she is requesting a third loan from WAGES to purchase various grocery products.

She would like to ensure her children's education and open up other shops.

loans.use: Buy grocery items

loans.name: Mayliah

texts.en: Mayliah is 30 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 2 and 10. She runs a domestic product business in Tombo Western, a rural area in Sierra Leone. One of her children is going to school. She's been in this business since 2008, and she sells rubber bowls, sets of pans, and plates in her community. She says that the main problem with her business is its improper business location. Mayliah applied for this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more rubber bowls and sets of pans and a variety of food containers for resale. She says the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and change her status of living. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rubber bowls and sets of pans and a variety of food containers to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: As a married parent of seven children, Lilia works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming rice. Lilia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell. Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Simion

texts.en: Simion is a 65-year-old business man. He is married to Jacinta. They are blessed with eleven grown-up children. Simon has been selling charcoal for the past 44 years and has a monthly income of KES 33,800, which he uses to support his family. Simion also doubles as a seller of cereals, a business which supplements his income.  Simion is applying for his first loan from KADET, after having been introduced by an existing KADET client. He will use the loan to buy more charcoal. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will raise the living standards of his family. His hopes and dreams are to run a successful charcoal business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 48 years old, and she operates a table in the market selling goods, including oil, rice, coal and pepper, in the Paynesville South area of Liberia. It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most heavily populated areas in Montserrado County. The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county, with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. She is married and has seven children between 20 and 33 years old. For the past two years, she has been in this business. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She enjoys her business because it earns her more money. She sells six days a week, from 7 AM to 4 PM. She is applying for a loan to buy more goods to sell in her business, such as oil, rice, coal and pepper. She plans to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell, such as oil, rice, coal and pepper.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher is a 28-year-old married father of three children who works as a barber to make a  living and provide his family with a good standard of living. Maher is not a Lebanese citizen. He is a nomadic Arab of unspecified nationality, like others living in Lebanon whose ancestors came to Lebanon illegally a long time ago and didn't register with the Lebanese government. He can't benefit from any official Lebanese governmental jobs or formal working sectors, but he can do his job and live freely in Lebanon, since he is not making any trouble. Maher is well known in his region, with a good reputation and special experience in his domain, which is why he intends to expand his business by acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase the number of beauty products he offers and to begin offering special men’s facial treatments. He hopes to keep on developing his business, because it is the only thing he is experienced in doing, and it is very important for his family's education and lifestyle.

loans.use: to expand his business by increasing the number of beauty products he offers and beginning to offer special men's facial treatments.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem, age 49, is a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community. She has eight years of experience in this field. She offers a variety of groceries and stationery. She has built up a regular list of customers and makes enough to support her family. She wants to grow her business, so she applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of biscuits, oil and beverages, as well as packets of paper and pens. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a stock of biscuits, oil and beverages, as well as packets of copies and pens, for her store.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been running a business buying and selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices and raises them, and then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business. Currently she has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid lives with his wife and their two children. For the last two years, Vahid has earned a living growing and selling tomatoes and cucumbers. He sells the plants in the market, which is near his home, and is able to cover some of his household expenses with the profits he makes. Vahid is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, tomato seedlings and the like, so he can continue with his crops, which are his only source of work. This will give him a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, tomato seedlings and the like for his business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 40 years old, married, and has five children.  She is from the Jui eastern area in Freetown. In 2003, Marie established her local food business. She began her business because she wants to take care of her family's welfare.   She works from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM, seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and the high cost of transportation.

Marie is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase cassava, sweet potatoes and bananas to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Marie plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava, sweet potatoes, and bananas

loans.name: Rihana

texts.en: Rihana is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of seven. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing this for many years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and others in the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy threads in different colors, along with packs of zippers, buttons and elastic, to meet the increasing demand of her customers. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy threads in different colors, zippers, buttons, and elastic.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 19-year-old single man who has been working as a barber for the past three years with ten years of experience in this domain. He didn't continue his school studies because of his family's needs for a breadwinner.
 
Through his previous loan, he increased the stock of hair treatments, creams, facials and after shaves to provide a wide variety for his customers to buy. These products were an extra source of income he relied on a lot in addition to what he gets for haircuts. 

His customers are mostly his friends, neighbors and relatives. He is working hard to keep on expanding and developing his working through opening a wider beauty therapy salon specializing in men’s facial treatments.

He is a hard worker who puts a lot of effort into improving and expanding his business, to make sure that his customers are pleased. Ali is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to do special electricity maintenance to his shop and his house.

loans.use: To do special electricity maintenance to his shop and his house

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is motivated to provide all life’s conveniences to her family members. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She offers variety of goods for daily use, including groceries and cleaning products. She has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store, and she makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store better stocked, she has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000, which she will use to buy grains, oil and sugar. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of grains, oil and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 50-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children. 

Five years ago, she started a business selling clothes. By this time, she has become famous among her neighbors for her collections and she has a good client list. 

Currently, she availed herself of a second loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase good-quality clothes, in different colors and designs. She hopes to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would help her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality clothes, in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. 

Fifteen years ago she decided to start a stitching business at her home to meet her household expenditures. She is expert in stitching fine clothes. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

Due to lack of funds, however, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She contacted to Kashf Foundation for loan of PKR 35,000. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including cloth, threads in different colors and packs of laces and zippers. It’s her third year with Kahf Foundation and she has shown good repayment behavior. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, threads in different colors and packs of laces and zippers.

loans.name: Shura

texts.en:
Shura is a widow and works hard to cover her family's basic costs. She is a devoted mother and grandmother from Zartonq village. 

She lives with her family and is engaged in agriculture. She keeps cows and pigs and cultivates tomato and eggplant. The gathered harvest she sells in local markets and gets income that is very important for her family's living.
 
By applying for this loan, Shura wants to purchase forage for feeding her livestock. The grass that she cultivates is not enough for feeding animals, so she needs to purchase forage.

Shura is sure that years of hard work will bring her the farm of her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Rutooma Women Group

texts.en:
Ajjara is 45 years old. Her husband divorced her and left her with three children to look after. From her hard work she has managed to educate her children. Some of the children have reached secondary level. 

She has been dealing in a retail shop and has a banana plantation to add to her income.

She has requested the loan to continue educating her children and to buy insecticides for her banana plantation. She took a loan of UGX 500,000 to help her to top up on school fees and buy some insecticide.    

Her major challenge is banana wilts, which destroy her plantation, and the competition in retail is stiff, so it does not yield much in terms of income to sustain the family needs.     

Her major dream is to restore back her banana plantation, which is almost getting finished due to wilt, by pruning and planting fresh wilt-free  bananas.

loans.use: To top up on the children's tuition. and buy insecticides.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is a 31-year-old, married woman. She is quite a motivated woman and always wants to do something for the betterment of her family. She has only one child who is school-going. 

Four years ago, she initiated her business of cloth sales. She buys cloths of different fabrics, in various colors and designs, from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough money through her business. 

Fareeda is requesting a PKR 35,000 loan from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs, to attract more customers and expand her inventory.  

She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. Fareeda expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past five years with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy reels of threads in different colors with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Farhat dreams of her children's bright future.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Edith's Group

texts.en:
The group is called "Edith's Group" and it is composed of five women entrepreneurs who are seeking better opportunities to move on in life. They live in the city of Accra, a beautiful place where trading is very popular and well established.

They sell bags, plantain, charcoal, jeans, underwear and jewelry.

This is their first loan with Kiva and the fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana.

One of the members, Edith, has been in the group for the past three years and has established a good friendship with all her neighbors and friends. She likes the fact that all the members of the group are united and much like a family.

Edith, 51, is married and has three dependent children who are staying with them. She rents the house she lives in and her husband is a businessman who works so hard to support her.

For five years, Edith has been selling bags. She sells throughout the week by walking to her customers.

She plans to use the new loan amount of GHS 1,400 to buy bags so that she can sell enough to take care of her children. Her goal is to stay healthy so she can keep working to take care of her children.
 
They need a total loan amount of GHS 3,250 to buy more stock for sale.

They are demonstrating samples of their products in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy bags to resell.

loans.name: Hoka

texts.en:
Hoka lives in the Likoni area, south of Mombasa, Kenya. She is 61 years old, and she is a single mother of one grown-up child. She has been in this business for the last four years, and the business has been doing fine. She knew Milango through a friend; they have been doing business together for a long time, and she decided to join. 

She now seeks a loan to buy fish for selling. She wants to be owning a successful fish shop in the next five years despite the challenge of weather. The income from the business will improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Musyoka

texts.en:
Musyoka, a 64-year-old father of four from Mwingi, has a business as a livestock farmer. He is married to Lilian, who helps him in animal rearing. He earns a monthly income of 11,000 KES (Kenyan shillings), which he uses to support his family. This marks his first loan term with KADET. 

With the loan he has applied for from KADET LTD., he will be able to purchase more goats, cows, sheep and donkeys for rearing. The additional income created will allow him to improve the standard of living for his family. In the future, Musyoka would like to venture into mixed-crop farming and also expand his animals’ sheds. 

His hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of his family and eradicate poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more goats, cows, sheep and donkeys for rearing.

loans.name: Karmen

texts.en:
Karmen is farmer from Baghramyan village, where she lives with her husband and son. Karmen's husband receives a pension and helps Karmen with running a farm. They cultivate haricot and peppers, and sell the gathered harvest in the local markets.

Karmen is very skilled in the agricultural sphere, but because of financial hardships she isn’t able to cultivate different types of vegetables. She has applied for this loan to purchase land and be able to enlarge this farm. Karmen will also purchase fertilizer, which is very important for successful cultivation of the land.

She hopes that Kiva lenders will support her to improve her farm and gather more income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and fertilizer.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, a  60-year-old, married father of four, from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. He earns a monthly income of KES 17,000 which he uses to support his family. This marks his third loan term with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), after successfully repaying his previous loans. 

With the loan he has applied for from KADET, he will be able to purchase more seedlings and fertilizer. Additional income created will allow him to cater to his family’s needs and to repay his loan. 

In the future, Peter would like to purchase a piece of land and to construct a permanent, residential house. He hopes to start exporting his farm produce.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 27 years old and not yet married. He has a cereal business in Naivasha, which he has operated for one year, and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD. to enable him to purchase maize and beans. He plans to expand his business with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, Peter hopes to become the biggest cereal supplier in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 23-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000, which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Rubina wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of seven. She has been doing a business of tailoring since five years ago to support her husband financially. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household with the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Now, she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase more reels of threads along with packs of buttons, laces and zippers. In this way, she will be able to stitch up more dresses. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Gulshan hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads along with packs of packs of buttons, laces and zippers.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen, age 40, is a married woman and a mother of five children. She is striving hard to meet her family's demands, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant, but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. 

Yasmeen started her business of sewing clothes to contribute to the family's income. She is very familiar with the stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

Yasmeen requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors, with packs of buttons, needles, and elastics. It will help her to meet the demands of her customers, without fail. 

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors, with packs of buttons, needles, and elastics.

loans.name: Mamagul

texts.ru: Мамагул сельская женщина в возрасте 47 лет. Она живет с мужем и четырьмя детьми в районе Пяндж. Мамагул арендует земельный участок, где выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Она занимается растениеводством в течение 5 лет. Мамагул в основном выращивает огородные культуры. Она запрашивает кредит для приобретения семян картофеля и минеральных удобрений. Мамагул осенью хочет собрать хороший урожай картофеля и заработать хороший доход, так как в это время все жители делают запасы на зиму. Она верит в вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mamagul is a country woman of 47. She lives with her husband and four children in the Pyandj region. Mamagul leases a plot of land where she grows agricultural crops. She has been working with this type of farming for five years. 

Mamagul primarily grows market crops and is requesting a loan to purchase seed potatoes and mineral fertilizers with the intention of harvesting a good crop of potatoes in the fall and earning good profits, since at this time everybody is stocking up for the winter. She is relying on your support.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en: Nasira is a married woman and a mother of four children. She is 42 years old and has been involved in a bangles sales business for the past twelve years. She serves her community well. Her husband works as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone.  Now she is requesting a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy a great variety of bangles in different colors and designs. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with a good repayment history.
