His income increased from the last loan he got; however, he got sick which made it impossible to care for his cattle. He didn’t have anyone else to do it, and his business was weakened. Now he has been able to strengthen his business and is back on track again. He needs a new loan to purchase cows that will give birth to new calves and give milk, which will allow Geovanny to increase what he has to offer. 

He works from the early hours of the morning until the afternoon. This young entrepreneur has learned more and more every day about his business and good administration.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Maria Trinidad

texts.es: Doña  María en casa propia con su  esposo y sus hijos,  es una mujer  muy trabajadora  que vela  por su familia, ella se dedica a la ventas de pupusas y tortillas desde hace varios años y es de esta manera como ella suple algunos de los gastos de  familia, tiene mucha clientela por ser una persona muy amable a la hora de vender, doña María solicita un crédito para poder  invertirlo  en su capital comprando maíz, cal, chicharrón, frijoles, quesillo, tomates, repollos, etc.  y poder generar  ingresos  mayores y mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia .
texts.en:
María lives in her own home with her husband and children. She is a hard-working woman who looks after her family. She has been selling pupusas (a Salvadorean fast food) and tortillas for the past few years. Doing this she is able to cover some of the household expenses. She is very friendly while selling so she has lots of customers.

María is requesting this loan in order to be able to invest in her capital, buying corn, lime, pork cracklings, beans, cheese, tomatoes, cabbage, etc. Thus being able to generate more revenue and offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, pork cracklings, beans, cheese, tomatoes, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Olga Margarita

texts.es: Doña Olga de 29 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo, hijos y suegros, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos y también de lociones, perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, etc. desde hace 6 años, es una persona muy conocida por su buen carácter, responsabilidad y honestidad, cualidades que la han llevado a ganarse la confianza de sus clientes, ya que posee una gran demanda de sus productos gracias a su dedicación y esfuerzo ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante. Doña Olga solicita un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para obtener mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Olga is 29 and lives in her own house with her husband, son and in-laws. For six years she has worked selling snacks as well as lotions, perfumes, creams, deodorants etc. She is well known for being honest and responsible with a good character, qualities which have helped her earn the trust of her customers, and she has good demand for her products. Thanks to her dedication and hard work, she has been able to provide for her family. Olga is asking for a loan to buy more wholesale merchandise so she can increase her earnings and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lotions, perfumes, creams, deodorants etc.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à DJIGONSSO, commune  cercle de BLA, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4eme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  Mme  RAHAMA,  assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à YANGASSO, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 85.000 FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of this Benkadi 4 group are married women with an average age of 42 and four children on average, all living in traditional families in  Djigonsso, township group BLA, fourth administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, the prior loans having been correctly reimbursed. 

Madame Rahama, seated in the middle in the photo, cultivates peanuts. With her loan she intends to buy farm inputs, seeds, tools, and pay for plowing to maintain a quarter hectare. Her produce will be sold right in the village and in Yangasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 85,000 f CFA at the end of the growing season.  This profit will permit her to repay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenditures.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and buy farm inputs, tools and seeds.

loans.name: Effort

texts.en: 46-year-old Effort from Liberia lives in the community surrounding  Airport. She was unable to attend school. She has four children between the ages of  4 and 31 years old. Only two are in school and live at home. For the past ten years she been selling soft drinks and other drinks in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her fiance, and she learned the business from her friends. She like how her business makes her independent. She spends ten hours on her business from Monday to Saturday. She is requesting a loan to purchase more drinks for her business. She hopes to build her own house. She is glad to be a borrower of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase drinks for her business

loans.name: Manuel Adalberto

texts.es: Don Manuel de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo de 8 años de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años, es un hombre muy trabajador  y responsable cultiva todos los años los principales granos básicos como lo son el maíz, frijol y maicillo tiene la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, además adicional a eso trabaja como jornal en una finca que está cerca de su casa, con lo que ganan de sus ventas y de su trabajo logra solventar algunos de los gastos de su familia,  don Manuel esta solicitado  un crédito  para   la comprar de insumos  agrícolas para poder  asistir  sus cultivos como herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, controles de plagas, etc.  y tener  resultados más notorios  es de esta manera es  como él desea mejorar sus cosechas  y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel, 43, lives in his own house with his wife and his 8-year-old son. He has been farming for 10 years. He is a hardworking and responsible man. Every year he grows the main basic grains such as corn, bean and sorghum. He has the experience necessary to attend to his crops. In addition to this, he works on a farm close to his house for daily wages. With the profit of the sales and his work on the farm he manages to pay some household expenses. 

Manuel is requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies; to help with his crops such as herbicides, fertilizers, manure, seeds, pest control etc...and having more noticeable results. This is the way he wishes to improve his harvests and to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides, fertilizers, manure, seeds, pest control etc...

loans.name: Ramon Ernesto

texts.es: Don Ramón de 45 años de edad se dedica a trabajar en su molino, procesando todo tipo de alimentos, como maíz, frijoles, harinas, salsas, entre otros. Tiene 15 años con el negocio y posee amplia experiencia que le ayuda a generar muy buenas ganancias, es muy conocido por las personas de la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, por los precios accesibles y por el servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor y muy decidido a luchar por sus sueños, esta trabajando muy duro todos los días para no decepcionar a su familia, se siente satisfecho y muy cómodo con su negocio, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda por el servicio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cuchillas, discos, etc. Tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, se compromete a cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevará seguridad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Ramón, 45 years old, works as a miller, processing all types of food such as corn, beans, different types of flour, and sauces, among others. He has been a miller for 15 years and has a depth of experience that helps him to generate a good income. He is well known in the area, and has established a good customer base. His clientele prefer him because of the quality, the low prices, and the unequaled service he always provides to his customers. He is an enterprising man, dedicated to his job and very determined to fight for his dreams. He works very hard every day so as not to disappoint his family. He is very satisfied and comfortable with his business. 

In the past few weeks the demand for his services has increased, and so he is asking Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy blades and disks for his mill. He has good references and is responsible. He has committed himself to paying off his debt, and at the same time he has faith that he will be able to give economic security to his family.

loans.use: to buy blades, disks, etc. for his mill.

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVA VIDA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria ella es viuda y tiene 63 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa y lencería, la socia vende chompas,pantalones,polos,medias entre otras ropas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones o sus amigos, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un atienda donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas, medias, polos pantalones y casacas.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

El socio que esta tapado con un circulo su cara ya no pertenece al banco comunal Nueva Vida
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de imprenta, negocio de venta de artesanías, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Nueva Vida communal bank.  This bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Victoria, a member, is a 63 year old widow, and she has two children.  She works in her business of selling clothes and lingerie.  She sells sweaters, pants, shirts, and stockings, and other clothes.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She takes her clothes to different places like institutions or to her friends.  She has been in this business for eight years, and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a store where she would be able to sell the clothes.  She is requesting the loan to buy sweaters, stockings, shirts, pants, and jackets.

The members whose photos are inserted into the group photo asked for permission due to work.  The member whose face is covered with a circle no longer belongs to the Nueva Vida communal bank.

The other members have a printing business, a business selling handicrafts, a grocery store business, and a business selling food.

Victoria is grateful to those who form part of this dream by providing this loan.  She pledges to make her payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, stockings, shirts, pants, and jackets.

loans.name: Maa Durgani Self Help Group

texts.en:
Maa Durgani Self Help Group was formed with ten members in 2008 in a small village in Odisha. They all came together to help each other and solve the social issues among them, save money and provide financial support to their families. They chose Puspalata as the leader of their group. 

The lady sitting in the middle of the photograph is Puspalata. She is a 34-year-old woman living with her husband and her only child. For ten years, Puspalata’s husband has been working as a farmer to support his small family. His income is not sufficient to support the family. So Puspalata is helping her husband by working with him and being involved in the mushroom cultivating business. She has five years of experience in this business. She has requested a loan to buy more mushroom seeds, straw, and other raw materials and to repair her space where the mushrooms are cultivated, so that she can add to her family’s income. 

Puspalata says that by selling mushrooms, she can support her family and she can send her child to a good school; through that, she can provide a better education to her child. The other members of the group Maa Durgani Self Help Group are involved in fish selling, agriculture, and retail stores.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing mushroom seeds, straw, and other raw material and to repair her space where the mushrooms are cultivated.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Self Help Group

texts.en:
In 2006 a group of nine women came together from a small village in Odisha and formed Maa Mangala Self Help Group. Ulash was selected as the leader of Maa Mangala Self Help Group. The lady standing in the second position from the right side of the photograph is Ulash. Ulash is 45 years old, married, and living with her husband and her only child. She has been involved in a milk business for past seven years. She has two cows and she wants to purchase one more cow because the demand for milk is high and she is not able to meet the growing demand of the customers in the market. 

Ulash has applied for a loan to purchase a cow and fodder and also wants to repair her cattle shed. This business will help her to support her child's education. She says that this loan can help to increase her income, which will help her to purchase the study materials for her child's education and to pay her child's tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a cow, cow fodder and to repair her cattle shed.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: El señor Jhonny trabajo desde muy corta edad para poder ayudar a sus padres y  apoyar a sus hermanos menores, no tuvo muchas oportunidades de continuar sus estudios, solo llego a estudiar hasta nivel primario, sin embargo con mucho esfuerzo y compromiso logro salir adelante, trabajo como agricultor muchos años apoyando a su padre, tiene un pequeño hijo que se encuentra transitoriamente viviendo con el, ya que el señor Jhonny esta separado de la madre de su hijo, después de algunos años logro incurrir en otro rubro que es la albañilería actualmente esta como ayudante de albañil, tiene bastante conocimiento en el rubro, apoyo en la construcción de su propia vivienda, pero por razones de solvencia económica no logro concluir su vivienda, por esta razón solicita un crédito que le permita culminar la construcción de su vivienda y así poder contar con su propio techo para vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Sr. Jhonny has been working from a very young age in order to help his parents and support his younger siblings. He did not have many opportunities to continue his studies and was only able to complete school through the primary level. Nonetheless, he has demonstrated great effort and commitment as he has moved forward. He has worked as a farmer for many years by helping his father.

Sr. Jhonny has a young son who is temporarily living with him. He is separated from the mother of his child. A few years ago, he picked up another trade and now works as a masonry assistant. Jhonny gained considerable knowledge in this field, which helped with the construction of his own home. However, due to financial reasons, he was not able to finish building his house. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can finish the construction of his home and have his own roof under which he can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to finish the construction of his house.

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru: Нуриддин простой таксист, работающий и живущий в городе Вахдат. Он всегда рад помочь окружающим и в любое время потянет вам руку помощи. Ему 50 лет и у него пятеро детей. Нуриддин в течение 10 лет зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь услугой такси. Сейчас его верный друг, машина-такси имеет технические неполадки, что затрудняет его работу. Нуриддин просит кредит для покупки авто запчастей, чтобы отремонтировать свою машину. У каждого человека есть дело, которым он занимается с удовольствием. Вот и Нуриддин любит вождение машины, это не только хобби, но и средство дохода его семьи.
texts.en: Nuriddin is an ordinary taxi driver working and living in the city of Vahdat. He is always glad to assist those around him and will lend someone a helping hand at any time. He is 50 and has five children. For 10 years Nuriddin has been earning a living with his taxi. Now his true friend, his car, has mechanical problems, which is making his work difficult. Nuriddin is requesting a loan to buy car parts to repair his vehicle. Every person has a task that they perform with pleasure. For Nuriddin it is driving his car - it is not just a hobby, but a means of making a living for his family.

loans.use: to buy car parts to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Phina

texts.en: Phina is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works in her shop seven days out of every week and sells to all categories of people, but on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ana Eufimia

texts.es: Ana nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 38 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal ser profesora, ella trabaja en uno de los colegios de la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Llapallanchis Llankasunchis” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento de la casa, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Ana was born in the city of Paucartambo and still lives there with her family. She is 38 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has one child. Ana is a hardworking and enterprising person who wants to move forward with her family. She puts forth the effort in her primary job as a teacher at one of the schools in the city of Paucartambo. Ana is a responsible person. For this reason, she was invited to participate in the Communal Bank “Llapallanchis Llankasunchis”.

Ana is taking this opportunity to request a loan for the maintenance of her house. She appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to pay for home maintenance expenses.

loans.name: Charchika Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
The group Charchika Mahila Mandal has nine members who are all from the same neighborhood. The lady standing second from the left-hand side in the photo is Gitanjali who is the leader of the group. Gitanjali is a 45-year-old woman, married to a worker of Tangi village in Odisha, India. The couple has two children who are in school. Jayanti lives with her children and, together with her husband, takes care of all the household expenses. 

In order to help with all the family expenses, Gitanjali has been involved in doing paddy cultivation and selling her produce to distributors for the past five years. She supplies her rice to the rice dealers in the nearby market. In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Gitanjali, together with the group Charchika Mahila Mandal, are requesting a loan from Peoples Forum for purchasing fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, and to cover their operational costs. Their goal is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing fertilizers, pesticides, seeds and to cover their operational costs.

loans.name: Nulee

texts.en: Please meet 28-year-old Nulee from Liberia. She lives in the community surrounding Airport. She is single and has no child. For the past ten years she has been running a shop which sells used clothes. She started this business selling for her mother and learned this way of selling from her friends. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending nine hours a day at her business. She appreciates her business because she makes more money. Her plan is to build a decent house. She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. She would like to thank BRAC Liberia for its continued support.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Lasto

texts.en: Lasto is a boda boda (motorcycle) rider around the city. He is married to Sarah and they have 3 children. Lasto  was a cleaner in washing bay before joining the boda boda business. He is applying for 1,000,000 UGX loan to buy a new motorcycle. He is topping up with his saving to buy a brand new motorcycle so as to increase on his daily income and meet his house hold basic needs adequately. He has a dream of constructing rental houses on his plot of land therefore it is from the help the loan that he believes his dreams will be achieved. In the photo is Lasto(left) with the Ugafode credit officer with the motorcycle he intends to pay for.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Demare

texts.en: This is Demare from Liberia, she lives in the airport area of Margibi County. She is 35 years old. She and her fiance live together along with four children between the ages of 7 and 15. Her children are in school and live at home. Her fiancee works with Firestone, she was fortunate to attend school, so she decided to do business. For the past 7 years, she has been selling fish in the local market. She sells for eight hours a day, from Monday to Saturday. She described herself as hard working woman. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. Her plan is to build her house and educates her childre

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business,

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be highly self motivated. He does farming to earn income. He will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a gas cooker that will benefit five family members. It will enable them to cook fast. He hopes that in the future, he will have a happy family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as aggressive. She does farming to earn a living. She will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a gas cooker that will benefit five family members. It will enable them to cook easily. She hopes that in the future, she will be stable. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en: Gertrude is a single mother of six children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (relatives). She has a business selling cassava and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of Cassava and sell them wholesale only, seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality, transportation and defaulters. She aspires to own a delivery van for ease in transportation and also to buy a plot of land and build rental rooms. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy bags of cassava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more hammers, axes, and hoes

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be determined. He does farming to earn an income. He will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a gas cooker that will benefit five family members. It will enable then to cook fast. They face a challenge of lack of enough money. He hopes that in the future, he will have a happy family. This is first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a gas

loans.name: Wilbroad

texts.en: Wilbroad comes from Katandura. He deals in cattle rearing and trade at a small scale. He has taken ugx.1,200,000 to assist him buy more cattle so as to increase his incomes. He hopes to educate his children to a higher level using the savings from his business. He thanks the Kiva lenders for giving him the opportunity to access a loan.

loans.use: To buy cattle for sale

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es: Elsa, tiene 45 años de edad, esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos con quienes ella vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. La actividad que ella realiza es la elaboración y venta de casabe (producto elaborado de yuca) y pan de coco.  Tiene aproximadamente 20 años de experiencia. Este producto lo vende en su casa. Ha decidido solicitar un cuarto préstamo que es de 8,000 Lempiras, con el cual va invertir en la compra de yuca, carbón, bolsas, leña, harina, cocos y azúcar para la elaboración de Casabe y pan. Su plan es trabajar con el negocio, incrementar las ventas y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Elsa is 45 years old, married, and has four children who live with her.  She lives in the town of Tela, Atlántida.  

Elsa makes and sells “casabe” (a flatbread made from cassava flour) and coconut bread.  She has approximately 20 years of experience.  Elsa sells her products from her house.  She has decided to request her fourth loan in the amount of 8,000 HNL.  Elsa will invest in the purchase of cassava, charcoal, bags, firewood, flour, coconuts, and sugar for making “casabe” and bread.  Her plans include working in her business, increasing her sales, and generating more income.

loans.use: to buy cassava, charcoal, bags, firewood, flour, coconuts, and sugar.

loans.name: Kusikoyllor Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KUSIKOYLLOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa ella es soltera y tiene 36 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y aceite, la socia tiene un puesto en el mercado que es una tienda de abarrotes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

La persona que sale adjunta en la foto es socia que pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo y la niña que viste de color rojo y negro es hija de una de las socias.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de imprenta, negocio de venta de vidrios, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesania.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Kusikoyllor Communal Bank. This bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

The member is Rosa. She is 36 years old, single and has 1 son. She works at her grocery store business, selling essential goods such as rice, sugar, milk and oil. She has a stall at the market that is a grocery store. She works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM. She has now worked at this business for 1 year and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She's requesting the loan to purchase milk, sugar, oil and rice.

Rosa expresses gratitude to those who form part of this dream in this way and promises to meet all of her payment deadlines.

The other members work in printing, glass sales, a grocery store business and craft sales. The person in the inserted photo is a member who asked permission to be late to the meeting because of work and the little girl dressed in red and black is the daughter of one of the members.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Amigos Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AMIGOS EMPRENDEDORES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria, la socia es casada tiene 46 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria en una carreta por el  centro de la ciudad, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería como galletas, chicles, chupetines entre otros.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de productos de belleza venta de ropa y venta de libros.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Amigos Emprendedores” (Enterprising Friends) communal bank which is located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  Victoria, 46, is the member.  She’s married and has six children.  

She alternates her daily activities with a business selling snacks in a cart going from place to place in the downtown area of the city.  She’s been in business for quite some time and does well thanks to the daily effort she puts into it.  

She’d like to be able to continue working in order to continue to support her family this way.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise like cookies, gum, lollipops, etc.  She thanks all those who share her dream by this means and commits to make her payments as scheduled.  

The other group members work selling beauty supplies, clothes and books.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa live in the airport area of Margibi County. She is unmarried and has four children between the ages of 3 months and 14. Only three of her children are in school and they all live at home. Her fiance is a builder. She is 34 and she completed 6th grade before starting her business. For the past 8 years, she has been selling rice, pepper, vita, sugar, salt in the local market spending nine hours on her business from Monday to Saturday. She described herself as a hard working business woman. She is requesting a loan to purchase more onion, rice, pepper, vita etc for her business. Her plans is to build her house and educates her children.

loans.use: to purchase more onion, rice, pepper, vita etc for her business

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 4 and 11. In 2007, Fatmata established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wants to generates her own source of income. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days a week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame is married and has four children. She received some schooling, until the end of primary education. Currently, Maame sells cosmetics and underwear, near Cape Coast. She has been involved in this business for about two years.  Her husband is a carpenter.  Maame’s income goes toward helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.

Maame will use the loan to increase her existing cosmetics and underwear inventory. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, she plans to develop her business further, by venturing into new markets.

loans.use: to increase her cosmetics and underwear inventory.

loans.name: Nilsa

texts.es:
La Sra. Nilsa tiene 38 años,  vive en casa propia con su marido en la Ciudad de Paraguarí desde hace más de 10 años, ella es comerciante, tiene una despensa muy bien surtida que abrió hace mas de 1 año, también trabaja como encargada de una casa quinta a inmediaciones de su  casa. Es una persona muy conocida en la zona por su sacrificio y ganas de trabajar que demuestra todos los días. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de arroz, panificados, fideos y demás insumos con los que podrá seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan. Agradece por esta ayuda que está recibiendo que le será muy útil.
texts.en:
Sra. Nilsa is 38 years old and has been living with her husband in their own home in the city of Parguarí for more than 10 years. She is a merchant and has a well-stocked food pantry that she opened more than a year ago. Nilsa also works as a manager of a boarding house that is located within close proximity of her home. She is well-known in the area for her sacrifice and the willingness to work, which she demonstrates every day.

Nilsa is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, baked goods, noodles, and other products so that she can continue offering her customers everything they need. She is grateful for the help she is receiving, since it will be very useful.

loans.use: to buy rice, baked goods, noodles, and other products.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer La Rinconada Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER LA RINCONADA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina; ella tiene 56 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 06 hijos; La socia altera sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar para su negocio.
Los otros socios  se dedican la agricultura, tienda de abarrotes, ganadería, crianza de animales ,restaurant, panadería, venta de materiales de construccion,artesania.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Nuevo Amanecer La Rinconada” (La Rinconada New Dawn) communal bank located in Andahuaylillas District belonging to Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department.  Justina, 56, is one of the members.  

She has a spouse and six children.  She alternates her daily activities with a grocery store business.  She sells basic staples like rice, sugar and milk, among others.  

She’s been in business for quite some time and does well thanks to the daily effort she puts into it.  She wants to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family this way.  She requests the loan to buy rice and sugar for her store.  

She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.  The other group members work in agriculture, grocery store, cattle raising, livestock raising, restaurant, bakery, building supplies sales and crafts.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Alegres ya está en su ciclo número gracias a que todas las mujeres de este grupo están poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder lograr salir adelante e ir creciendo. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas quieren conocer la situación en que se encuentran.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mariana, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas de variadas clases. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que esta con muchos objetivos y metas que quiere cumplir. Esta luchando por su familia y para poder darle todo lo que necesitan. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de remeras, jeans, pantalones y demás prendas con las cuales podrá seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The group called “Mujeres Alegres” (Cheerful Women) is in its ninth cycle already thanks to each of the women in this group putting in her greatest effort in order to get ahead and continue growing.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey to find out the situation each one of them is in.

One of the members is Mariana who works selling various kinds of clothes.  She’s a very hardworking woman who has many goals and objectives to reach.  She’s striving for her family and to be able to give them everything they need.  She’s asking for this loan to buy t-shirts, jeans, pants and other articles of clothing in order to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en: This is 49 years old Miatta from Liberia. She lives in the community surrounding the airport of Margibi county, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married and her husband is not working. They have four children ages from 20 to 35. All her children are living on their own. She was not lucky enough to attend school, but she has keptherself busy by selling fresh fish, frozen chicken, and dry fish in the local market for the past thirty years. She described herself as hard working woman. She enjoys her business because she makes profit. She sell for nine hours per day, six days a week. She is requesting a loan to buy more fresh fish, frozen chicken, and dry fish for her business. Her plans is to increase her business even more. She likes to say thanks to BRAC Liberia and their supporters.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish, frozen chicken, and dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Niño Jesus está en su ciclo número 9, donde todas y cada una de ellas están dando todo su esfuerzo y a que quieren salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza como medio de conocer la situación que todas y cada una está teniendo.
Una persona digna de destacar es Eulalia, quien es una excelente vendedora de ropas, tiene muy buena clientela y está saliendo adelante por medio de su trabajo. Ella es muy luchadora y trabajadora.
Pide de esta ayuda para poder comprar prendas como ser camisas, remeras, pantalones y demás, con lo que quiere poder surtirse y de esa forma poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradecen todas ellas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de salir adelante.
texts.en:
“Niño Jesús” (Child Jesus) is in its ninth cycle.  Each and every one of them is putting in her maximum effort because they all want to get ahead.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey as a means of finding out what situation each one of them is in.

One of the people worthy of pointing out is Eulalia who is an excellent clothes merchant.  She has a very good clientele and is getting ahead by means of her work.  She’s very tenacious and hardworking.

She’s asking for this help in order to be able to buy articles of clothing like shirts, t-shirts, pants and others because she wants to stock up to be able to fill customer orders.  

All of them are grateful for the opportunity they are getting to move forward.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
En su ciclo 12 se encuentra este grupo llamado Amanecer, de la ciudad de Encarnación, son mujeres que se han unido para poder ayudar a sus familias y darles lo que a cada una les falto. También están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza y medir de esa forma como esta cada una.
Pabla es una de las integrantes de este grupo, y una persona digna de destacar, ella es modista, y tiene un pequeño tallercito en el que cumple con los pedidos de sus clientes. Es una persona muy luchadora, que quiere salir adelante. Quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, es por eso que pide de esta crédito para poder invertirlo en telas e hilos y así seguir con sus confecciones y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called “Amanecer” (Dawn) is in cycle 12; they are from the city of Encarnación.  They are women who have joined together in order to help their families and to give them everything they themselves never had.  They are also taking the poverty elimination survey to determine how each one of them is this way.

Pabla is one of this group’s members.  She’s a person worthy of note.  She’s a dressmaker and has a small workshop where she fills customer orders.  She’s a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead.  She wants to continue investing in her business which is why she’s requested this loan in order to invest it in fabric and thread and thus continue making clothes and meeting customer demand.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Isatu from Waterloo western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children, ages 2 and 7/ Two of her children are currently attending school. For the past 10 years, Isatu has run a cookery business. She began her business because she needed to generate income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business lack of enough capital to run her business.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more rice, onions and cooking season to prepare her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her level of living. In the future, Isatu plans to expand business more than even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice, onions and seasonings for her restaurant

loans.name: Richeal

texts.en: Rachael is 38 years old, married with three children. Her children are between the ages of 6 and 12 and are in school and living at home in the airport area, one of the most best-known place in Mirgibi County. She is a six grade dropout and has been selling rice by cups in the local market for the past year. She uses a taxi most of the time. She faces problems during the rainy season because she does not have a good selling spot in the local market. Rachael is requesting a loan to increase her sales by buying five bag of rice to resell. Her plan is to build a house for her children. Her business makes her independent.

loans.use: to increase her sales by buying five bags of rice to resell.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a single mother of four children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members.  She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for 10 years. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells at retail. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more bunches of green bananas. She aspires to become a wholesaler and to educate her children, up to university.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Daphine

texts.en: Daphine  is married and has one child who doesn’t go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for two years. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She moves door-to-door selling used clothes seven days out of every week. She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring of getting a permanent business premise and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more  bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Twekambe Kyarwakya Group

texts.en: Anthony is a hardworking 43-year-old man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is married with seven children between 23 and 5 years old. He owns a retail shop where he sells general merchandise but also works in agriculture in order to maximize his profits. A good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the university level and expand his business to new markets. He is a member of the above mentioned group where each member guarantees the other to pay the loan. Anthony intends to use the loan to buy soda, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas, sugar and salt  to sell.

loans.name: Easter

texts.en:
Easter is married and has one child, who doesn’t go to school. Easter also takes care of an additional family member, her sister. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

She has a business, a pub. She has been in this business for two years. Easter has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda shilling from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and soda. Her major business challenges includes seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully-stocked pub, and to build a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda to serve at her pub

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel, the mother of three children, lives with their father, her husband. 

Since they are living in a home under construction, she is requesting her 19th loan. This loan is to continue building her bathroom and a cesspool. She will use this loan to buy tiles, cement, concrete blocks, and plumbing materials.

Isabel is one of Esperanza International Dominican Republic's entrepreneurs who came to the organization almost ten years ago for a loan to expand her business, a small bakery, in which she produces homemade bread to sell to their neighbors. It also produces income she uses to help her family, to reinvest, and to make loan repayments. She lives in a slum area in Samana.

Esperanza International Dominican Republic is running a program in which most of its clients pay back their loans, fulfill the commitment to expand their businesses, and show reliability in their groups. They can request loans to improve their house structure, while implementing their business loans and attending group meetings.

loans.use: to buy tiles, cement, and other building materials.

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Sebastian está en el ciclo uno, trabajando juntas y tratando de fomentar el trabajo en equipo. Ellas son de una zona bastante alejada y rural llamada Villa Ygatimi, una zona muy humilde y con poco acceso a ciertos servicios básicos, por lo que la fundación paraguaya apuesta en ellas dándoles esta oportunidad.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Estela,  ella solicita su crédito para poder invertirlo en compra de animales para poder criar para el consumo de su casa, como también para su venta. Ya que esa es su principal ocupación la de cría y venta de animales de corral.
A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo ella sabe que ira mejorando mucho.
texts.en:
The group called “San Sebastian” is in its first loan cycle. The members are working together and trying to promote their work as a team. They are from a remote rural village called Villa Ygatimi, a very modest area that has limited access to certain basic services. For this reason, Fundación Paraguaya has chosen to give them this opportunity.

One of the members is Sra. Estela. She is requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchase of animals that she can raise at home for consumption, as well as to sell. Her main occupation is raising and selling farm animals. Through continuous work and effort, she knows that she can make great improvement.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Mabinty from Waterloo eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 6 children between the ages of 6 and 22. Five of her children are currently attending school. In 2009, Mabinty established her retail business. She started the business to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 7 days per week and 12 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation and price inflation.

Mabinty requires a loan in order to buy more native rice for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take good care of her family. In the future, Mabinty plans to build a permanent residence for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more native rice for resale.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
Santa Rosa es un grupo muy unido que está saliendo adelante por medio de su esfuerzo y trabajo en conjunto, están en su ciclo número 6to del programa de comité, además están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde las integrantes quieren poder ir mejorando cada día.
Lilian es una persona que desde joven ha trabajado, sale adelante por medio del esfuerzo que viene haciendo en su negocio. Con sacrificio monto su peluquería y hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela. Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, tijeras y demás insumos para poder seguir con su buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que ella y sus compañeras están recibiendo.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa is a very united group that is getting ahead through their joint efforts. They are in their sixth loan cycle with the committee program and are also doing the poverty elimination survey, where the members want to be able to improve every day.

Lilian is a person who has worked since she was young, getting ahead through the effort that she puts in with her business. By making sacrifices she put together her salon and she now has a very good clientele. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of hair color, shampoo, rinses, scissors and other supplies to be able to continue providing good customer service. She feels grateful for this opportunity that she and her fellow members are receiving.

loans.use: to purchase hair color, shampoo, rinses, scissors and other supplies.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a single mother of two children, and one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of an additional family member (her mother). She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

She has a business of selling biscuits, sweets, and roasted corn and ground nuts. She works from home, seven days out of every week. She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more ground nuts and boxes of biscuits and sweets. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more ground nuts and boxes of biscuits and sweets

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
Saidat is a single mother of four children, and all her children go to school. She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for nine years. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Saidat applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use it to buy more bunches of green bananas to sell. She works at the market seven days out of every week, and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to go to villages of Masaka for green bananas.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas to sell at the market.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à DJIGONSSO, commune de BOUGOURA cercle  de BLA, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  Mme  SETOU,  1 ere  femme  assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 130 500 FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Benkadi 5 are married women who average 40 years of age and 4 children each, and who all live in traditional families in DJIGONSSO, in the commune of BOUGOURA, circle of BLA (4th administrative region of Mali). 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th collaboration with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mrs. Setou grows groundnuts. She is the group member sitting first from the left in the photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs, seeds and small farming equipment, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 1.25 hectares of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village and at the market to a clientele consisting of both men and women. She expects to earn a profit of 130,500 FCFA by the end of the season, which she will use to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs, seeds and small farming equipment, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is married with five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister). She has a business selling tomatoes and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of tomatoes. She generates additional income by selling eggplants and onions. She works from home seven days per week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and perishabilty. She aspires to grow tomatoes herself and to become a wholesaler. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: San Pedro Group

texts.es:
El comité San Pedro esta integrado con 19 mujeres muy trabajadoras, que con su lucha diaria están saliendo adelante. Son mujeres jefas de familia, que quieren poder darles todo lo que necesitan.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Rosa, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas y de mercería, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su sacrificio está saliendo adelante y también mejorando en su emprendimiento. Es una persona con grandes ideales que quiere salir adelante. Solicita de esta ayuda para la compra de prendas variadas, como ser remeras, camisas, jeans, como también calzados y artículos de mercería. Agradece por esta ayuda que ella y sus compañeras reciben.
texts.en:
The San Pedro Communal Bank is made up of 19 very hardworking women who are getting ahead through their daily efforts.  They are heads of their families who want to be able to give them everything they need.

One of these women is Rosa, who sells clothing and notions.  She is a very hardworking person who is getting ahead and improving her undertaking through her sacrifice.  She is a person with high aspirations that she wants to make into reality.  She is asking for this help to buy various clothing items, such as tank tops, shirts, jeans, and shoes, as well as notions.  She is thankful for the help that she and her colleagues receive.

loans.use: to buy various clothing items, such as tank tops, shirts, jeans, and shoes, as well as notions.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby lives with her family in Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has three children, and she is 44 years old. Her husband is a rice farmer, and rice is their main source of income. She helps her husband, by selling 'suman' in their community in order to augment their income. ['Suman' is a typical Filipino dessert, usually made of rice, coconut milk, and a little sugar, and wrapped in palm or banana leaf for steaming.] 

Ruby successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC, which she used to purchase raw ingredients. Recently, she borrowed a new loan, which she will use to buy more ingredients for the many orders of 'suman' she has to make. In addition to filling orders, she also delivers her product at the 'suman' center in town, for additional income. She wants to improve her business, and the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make suman.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité, donde todas y cada una de ellas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, ya que quieren poder conocer la situación de cada una, y de esa forma poder trabajar y enfocar su esfuerzo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lorena, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel 3, es decir, con ingresos buenos, pero ella está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente. Entre el trabajo que ella hace comenta que es empleada y sus ratos libre hace compra y venta de  queso, y artículos de primera necesidad. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, que quiere salir adelante, es por eso que se está esforzando mucho.
La Sra. Lorena solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos de primera necesidad como ser aceite, jabón, azúcar, y Harina, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mujeres Unidas is in its second cycle of the communal bank program and each and every one of them works and helps herself to get ahead.  They are conducting a survey to eliminate poverty, as she want to know each individual's situation so then can work and focus their efforts.  

One of the bank members is Lorena, whose last survey showed her to be at level three of poverty, which is to say with good income.  However, she knows that the work and effort she is putting in have to be ongoing and permanent.  She tells us that among the kinds of work she does are housekeeping and buying and selling cheese and essential items in her free time.  She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who wants to get ahead, which is why she is putting in so much effort.  

Lorena is asking for this loan to buy essential items, such as oil, soap, sugar, and flour, which will help her solidify her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy essential items, such as oil, soap, sugar, and flour

loans.name: Filomina

texts.en:
Filomina is 61 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Gata Daiot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has been operating her small sari-sari (variety store) for more than two years, to make a living.

In 2011 Filomina joined Gata Daku MPC. She successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to buy more stock for sale at her store. Recently, she needed some additional capital for her business, for it is the main source of income for her family now. She borrowed a loan of 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more dried fish, vegetables and spices to sell. She hope to improves her business outcome and generate more income. She wants to have a better living standard in the future, with her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish, vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Leopolda

texts.en: Leopolda is married with one child and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband provides transportation services in their motorcycle transport business while Loepolda runs a general store in the town market to make a living. She has been in her business for many years to support the needs of the entire family. She joined Gata Daku MPC and it helps her to improve her ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her previous loans that she used for additional capital for her business. Recently, she borrowed of 8,000.00 PHP to purchase tires and spare parts for her motorcycle. She wants to improve the general living condition of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Maa Parbati Mm Group

texts.en: Sukanti is 38 years old and married. She lives in a village in the Khurda district with her husband and her two children. Her husband earns a living by farming rice and vegetables. She is engaged in the activity of selling rice in her village, having been in this business for three years, and she manages to earn about 3,000 INR per month. This is a group loan for Sukanti's group of eight women named Maa Parbati MM. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. Sukanti wants to use her loan portion to buy more rice in bulk and sell it in the market. She hopes to increase her rice business and earn more income to better her living conditions. The members of the group Maa Parbati MM are very ambitious and are engaged in different kinds of activities like agriculture, retail stores, catering, dairy farming, vegetable selling etc.

loans.use: to purchase rice in bulk for her shop.

loans.name: Gundegmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Gundegmaa. 42 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. Her husband has been working as a teacher at an automobile driving school since 2009. Gundegmaa has been working as a weaver at a carpet factory for almost ten years. Her elder son is graduating from his university next year, and her daughter is beginning her university studies this September. Her youngest son goes to high school.

Because two children will be studying at university this year, affording tuition will be a problem for the family. So Gundegmaa is requesting a loan of 4,400,000 MNT to pay the tuition. She thinks university education will help her children in the future and open infinite opportunities to them.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her son in his last year, and her daughter in her first year, at university

loans.name: Enkhtuvshin

texts.en: Enkhtuvshin, 38 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. He worked at an automobile dismantling factory in Japan between 1999 and 2004 and due to a factory accident he broke his left leg, quit his job and came back to Mongolia. He receives a monthly pension from Japan fund for his disability. His elder daughter is enrolling in university this September. His wife stays at home looking after their younger daughter. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to pay for his daughter's tuition fee. He thinks getting a university education will help his daughter to reach her dream.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en: Mr. Bayarsaikhan, 46 years old, lives with his son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife works in Turkey as a home teacher and housekeeper and she transfers money to her family. He has been rendering transportation service to local people since 2009. His eldest son lives on his own separately from his parents. Last year, with his savings and his wife's sent money, he purchased a two-room old apartment. As his wife is coming to Mongolia this September, he wants to welcome her with a renovated comfortable home. So he is requesting a loan of 2,800,000 MNT to purchase vacuum insulated windows, hardwood flooring, wallpaper, fiberglass and foam. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where heat won't be lost easily through walls and windows. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who deeply cares for his family.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass

loans.name: Lkhagvasuren

texts.en: Lkhagvasuren is 36 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. He has been working as a driver for a building company for almost four years and during his day off, he provides taxi service to local people. His wife is a human resource manager at cashmere fashion company, currently working for a trial period. His daughter goes to kindergarten. He is requesting a loan of 1000000 MNT to purchase spare parts to repair his automobile which is an essential part of income generation for his family. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his automobile

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is very thankful for the financial assistance given to her. She used the loan as additional capital for her business. She has a Direct Selling and a buy and sell business. Her income from her businesses is helping with their everyday expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Delia hopes to have a product center and dreams of helping her family and loved ones financially. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise like  undergarments, and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à DJIGONSSO, un des villages de BOUGOURA, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4eme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  SITAN ZE  2 eme debout  de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 72500FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The ten members of the Benkadi 6 group are married women who are on average 45 years old, have five children, and live in traditional families in DJIGONSSO, one of the villages in BOUGOURA, the fourth administrative region of Mali. They are working with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to be able to see through their agricultural businesses in the rainy seasons. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and all of their loans have been properly repaid. SITAN ZE, the second one standing from the left in the photo, grows peanuts. With her loan, she plans to buy ingredients, seeds, and small agricultural tools and to pay for the labor to maintain 0.5 hectares. The crops will be sold at the village and market after the harvest to a clientele made up of men and women. She plans to make a profit of 72,500 FCFA at the end. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor, ingredients, small agricultural tools, and seeds

loans.name: Anatolio

texts.en:
This is Anatolio. He previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase a variety of fish needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in meeting their personal, household and business expenses.

He would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to pay for a variety of fish needed in his business. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs and cover the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Anatolio dreams that his business will continue to flourish and hopes to have a good future. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for a variety of fish needed in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more pizza as needed in her business.

loans.name: Wend Goudoum Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZARATA représente le groupe WEND GOUDOUM. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 04 vont à l’école.
Mme fait la restauration (vente d’haricot) depuis 09ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Kilwin. Ses clients sont les gens de son quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter 04sachets d’attiéké (couscous de manioc), 01bidon d’huile et  01sac d’haricot.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut  renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne  agrandir son commerce et  mieux scolariser ses enfants dans de meilleurs écoles.
texts.en: Mrs. ZARATA represents the WEND GOUDOUM group. She feels well. She is a married mother of four. The oldest is 14 years old, and the youngest is 6 years old. All four attend school. Mrs. ZARATA has been in the restaurant business (she sells beans) for nine years. She stocks up at the market in Kilwin. Her customers are people in her neighborhood. She wants to buy four sacks of attiéké (manioc couscous), a container of oil, and a sack of beans. With her profits, she wants to build up her business. Mrs. ZARATA has the ambition to grow her business and to give her children the best education by sending them to the best schools.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of attiéké (manioc couscous), a container of oil, and a sack of beans

loans.name: Benkadi 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe  Benkadi 7 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à DJIGONSSO commune de BOUGOURA cercle  de BLA, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4eme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  FANTA, 2 eme  femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à YANGASSO après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 130.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the group Benkadi 7 are married women who average 45 years of age and 6 children each, and who all live in traditional families in DJIGONSSO, in the commune of BOUGOURA, circle of BLA (4th administrative region of Mali). 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 4th collaboration with the MFI, and all past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mrs. Fanta grows groundnuts. She is the group member standing second from the left in the photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs, seeds and small farming equipment, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 1.5 hectares of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village and in YANGASSO to a clientele consisting of both men and women. She expects to earn a profit of 130,000 FCFA by the end of the season, which she will use to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs, seeds and small farming equipment, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Badegna sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 47 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sabalibougou dans le district de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sabalibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de légumes (oignon, patate,…), de vêtements de toutes sortes : pagnes wax, brodés, bazins et d’habits de la friperie. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Maï (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des pagnes wax, brodés, bazins. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 35 pièces de pagnes wax au grand marché en gros. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédit à Sabalibougou et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mai espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75. 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer les soins de santé des enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Badegna are for the most part married in monogamous households, and they average 47 years of age and six children each, all living in the Sabalibougou area of the Bamako district. They know one another through ties of community and through their revenue-generating businesses at the Sabalibougou market. The group members have small-scale businesses selling vegetables (onions, sweet potatoes, …), clothing of all sorts: Wax or embroidered 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), damask fabrics, and secondhand clothing. 

With the goal of increase their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Maï (sitting at the far right in the photo) has a great reputation selling Wax, embroidered, and damask fabrics. She intends to use her loan to purchase wholesale 35 lengths of Wax 'pagne' cloth at the big market. Accepting cash or credit, she resells them to a customer base composed mostly of women in Sabalibougou and by going door to door.  

With this loan, Ms. Maï hopes to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and ensuring her children's healthcare at home.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is married with an only child and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with his family. He is 46 years old and operating a motor transportation service in his community. He has been doing this for many years as his main source of income. He joined Gata Daku MPC this year and borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to use for motor maintenance costs. He plans to save a portion of his generated income to acquire another unit of motor for his business expansion. He wants to improve the general living conditions of his family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for motor maintenance costs.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is from Gango, Ozamiz City. He is 39 years old, married, and has two children. To make a living, Wilson operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling cellphone accessories in the local community. Wilson has been engaged in his business for years, and it is his family's main source of income. His wife works as an office clerk in a private company.

He joined Gata Daku MPC in 2010, and he successfully repaid the previous loan, which he used to expand his business. Recently, he borrowed a loan of 15,000 PHP, which he will use to cover the costs of house repair. He plan to acquire a motorcycle to be used for the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan, to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of house repair

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
This is Wilfredo. He previously obtained a 15,000 PHP loan that he used to purchase materials needed in repairing jewelry.
