They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to run their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution, having paid back their previous loans in full. Their crop is corn with Ms. Mah standing in the second position from the left to the right of the photo. With this loan, she expects to buy plowing, seeds, and fertilizers to maintain .5. The output is sold at the village level in Sikasso after the harvest to a customer base made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 50,000 francs CFA by farming. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase plowing, inputs and agricultural seeds.

loans.name: El Kuychy Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL KUYCHY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Sebastian, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maura ella es conviviente y tiene 33 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, la socia vende manzanas,naranjas,uvas,platanos y mandarinas, la socia también vende zanahorias, tomates y pepinos, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las frutas y verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas y verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas,platanos,uvas,cebollas,zanahorias y pepinos.
El socio que esta tapado con un circulo su rostro ya no pertenece al banco comunal El Kuychy.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de huevos, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesanía.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank group “EL KUYCHY”, located in the district of San Sebastian, of the Anta province and department of Cusco.

Maura lives with her partner. She is 33 years old and has a son. She makes a living selling fruits and vegetables such as apples, oranges, grapes, plantains, mandarine oranges, carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Maura works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. She has been in this business for seven years and it has gone very well for her. Maura's dream is to have her own shop from which to sell her fruits and vegetables. She is requesting this loan in order to buy oranges, plantains, grapes, onions, carrots, and cucumbers. 

The person with the circle covering his face no longer is a member of the El Kuychy group.
 
The other members of this group run businesses selling eggs, animals, groceries, and handicrafts.

She is grateful to everyone who has a part in her dream through this loan and she pledges to make all of her repayments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy oranges, plantains, grapes, onions, carrots, and cucumbers.

loans.name: Sayha

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставляет человека направлять все свои усилия и мотивировать существующие ресурсы. Сайха является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж имеет маленький доход. Сайха решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Difficult living conditions forces a person to focus all their efforts and summon their resources. Sayha is one of these people who try to improve living conditions and stimulate the financial situation of the family. She is married and raising four children. Her husband has a small income. 

Sayha decided to help her husband for the benefit of the family. With this aim she attended the training "To Get Ahead", organized by the Association of Business Women, and she received a certificate. Currently she may set up her own business and become successful in this area. She would like to set up a business of animal sales, as she has experience in this type of business. She plans to use the income from the loan to provide her children with a good education and nutritious food. 

Sayha requests a loan in the amount of 1,500 somoni for the purchase of livestock in order to set up the new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for setting up a new business

loans.name: Delmy Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Delmy  es una persona muy trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Su negocio es una pulpería y tiene 2 años de tenerla.
Doña Delmy su negocio es muy conocido y visitada por los vecinos de su comunidad, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser manteca, arroz, frijoles, gallinas, maíz, refrescos, pan, churros, pan, café, etc. necesita estos productos para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. 
Doña Delmy espera que el préstamo la ayude mucho ya que gracias a el contara con los insumos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, además espera que sus un ventas aumenten y con esto ganar más ingresos que mejoren un poco su estilo de vida y la de su familia en el hogar. 
Doña Delmy espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio 2013
texts.en:
Delmy's a very hardworking person.  She lives in a community in the south of Honduras with her husband and her three children.

Delmy's business is a grocery store, which she has had for two years.  Her store is very well known and her neighbors in the community shop there a lot.

She's requesting the loan to buy more products: shortening, rice, beans, chickens, corn, soda, bread, crackers, coffee, etc.  She needs these products to respond to customer demand.

Delmy hopes the loan will help her a lot.  Thanks to the loan she'll have the supplies she needs to satisfy her customers' needs.  She also hopes her sales increase and she earns more income so her family's lifestyle will improve.

Delmy hopes to expand her business and continue supporting her children in their studies so they have greater opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras, July 2013

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Chantha is 46 years old and married. She is blessed with five children, four of whom still count on her, as some of them are in school and some are too young for schooling. Her main sources of income are from a fruit plantation and a recycled items trading business.  She has been engaged in her current business for ten years, earning about 28,900 KHR per day. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Chantha is a fourth-time borrower and leads a group of four to get a new loan. The past loans, which she has fully repaid, have enabled her to improve her lifestyle at a good pace. 

Chantha will spend her loan portion to buy recycled items for resale and to buy a cart to transport her recycled items. She hopes this purchase will support her business on time so that she can gain a good income to keep improving her living.

loans.use: to buy recycled items for resale.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгул 42 года, замужем, вместе с мужем воспитывает 4 детей. У Назгул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Назгул занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Назгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, а также 4 лошади, ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки жеребят. Доходы от кредита Назгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Nazgul is 42 years old, married, and she is raising four children together with her husband. Nazgul has secondary education. 

As a main income for her family, Nazgul works with livestock breeding, after having started 20 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nazgul's persistent work, her farm currently counts one dairy cow and four horses, and the monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Nazgul turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for increasing the number of livestock through purchasing foals. Nazgul plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing the number of livestock, and plans to save money for repairing the old livestock barn.

loans.use: to purchase foals

loans.name: Mclaren Group

texts.en:
Hadija, who is in her mid 40s, is single with two children, a boy and a girl who are enrolled in school. For twenty years now, Hadija has been running two businesses, a mamalishe (restaurant), offering different food services, and also a poultry business using local chickens which she grows herself. Hadija sells these chickens in two forms: chicks and big chickens. She works from 5:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. daily and is able to earn a good profit per working day. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Hadija's first loan request. She will use the loan to buy chicken food and mamalishe food cooking items (charcoal, cooking oil, maize flour, baking flour, etc.). She dreams that one day, she will be able to build a café. 

Hadija will share this loan with her loan group, “Mclaren", which consist of ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicken food and mamalishe food cooking items (charcoal, cooking oil, maize flour, baking flour, etc.).

loans.name: Ty's Group

texts.en: Ty is 33 years old and a mother of three children who are in school. To support her family, she grows garlic as her core business with support from her husband. Engaging in her current business for 15 years, she has been able to earn up to 20,800 KHR per day. Ty is a second time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), forming a group of two to get a new loan. Her past loans has enabled her to improve her living condition better than before and provide the primary basic needs for her family. Now, she is seeking for 1,000,000 KHR; it is the same loan amount of her co-borrower. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash, rice seed, and gasoline for her hand-tractor. She hopes that she can gain a good crop output and make more income than before.

loans.use: To buy potash, rice seed, and gasoline for her hand-tractor

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en: Chreb is 35 years old and married. She is a resident from Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. She has three children, but only two children under her dependency. To overcome her family’s hardship, she does rice cropping. She has involved in her current business for 10 years, earning about 16,400 KHR per day. This is second time for Cherb to lend from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and the first cycle for the other two borrowers in the same group. Her original loan has enabled her to support her agribusiness timely to improve her lifestyle and she has fully repaid back her past loan already. Now, the total amount of her entire group loan is 1,900,000 KHR, which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy six sacks of fertilizer for her crops and to buy pigs plus its feed for her pig-raising business, a new business to supplement her income. She hopes that she can make more income to buy a small rice mill to support her crops and expand her pig-raising business.

loans.use: To buy six sacks of fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en: A villager from Sangke district of Battambang province, Vorn is 32 years old and blessed with three dependent children. She generates income via rice cropping with the support from her husband who uses spare time to catch fish for resale. This business has returned her about 16,700 KHR per day.  This is the second microloan for Vorn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has succeeded in repaying her past loan wisely and to upgrade her lifestyle at a good pace and to expand her business in a gradual pace. Now, in a group of three, she is a leader. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can make more yields from her crops and get a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Amani-Hondogo Group

texts.en:
Jackson is in his early 30s and is married with three children who are still going to school. He has been running a business of transporting clients by using a motorcycle. He has been in this business for five years now. He works from 3.00am (at night) to 10.00 am daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Jackson's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to maintain the motorcycle by taking it for servicing and to buy  spares which were out of service. He has paid all his loans successfully. He used his profit to build his own house and to pay his children's school fees.  He will use this loan to buy his own motorcycle. Previously he was employed. His dream is to one day be able to own a spare parts shop, buy a water tank and start selling water.

Jackson will share this loan with his loan group "Amani-Hondogo" with nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para el fortalecimiento del negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar faja, discos, entre otros para que el molino se encuentre en buenas condiciones y asi ofrecerle un mejor servicio a los clientes.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus ingresos y obtuvo más clientes satisfechos. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado en gran medida.
texts.en:
Rafael needs to opt for a new loan to strengthen his business; this investment will help him to buy a belt, disks, and other items to ensure that the mill is in good condition and thus offer a better service to his customers. 

The previous loan helped him to improve his income and he obtained more satisfied customers. His financial conditions and family circumstances have improved to a great degree.

loans.use: to buy a belt and disks, among other items.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is an honest lady. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan and a responsible mother of four children. She  belongs to a poor family, and fulfills the family's needs despite so many challenges. 

Her husband is a cobbler.  He has a small shop in the cornor of the street market. He provides shoe making services in her community. He is a very hardworking and happy person.  Balqees has requested a Kiva loan to help her husband in purchasing rexine, leather and thread for mending shoes. She prays for the growth of her husband's work, as this is the only source of income for the family. She hopes that the loan amount will be helpful for her husband's work. 

She wants to provide a good education to her children, but because of lack of finances, she is unable to send her children to school. She is thankful to Kiva and the BRAC staff for their help.

loans.use: to purchase rexine, leather and thread for mending shoes.

loans.name: Rath's Group

texts.en: Rath, originally from Sang district of Battambang province, is 33 years old and a married mother blessed with seven children. The main sources of her family’s income are from paddy rice farming and a small income from her husband job as motor-taxi driver.  With this new loan, she is the second-time borrower and her co-borrower is the third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has fully repaid back, enabled her to support her business and uplift her lifestyle in a good pace. Now, she and her fellow group member are seeking for 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for plowing fee and labor cost. She hopes that she can gain a good yield and gain more income to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for plowing fee and labor cost

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal is a 34-year-old married father of two children. He has been working as a barber for 10 years. In 2008, he opened his own barber shop, and he developed it in a well-managed way. He dreams to renovate his barber shop and equip a salon with new equipment. 

Vusal is requesting a loan hardwood floors, vacuum insulated windows, wallpaper, paint, fiberglass and foam in order to renovate his old apartment. In this way Vusal hopes to improve the security and well-being of his family. By doing so his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where energy is preserved efficiently.

loans.use: To purchase vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass.

loans.name: Yoeurn's Group

texts.en:
A mother of five children residing in the Sampov Meas Ddistrict of Pursat Province, Yoeurn is 55 years old and a local farmer who plants rice, peanuts, and maize. This business, which she has had for 20 years, has returned her about 19,500 KHR per day. 

Now, Yoeurn is a leader of a group consisting of  four female members. She and  two other borrowers are the in their fifth loan cycle, whilst a remaining borrower is a second time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner.  She has fully repaid her past loan with success in stabilizing her business on a good path. Now, the total amount of her entire group loan is 5,400,000 KHR.

Yoeurn, whose loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR, will spend her loan portion to buy 15 sacks of fertilizer to support her business. She hopes to boost her crop yield timely and get a good income so that she can start up a small grocery store to supplement her income.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of fertilizer to support her business.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer De Mollepata Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE MOLLEPATA II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Mollepata, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zonia ella es soltera y tiene 38 años y tiene 2hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y aceite, la socia tiene un puesto en el mercado que es una tienda de abarrotes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

La socia que esta tapada su cara con un circulo ya no pertenece al banco comunal Nuevo Amanecer de Mollepata ii
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de crianza de ganados, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesanía.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The communal bank "NUEVO AMANECER DE MOLLEPATA II" is located in the district of Mollepata which belongs to the province of Anta in the department of Cusco.

Zonia, one of the members, is 38 years old, single and has two children.  She has a grocery stand in the market and sells staples such a rice, sugar, milk and oil.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and has been in business for a year, and things are going well for her.  Her goal is to expand the business.  She is requesting a loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

The member whose face is whited out no longer belongs to the communal bank.  The other members are involved in livestock farming, animal sales, grocery and crafts businesses.

The borrower is grateful to the lenders and committed to paying the loan back on time.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Khan

texts.en: Khan, 47, is local farmer from Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province. For her entire family, six hectares of rice farming and half hectare of bean planting are the main sources of income. It is the business that she has had for ages. Khan, a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), has fully repaid back her past loans wisely to sustain her business at a gradually pace. Now, she is seeking for a new loan of 2,500,000 KHR in order to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer and rice seed for her crops. She hopes to double her crop yield and get a good income in return.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crops

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng, 33, is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school and one still at home. The family lives in a village in Battambang province. For the past ten years Eng has farmed rice on six hectares of land.

This will be the second microloan for Eng through VisionFund, a Kiva partner. Her past loan has improved her life, especially in terms of keeping her children in school. This loan of 4,000,000 KHR will be used to buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for labor costs for her farmland. A portion of the loan will also be spent on buying piglets to raise and sell.

Eng hopes to triple the yield from her crops and so make more money. With it she can keep her children in school up to college level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Khorl's Group

texts.en: Khorl is 34 years old and married. She is a villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang where she plants her rice in order to support her family especially her three dependent kids. Besides this agribusiness, she also raises pigs for resale for additional income. This is the business that she has had for 10 years, earning about 27,900 KHR per day. This is not the first-time loan for Khorl with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back loan wisely to uplift her lifestyle in a good pace. Now, in a group of four, she is a leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for labor cost. She hopes to gain a good yield from cash-crop and gain a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Abubakr

texts.ru: Абубакр родился в 1995 года. Он воспитанный и добродушный молодой человек. В семье у них 6 человек. Он не женат. Абубакр в этом году окончил среднюю школу. Он учился в школе отлично и участвовал во всех мероприятиях школы. Абубакр после окончания школы поступил в Государственный Технологический Университет по специальности Мировой маркетинг. Он будет учиться на английском языке. Абубакр  должен оплатить за учебный договор. Его отец трудовой мигрант, а мать работает учительницей в средней школе. Они не в состоянии оплатить за учебный договор Абубакра. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abubakr was born in 1995.  He is a well-mannered and kind young man.  There are six people in his family.  He is not married.  Abubakr graduated from a secondary school this year.  He studied excellently in school and participated in all school events.  After finishing school, Abubakr was accepted to the State Technology University with a world marketing major.  He will be studying in English.  Abubakr has to pay for his university tuition.  His father is a migrant worker, and mother works as a teacher a secondary school.  They cannot pay for his tuition.  Abubakr is requesting this loan to pay for his university tuition.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 42 años, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de 26, 23, 19 y 15 años con quienes vive en su casa propia. Gloria se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco por las mañanas. Su labor empieza por las madrugadas dirigiéndose al puerto pesquero de su localidad a comprar su mercadería directamente de los pescadores mayoristas, luego los lleva a su puesto de ventas ubicado en un mercado muy concurrido. Se inició hace más de 3 años con un capital propio y viendo que era un trabajo fácil de realizar y de mucha demanda, decidió dedicarse completamente a desarrollarla y desde entonces ha mantenido constante su inversión inicial. Antes de iniciar su negocio, tenía problemas económicos ya que  se había separado del padre de sus hijos y con la necesidad de tener un ingreso económico decidió a empezar a vender. Viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, espera  ver crecer su negocio, aumentando su capital. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con sus planes, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará pescado al por mayor.
texts.en:
Gloria, 42, is a single mother and has four children, ages 26, 23, 19 and 15, who live with her in her own house.  She sells fresh fish for a living and her work day begins in the early hours in her town's fishing port.  She buys fish directly from the wholesale fishermen, and then sells it at her stand in the busy market.  Over three years ago she started her business with her own money; and seeing that it was an easy job with considerable demand, she decided to work full time developing her business.  Since then she has maintained her initial investment.

Before starting her business she had economic problems after divorcing her children's father and needed to earn an income.  Since she earns a good profit she wants to expand and increase her capital.  She is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN and is grateful for the opportunity of receiving financial support to develop her plan.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  The loan will be used to buy fish wholesale.

loans.use: To buy fish wholesale.

loans.name: El Gorrion Group

texts.es:
El señor Marciano es casado, de edad 35 años, de escolaridad primaria completa, tiene 3 hijos y los 3 estan estudiando, se dedica a la siembr de cardamomo, inició este negocio desde niño ayudando a sus padres en la diembra de cardamomo y hasta la fecha lleva 26 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la limpieza de cardamomo, desea en el futuro contar con mas cuerdas de terreno para poder sembrar cardamomo. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedicana a la siembra de cardamomo. En la fotografia aparecen 14 integrantes pero solo a 13 de ellos se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Marciano is married, is 35 years old, completed primary school and has three children, all of whom are studying. He makes a living by planting cardamom. He began working in this business as a child, helping his parents plant cardamom, and he has 26 years of experience so far. He also has the support of his wife.

Marciano has organized a group asking for a loan that will be utilized for cleaning cardamom. In the future he wants to have more acres of land to be able to plant cardamom. The other members of the group also make a living from planting cardamom. There are 14 members in the photograph but the loan was only given to 13 of them.

loans.use: to clean cardamom

loans.name: Dora Concepcion

texts.es:
Dora, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en el negocio de su tienda y para ofrecerle mayores productos a los clientes; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar productos de la canasta básica, tales como: frijoles, aceite, huevo, azúcar, condimentos, detergentes, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias ha podido  aportar a su familia, las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares  han mejorado.
texts.en:
Dora is in need of a new loan to use as work capital for her grocery store, as she wants to offer her customers more products.  This investment will help her buy staples such as beans, oil, eggs, sugar, condiments, detergents, etc.

She used the previous loan to strengthen her business.  Her profits have gone to the family so the household economic conditions have improved.

loans.use: To buy beans, oil, eggs, sugar, condiments, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Chou's Group

texts.en:
Chou, originally from the Sangke district of Battambang province, is sixty years old and a widower. He is a rice farmer who works hard to make a living for the sake of his family, especially his five children. He has farmed for the past ten years and when averaged, earns about 19,800 KHR per day.

Chou is new to VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. He is now forming a group of two to apply for a 1,000,000 KHR loan that will be divided between them. Chou will use his portion of the loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees. He hopes to gain a better yield than last year and so improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Nyota Group

texts.en:
Khadija is head of the Nyota loan group comprised of four members. She is in her early forties and divorced with three children. One child lives with her, and the two others are under their father's care. One of the children is in school.

For two years now Khadija has been managing two businesses, one a restaurant and the other, a shop selling beer, soft drinks, wine and other spirits. She has a few employees and works from 6:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. daily. She is able to make a good monthly profit.

Khadija is applying for a 4,000,000 TZS loan through Tujijenge Tanzania to be split among the group. Each member will hold the others accountable for paying back the loan. With her portion Khadija will restock her shop with more beer, soft drinks, wine and other spirits. She will also buy new chairs, tables, plates, bowls, etc. for her cafe.

Khadija dreams that one day she will be able to build a house.

loans.use: to restock her shop with more drinks and buy new equipment for her restaurant.

loans.name: Saoda's Group

texts.en: Saoda is a young mother of little kids. She tackles her daily cost of living via rice farming whereas her husband works for others for a fee during his spare time. This is the first loan for Saoda's group with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a good yield, better than before, and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es:
Jonathan vive en la ciudad de chincha, e sun joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo se encuentra estudiando en la universidad la carrera de Computación e informática, y para poder solventar sus gastos de estudios trabaja como chofer de una mototaxi, cada día Jonathan trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente y por las noches el va a su centro de estudios.

Jonathan está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le ha brindado el podrá realizar el mantenimiento de su vehículo, con lo cual podrá conducir en buenas condiciones y seguir trabajando para poder solventar sus estudios, ya que es su única fuente de ingresos, asi seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Jonathan lives in the city of Chincha.  He's a young man with a great desire to get ahead, so he's putting a lot of effort into his university program in computer science and information technology.

Jonathan drives a motorcycle taxi to pay for his studies.  He works about eight hours a day and can serve up to fifteen customers.  He goes to school at night.

Jonathan's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to perform maintenance on his vehicle.

This way he can have good driving conditions and continue working to pay for his studies with his only source of income.  He'll continue striving to make his biggest dream come true: to finish school and have his own house.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients for tamales

loans.name: Perla Massiel

texts.es:
Perla Massiel, es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar sus estudios universitarios, esta es su historia: Me llamo  Perla Massiel, tengo 18 años  de edad vivo en Licey –Santiago con mis padres, nací en Santiago, tengo dos hermanos más pequeños  siendo yo la mayor.
Mi padre trabaja como herrero  y mi madre en un centro de internet familiar, estudio el tercer ciclo de la carrera de medicina  en Utesa- Santiago, desde niña soñé con esta carrera, en mis juegos infantiles  yo siempre era la doctora y lo hacía con tanto entusiasmo que esa inspiración  me motivo a que mi bachillerato lo hiciera técnico en enfermería, como preámbulo a lo que hoy estudio.
También  he visto  la necesidad  de personas que mueren a mi alrededor  porque no tienen el dinero para pagar una clínica,  pero cuando yo me gradué   quiero apoyar a mi comunidad  y aportar a  mi región con mis conocimientos,  pero solo con la ayuda del programa kiva puedo lograrlo.
texts.en:
Perla Massiel is an 18-year-old medical student. She is applying for a loan so she can pay for her university studies. This is her story:

My name is  Perla Massiel. I'm 18 and live in Licey -Santiago with my parents. I was born in Santiago, have two younger brothers, and am the oldest child. 

My father works as a blacksmith and my mother works in a family internet center. I'm in the third semester of the medial program in Utesa- Santiago. I've dreamed of being a doctor since I was a a young girl. Playing with other children, I was always the doctor, and my enthusiasm for that role has remained an inspiration. It was my motivation to earn a bachelor's degree as a nurse technician in preparation for my medical studies.   

I've also seen the needs of people who have died around me because they lack money to pay for medical care. When I graduate, I want to support my community and make a contribution to the larger region through my knowledge and experience. But I can only do this with the support of Kiva's loan program.

loans.use: To pay university tuition.

loans.name: Samun's Group

texts.en: Samun, 63, is a married father of five children residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. He has five children. To deal with the daily cost of living, he does rice cropping and pineapple planting. To help the family generate more income, his wife sells dessert after helping him on the rice farm. He has been involved in his current business for ages, earning about 20,000 KHR per day. This is the third loan for Samun’s group, composed of three members, with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). His past loans, which he has fully repaid, have enabled him to upgrade his living at a good pace. Now he and his co-borrowers are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes that he can gain a good yield from his crop and make more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: Wallen

texts.en: Wallen is a thirty-year-old divorced man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For a year now he has been in the agricultural business and he also operates a retail shop in order to meet his daily family expenses. Good father that he is, he desires to educate his children, construct a permanent residential house, and venture into produce sales so as to raise more income for the family. Wallen intends to use the loan to buy coffee, maize and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee, maize and rice to sell.

loans.name: Monhzul

texts.en:
Mrs. Monhzul is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a 'ger', a traditional nomadic yurt, in Bulgan province of Mongolia. Her husband Enhbold works with his brother on a construction site, and her son Chimeddorj studies at local school. Daughter Anudari is 5 and goes to local kindergarten. 

Monhzul has been running a shoe retail business at a rental counter of the local market for more than a decade and has a lot of experience in the business. She imports shoes from Erlian, China, sells them at her counter, and pleases her regular customers with her tastefully chosen pairs of shoes. She is now requesting loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of shoes from Erlian, China to sell at her counter in the market. She is hardworking, welcoming and a positive woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of shoes from Erlian, China to sell at her counter in the market

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is single and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  Angie owns and operates a service-based business providing passenger services, which she has done for  years to make a living. Aside from this, she also runs her piggery, raising pigs for sale. Angie successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC that she used for her motorcycle renewal. Recently, she borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy piglets and livestock feed.

 In the future, Angie hopes to purchase an additional motorcycle and add another business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and livestock feed.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is married with three children who are in school. She is 37 years old and lives in Tambisan, San Juan, Siquijor. She sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for ten years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, shampoo, toothpaste and soft drinks. She has been a PMPC member for one year. In the future, Analyn hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, shampoo, toothpaste and soft drinks.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Teodora is a widow with five children who lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For years, she has owned and operated a farm, planting and harvesting rice to sell to earn a living. She joined Gata Daku MPC in 2009 and successfully repaid her previous loans, which she used to improve her farm. Recently, she  is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her farm in order to gain an abundant harvest in return. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee and maize to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is widowed with 8 children. Myrna is 52 years old and lives in Katipa, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.  

Myrna has a grocery store to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. Each month she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to pay for gallons of cooking oil, sacks of sugar, and assorted candies.

Myrna has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In the future, Myrna hopes to have another business which is to buy and sell RTW (ready-to-wear clothing).

loans.use: to pay for gallons of cooking oil, sacks of sugar, and assorted candies.

loans.name: Hiyam Group

texts.en:
Hiyam is a group of three Lebanese women. They acquired a loan from Kiva partner's Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends. 

Hiyam is the featured borrower of the group; she is the lady wearing red in the middle. Hiyam is a 56-year-old married mother of five children. She puts in so much effort to develop her business in order to provide better for her family's increasing needs.

Hiyam is a makeup artist.  She works from her house because at the beginning she wasn't financially capable of opening a separate place of business of her own. She specializes in tattoo and makeup work.  Her clients are increasing because of her special reputation and expertise after ten years in this field.

Today, Hiyam is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner's Al Majmoua to open a new shop selling clothes.  She will invest in a well-managed way in both businesses to develop them equally.

As for the other group members, Samia is the lady in blue at the left, and Joumana is the lady at the right.

loans.use: To open a new shop selling clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tourist tickets. (entrance to various attractions in the Cusco/Sacred Valley area)

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 53 years old and lives in Katipa, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines.   She is married, with six children. 

Jessie works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to  pay for more fishing materials. 

Jessie has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, she hopes someday to have professional children.

loans.use: to pay for fishing materials.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 38 años de edad, está casada con Richard quien es empleado y padre de sus 03 hermosos hijos de 17, 12 y 03 años de edad respectivamente. Actualmente está embarazada de su último bebé. Vive junto a toda su familia en su casa propia. Isabel se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños para todo tipo de acontecimiento. Realiza su trabajo desde su casa propia y es muy solicitada por los vecinos de la zona en la que vive principalmente por sus amigos y familiares ya que tiene un trato agradable cuando atiende a sus clientes. Realiza este trabajo desde hace 07 años y en todo este tiempo logró ser reconocida entre sus clientes quienes compran sus productos de manera continua. Por otro lado, comenta que se inició en éste negocio por el deseo de contar con un ingreso propio, sentirse independiente y no depender de los ingresos de su esposo, así como el poder apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800, comenta estar agradecida con la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para concretar sus planes, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de su mercadería como polos, blusas, prendas interiores, camisas y pantalones de diversas tallas y modelos para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Isabel, 38, is married to Richard who is employed and the father of her three beautiful children (17, 12, and 3 years old). Currently, she is pregnant with their fourth child. She lives with her family in their own house. 

Isabel earns a living by selling clothes for women, men, and children, for all occasions. She works from home and is sought after in the area where she lives, mostly by friends and family, and as a result, has pleasant interactions with her customers. She has been selling clothes for seven years and has a good reputation among clients who purchase from her regularly. Isabel says that she started this business in order to have her own income, to be independent, and to not have to rely on her husband's income, as well as to help him with household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan of S/.800, and says that she is grateful for the opportunity to have a line of credit to carry out her plans, and she is committed to repaying her loan on time. She will use the entire loan to purchase merchandise such as polo shirts, blouses, undergarments, shirts, and pants, in various sizes and styles for women, men, and children.

loans.use: to buy blouses, polo shirts, pants, and other items for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Mangadalena

texts.en:
Mangadalena is a 29-year-old married woman living in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been selling salt for twelve years, and she buys directly from the salt miners at the lake.  Salt's corrosive nature and limited funds affect her business growth, while her dream is to process the salt herself so as to add value and attract a higher price. 

Mangadalena intends to use the loan to buy salt to sell.   She also desires to educate her children up to the university.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married, with two children, and she  lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, with her family.  Her husband works as a private employee while she sells barbeque to make a living. She has been doing this for years to support the needs of her family. 

In 2012, she joined Gata Daku MPC, and she has successfully repaid her previous loans that she used to improve her living. She borrowed a new loan recently to buy raw ingredients and materials for barbeque vending. 

She is thankful to GDMPC for giving her access to micro-finance services.  That has enabled her to improve her ability to engage in business and also to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and materials for barbeque vending

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 30 years old and married, with two children, who are six and two years old.  The family lives in a rural setting.

Andrew is a farmer who raises passion fruit and cabbages. He has been in this business for three years. He started it with the aim of improving his family's standard of living through selling these goods.

He has acquired this loan in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his cabbage and passion fruit plantations. He usually sells his products to local traders in villages.  His hope is to have a large plantation that can yield large volumes such that he can sell to the city traders.

His main challenge is dry seasons, which tend to hurt his crops.  He describes himself as a hard-working man.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his passion fruit and cabbages

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio is 62 years old and lives in Katipa, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is married with nine children. 

Dionesio has a bamboo weaving business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to pay for bamboo trees.

Dionesio is just a new member of PMPC. In the future, he hopes to have more savings for his family's future.

loans.use: to pay for bamboo trees.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 27 years old and lives in Barra Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is still single. 

Danilo works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. He has been doing this for five years. He has requested a loan to pay for fishing materials.

Danilo has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, he hopes to have enough savings to acquire another pump boat to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for fishing materials.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
This is Marina, 48, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Armando, a security guard, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. She also sells fruits for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Marina hopes to have a big grocery store someday and dreams of a good future for her children.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man aged forty years with six children. He lives on the outskirts of Kyotera town with his family. His children are seventeen, sixteen, thirteen, ten, seven and three years old. He also takes care of his nephew who lost his parents.

Charles is a farmer who deals in coffee, passion fruit and banana growing. He also takes of animal rearing but on a small scale. He works seven days each week and each day he works for twelve hours. Charles supplements his family income with a produce business which he does seasonally. 

Charles has been in this business since 1997 and he started it for survival in order to earn income. He has acquired this loan so that he can buy fertilizer and insecticides for treating his crops so that they can have high yields. He sells his agricultural products to fellow traders nearby. However, he faces the challenge of dry seasons which leads to low production. He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta is widowed with six children. She is 65 years old and lives in Puntod, Plaridel,  Misamis Occidental.

Modesta has a grocery store to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to  pay for gallons of cooking oil, sacks of sugar, assorted candies and biscuits.

Modesta has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  In the future, Modesta hopes to have more savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to pay for gallons of cooking oil, sacks of sugar, assorted candies and biscuits

loans.name: Paula Janet

texts.es:
La señora Paula  se dedica arduamente a la labor de maestro de secundaria de un colegio de la localidad, con 18  años de laborar, es soltera, tiene 2  hijos a su cargo la cual le está brindando  todo el apoyo para que se prepare académica mente.

Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Paula atraviesa, es de  mejorar su vivienda  Por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de cemento, bloques, perlines, hierro, zinc y pago de mano de obra y mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Paula works hard as a secondary school teacher at the local school and has been working there for 18 years. She is single and responsible for two children, to whom she is offering every support so that they can complete their education.

One of the needs that Paula is experiencing is that of improving her home, so she has made the decision to approach Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy cement, cement blocks, purlins, rebar, sheet metal roofing and pay for labor. This will enable her to improve her living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: To buy cement, cement blocks, purlins, rebar, sheet metal roofing and pay for labor.

loans.name: Galib

texts.en: Galib is a 41-year-old married man. He is a father with three children: two sons and one daughter. For the past seven years, Galib has been working in a shop selling car spare parts. It is a profitable business and he has a good experience in this field, which makes him a well-known person in his city. The loan he has applied for will help him to buy more spare parts for his workshop, which will improve his business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is an active 40-year-old woman with two sons and two daughters.  Her husband is a farmer while her son is working in a mechanic's shop. 

Sajida has excellent embroidery skills so she provides embroidery services in her community. She is running this business to contribute some amount to the family income and to keep herself busy as she does not like  to waste her skills and precious time by sitting idle at home. Her business is successful and the demand for her embroidery products is increasing day by day. 

Sajida has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase fabric and packs of thread of various colors and a variety of beads and laces for her work. A Kiva loan would be helpful for her to continue her work by purchasing important embroidery materials. She is feeling happy after taking out her loan.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and packs of thread of various colors and a variety of beads and laces for her work.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a single enterprising young man, twenty-four years old. He lives in Kyotera town and he is a health worker.

Julius has been in this job for three years where he earns a salary as income. He works six days a week and each day he works for fourteen hours. He offers his services to residents of Kyotera town and those from nearby rural villages. He has acquired this loan in order to complete payment on his plot;  he had deposited half payment on it. He hopes to build his first home on said land. 

Julius's dream is to acquire a large farm as an asset. He faces the challenges of stress and working for long hours. He describes himself as a hard-working man. In the photograph is Julius and the Ugafode credit officer (right to left.)

loans.use: To complete payment on a piece of land

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
This is Nena. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy the grocery items and products needed for her variety store. Her income from the business assisted her children's education as well as their household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan  to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nena dreams of being more successful in business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and son in Vanadzor city, which is in the Lori region of Armenia. 

Flora is engaged in the kids’ clothes business in a rented stall in the Vanadzor trading market. She sells a large variety of baby clothes, bedding and covers, towels, toys and shoes. She brings all the needed products from Yerevan's wholesale markets in a rented car once or twice a month. 

She has been in this business for five years.  Her stall is well known among the citizens, who are satisfied with the great assortment of products and the quality of service of Flora’s stall.

Flora asks a loan of 250,000 Armenian drams to buy a new collection of infants' covers and bedding.  These are highly demanded among her customers.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of infants' covers and bedding

loans.name: Sefer

texts.en:
Sefer wants to thank all Kiva lenders for the previous loan, which has helped him to buy the necessary materials to complete orders that customers have for his shoe repair workshop. With the previous loan, he had the opportunity to increase his business’ profit and has been very satisfied with the manner in which his business has expanded and grown, improving his family's quality of life.

Now he is requesting a second loan for the same business in order to purchase a new work table, working stock and other materials. 

He plans to continue his business in the future, as his goal is to provide a secure life for his family. Sefer again would like to thank all of the Kiva lenders for their second support!

loans.use: to purchase a new work table, working stock and other materials.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is very thankful for the financial assistance given to her. She used the money in buying balut (fertilized duck eggs) and crackers for her business. Her income from her business assisted with her children's education and their household expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 45,000 PHP loan to purchase stock of balut (fertilized duck eggs) and crackers needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Zenaida dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for stock of balut (fertilized duck eggs) and crackers needed in her business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is married with two children. She is 35 years old and lives in Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Vilma is a businesswoman and has a fishpond for shrimp and crab production to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan in the amount of Php. 12,000 to finance  shrimp and crab production. 

Vilma has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Vilma hopes to improve their living conditions by using the profits from the business and to build more fishponds for her shrimp and crab production business.

loans.use: to finance shrimp and crab production

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is 25 years old and he is a single businessman and owns a butchery business which he has been operating for three years. He started the business from small savings that he had made. He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is seasonal demand. Said is applying for a loan of 41,850 KES to buy meat to sell in his butcher shop. The extra income resulting from the loan will be added to his savings. His dream is to see his business grow and to start buying his own cows.

loans.use: To buy meat to sell in his butcher shop

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en: Hakim is a fifty-five-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in agriculture for thirteen years but also does  fishing to earn additional income. He mainly grows sunflowers and the business has been very lucrative since there is a ready market. Unpredictable weather changes especially prolonged drought and also wild animals are his major challenges while his dream is to venture into mechanized farming. Hakim intends to use the loan to pay for labor.

loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is aged 32 and married with two children; only one attends school. He is a peasant farmer mainly growing sugarcane for local gin brewing as his major source of earning, a business he has been doing for the last nine years.

John approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX 600,000  to hire a machine for squeezing his sugarcane in order to brew local gin, a popular delicacy in the area. John hopes to use the proceeds from the 'waragi' to complete construction of his house.

The major challenge John faces is the price fluctuation for 'waragi' as well as the cost of hiring the machine and he would like to buy his own in the near future except that he is still limited by capital. In the photo is John (left) with the Ugafode credit officer at John's incomplete house, which he hopes to complete with the income from his business.

loans.use: To hire a machine for sueezing sugar canes

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme ROKIA debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 55.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of this group called Benkadi IV are married women with an average age of 42 and on average, six children. They all live in polygamous families in Korobarrage, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution and their prior loans were correctly reimbursed. 

Madame Rokia, standing first from left to right in the photo, cultivates maize. With her loan she intends to pay for plowing and buy seeds and fertilizer to maintain one half hectare. The produce is sold right in the village and in Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 55,000 francs CFA per season. This profit will permit her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenditures.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
La señora Juana Marina, de estado civil casada, tiene 44 años de edad, de escolaridad 3ro. primaria, tiene 2 hijos que no estudian, se dedica a la compra y venta de rpa típica, inició este negocio por la necesidad de general ingresos económicos para ayudar con los gastos de la familia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para vender como: guipiles, cortes, delantales, perrajes, fajas, etc. Desea en el futuro contar con más capital para poder comprar mas mercadería y asi obtener mejores ganancias. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales domésticos. Una de las integrantes no pudo asistir cuando tomaron la foto.
texts.en:
Juana Marina, age 44, is married.  She has a third grade education.  She has two children who do not go to school.  She buys and sells typical clothing.  She started this business out of the need to generate income to help with the family expenses.

She organized a group and is requesting a loan.  She will use the loan to buy clothes like blouses, skirts, aprons, shawls, and woven belts, etc.  In the future she wishes to count on more capital in order to be able to buy more merchandise.  This way she will get better earnings.

The other members of the group work in commerce and raising domestic animals.  One of the members was not able to attend when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy and sell typical clothing.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia lives in Kasese, Uganda and is a twenty-eight-year-old single mother of one child. She has been selling clothes for six years, but also does farming to earn extra income. 

A good mother that she is, she desires to educate her child up to the university. Ever-changing customer preferences and trends, coupled with inadequate capital, pose a challenge to her business growth. Her dream is to own a boutique.

Sylivia intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 34 years old, and she is married with four children. She lives in Baybay, Bonifacio, in the Misamis Occidental province of the Philippines.

Lolita is a farmer and she has been growing rice to earn a living for eight years. She has requested a loan amount of 14,000.00 Philippine pesos to buy fertilizer for her rice fields.

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living condition by becoming the rice distributor for the entire municipality.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice fields.

loans.name: Balcon Florido Group

texts.es: El grupo “BALCON FLORIDO” se encuentra conformado por 05 integrantes quienes se encuentran pasando el 14 ciclo. Rosa en el grupo cumple la función de presidenta quien fue elegida por los socios del grupo. Rosa tiene 53 años es casada.  Hace 35 años se dedica a la agricultura juntamente con su esposo y a la vez a la ganadería. Las frutas que producen las distribuyen a los mercados grandes el queso y la leche que obtiene de las vacas que cría las vende a sus vecinos. La  actividad de ganadería y agricultura lo aprendió de sus padres. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y comida para sus animales. Su mayor deseo es terminar de construir su vivienda. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Rosa es la primera del lado derecho.
texts.en:
The “Balcón Florido" group is made up of five members who are in their 14th loan cycle. Rose fulfills the function of chairperson for the group and was selected by the members. Rosa is 53 years old and married. Together with her husband she has farmed for 35 years, raising livestock at the same time.

They distribute the fruit they produce at large markets. She sells the cheese and milk she gets from the cows to the neighbors. She learned the activity of livestock-raising and farming from her parents. 

She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and feed for her animals. Her greatest desire is to finish building her home. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan. Rosa is the first one on the right.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta 9º grado, esta casado, su esposa se dedica al que hacer de  la casa, tiene tres hijos  de 19, 17 y 15 años de edad, 2 de ellos estudian, aparte de su esposa y sus hijos, viven con él su cuñada y el bebe de ella.

Él  trabaja como mecánico en enderezado y pintura, este oficio lo aprendió, por necesidad, ya que sus padres no alcanzaban a cubrir los gastos de la casa, y esto provocaba que por días, no tenían nada que comer, así fue que él, se acerco a un taller de mecánica, como aprendiz, y poco a poco fue aprendiendo este trabajo. Actualmente, tiene 30 años de estar desempeñándose, como mecánico en enderezo y pintura, se moviliza en bicicleta hasta el taller, el cual esta a una distancia de 4 km de su casa, y trabaja de 7 am a 5 pm.


Con el préstamo comprara un nuevo compresor, el cual, es de gran utilidad en su trabajo; puesto que sin el, no tiene como pintar los vehículos que repara, y por ende no terminaría los trabajos, y esto conlleva a que no tenga ingresos, para mantener a su familia, también le provoca inconformidad a sus clientes, por que los vehículos, no son reparados en un tiempo prudente. Pero ahora podrá seguir con su trabajo, gracias al préstamo facilitado.

El sueño que tiene para sus hijos, es verlos preparados profesionalmente, para que puedan enfrentarse al futuro y que no sufran, lo que el vivió. En cuanto a su trabajo, quisiera instalar un gran taller, de servicios automotrices varios, pero reconoce que es necesario que se esfuerce el doble, de lo que hasta hoy, lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 45 years old. He went to school up to the 9th grade. He is married, and his wife dedicates herself to the needs of the household. He has three children, aged 19, 17 and 15, of whom two are in school. In addition to his wife and children, his sister-in-law and her baby also live with him. 

He works as a mechanic in body work and painting. He learned this profession out of necessity, since his parents were not able to cover the household expenses, and for this reason they sometimes went for days without anything to eat. Thus he went to a mechanic's workshop and became an apprentice, and little by little he learned this trade. Currently, he has 30 years of experience as a mechanic in body work and painting. He travels on a bicycle to the workshop, which is 4 kilometers from his house, and he works from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m.

With the loan, he will buy a new compressor, which will be greatly useful in his work. Without one, he is unable to paint the vehicles he repairs; thus, he cannot finish the jobs himself and does not have that income to support his family. It is also inconvenient for his customers, because the vehicles are not repaired within a reasonable time. However, now he will be able to continue his work, thanks to the loan provided to him. 

His dream for his children is to see them gain professional training, so that they can face the future and not suffer through what he experienced. With regard to his work, he would like to set up a large workshop offering a range of automotive services, but he recognizes that for this he will have to work twice as hard as he has done up to now.

loans.use: to buy a new compressor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials: cement, sand, gravel, and brick panels.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
This is Elsie, a 55-year-old woman living in Intramuros, Manila, in the Philippines. Her husband, Ermilando works as a potter. Together they have a child, manage their household, and operate their business. Elsie works hard to provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Elsie sells load wallets, electronic loads, and SIM cards for mobile phones, as well as frozen and processed products. Her store is adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns at least 900 Philippine pesos from sales every day.

Elsie is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy load wallets and SIM cards for mobile phones to sell in her store. She dreams that her business will continue to expand and hopes that her son will finish his studies. She meets up with her fellowship members every week to share stories of their work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy load wallets and SIM cards for mobile phones to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jean Carlos Oscar

texts.es: Jean Carlos  de 29 años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es una agradable estudiante de la facultad de ingeniería civil, estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas propuestas.  Jean Carlos  tiene la meta de culminar sus estudios con éxitos y poder ser un buen ingeniero civil. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de sus pensiones universitarias  y  realizar la compra  de útiles de estudio que necesita. Jean Carlos   se encuentra muy agradecido  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a  kiva por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Jean Carlos, 29, is single and has no children.  He's a nice student in the College of Civil Engineering who studies a lot to reach his objectives.  Jean Carlos's goal is to finish his studies successfully and be able to be a good civil engineer.

With the loan granted he'll pay for his university housing and buy the study supplies he needs.

Jean Carlos is very grateful to Kiva for the help, and signs off with a desire to achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to pay for his housing and to buy study supplies

loans.name: Tunka Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento TUNKA,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos  varones,   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Aurora,  tiene 57 años, tiene cinco hijos ya independientes  ella se dedica  a la elaboración y  venta de queso el vive en la zona de Villa Concepción,   la Sra. Aurora utilizara este préstamo para la compra  de leche por cantidad para la elaboración de queso y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero  para la compra ya que esto le beneficiara de gran manera  para así de esta manera producir más quesos y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, la Sra. Aurora enfrenta retos en su negocio ya que en algunos casos es la escasez de leche que no le permite la producción de quesos por este motivo solicito el crédito, la Sra. Aurora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le dan en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Tunka Communal Bank is made up of eight members, six women and two men.

The president of the bank is Aurora, 57.  She lives in the Villa Concepción area and has five adult children.  She earns a living making and selling cheese.

Aurora will use this loan to buy milk wholesale to make cheese.  She wants to make the most of this opportunity.  She's requesting this loan because she doesn't have the money.  It will benefit her greatly because she can produce more cheese and increase her income.

Sometimes Aurora faces challenges in her business.  The scarcity of milk, for example, prevents her from making cheese.  This is why she requested the loan.

Aurora's happy for the opportunity of being granted the loan.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is married and lives in Cagay-anon, Sinacaban, with her family. Her husband is a fisherman, which is their main source of income, and she also runs a general store to help make a living. 

Cornelia already successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC, which she used to improve her store. Now she is requesting a new loan that she will use to purchase seafood to sell in her store. With the additional revenue that this purchase will generate, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seafood to sell in her store.

loans.name: Muhidin

texts.en:
Muhidin runs a small stall which sells computer accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Muhidin lives in Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Muhidin is married and living with four persons in the family home. 

Muhidin began working with Ruma two months ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last month he has had around $28-$30 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Gen

texts.en: Gen lives with her family in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is raising two children who still need her support. She operates a general store, selling grocery items to make a living, and has been in this business for a year. Gen joined Gata Daku MPC to gain access to micro finance opportunities. She borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy rice, corn grits, and livestock feed to sell in her store. She wants to improve her business so that in the future she will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn grits and livestock feed to sell.

loans.name: Kadenge

texts.en: Kadenge is 35 years old, married and a father of two children. For the past five years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town, from which he earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his second loan, in the amount of KES 30,000. He is going to use the loan to service and repair his motorcycle and purchase additional spare parts. He will use the profits to pay school fees for his children and invest back into his business, as well as to continue looking after his family. His goal for the future is to continue growing his businesses, so that he can improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to repair and service his motorcycle

loans.name: Suvdanchimeg

texts.en:
Suvdanchimeg is a student at a private university who is studying to earn a bachelor's degree. She is the first person in her family to pursue a university degree, and she lives with her brother and parents who own a private business. 

Her dream is to become a lawyer and she needs to study for three more years to finish her university degree. Suvdanchumeg is a hardworking student and is fulfilled by her dreams. She is so grateful to the Kiva organization because without this loan, she would have to miss a year of school.

loans.use: to pay tuition at her university.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is married with four children and  lives in Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a retired AFP, and she manages a motor transportation rental and service to make a living. For five years, she has successfully managed her business. Recently, she joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan of 8,000 PHP to  cover the costs of vehicle maintenance and repairs. She wants to buy another vehicle to expand her business.

loans.use: to cover the costs of vehicle maintenance and repairs
